original: las len pa gang da ltar yang sdug bsngal la ma 'ongs pa na yang rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal ba de yang de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: las len pa gang da ltar yang sdug bsngal la ma 'ongs pa na yang rnam par smin pa sdug bsngal ba de yang de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata knows the karma that is painful now and will ripen in the future as pain.

original: las len pa gang da ltar yang bde la ma 'ongs pa na yang rnam par smin pa bde ba de yang de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: las len pa gang da ltar yang bde la ma 'ongs pa na yang rnam par smin pa bde ba de yang de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata knows the karma that is pleasant now and will ripen in the future as pleasure.

original: 'di ltar @86b sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: 'di ltar @86b sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar gyi dus na sems can thams cad kyi las gang dang / rgyu gang dang / rnam par smin pa gang de bzhin dang / de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa dang / gzhan ma yin par bsten pa de yang de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar gyi dus na sems can thams cad kyi las gang dang / rgyu gang dang / rnam par smin pa gang de bzhin dang / de bzhin nyid dang / gzhan ma yin pa dang / gzhan ma yin par bsten pa de yang de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: the Tathāgata knows the karma of all beings in the past, future, and present, what it is, its cause, and its ripening, just as it is, just as it is, not otherwise, not not otherwise.

original: mkhyen nas kyang de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas chos ston to; ;de ltar na /
analyzed: mkhyen nas kyang de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas chos ston to; ;de ltar na /
translated: Knowing it, he teaches the Dharma just as it is.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar gyi las len pa'i rgyu gang yin pa dang / gnas gang yin pa dang / rnam par smin pa mkhyen pa gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyis 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar gyi las len pa'i rgyu gang yin pa dang / gnas gang yin pa dang / rnam par smin pa mkhyen pa gang yin pa de ni /
translated: The Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One knows the causes, the bases, and the ripening of actions that are past, future, and present.

original: mtha' yas mu med do //
analyzed: mtha' yas mu med do //
translated: They are limitless and boundless.

original: 'di lta ste /🔽dper na / sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / dper na / sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: It is like this:🔽Śāriputra,

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas mu med pa de bzhin du sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas mu med pa de bzhin du sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: just as space is limitless and boundless, in the same way, Śāriputra,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i las kyi rnam par smin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs de yang mtha' yas mu med do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i las kyi rnam par smin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs de yang mtha' yas mu med do //
translated: the Tathāgata’s power of knowing the ripening of actions is limitless and boundless.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: gang de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyi mtha' 'dod pa de ni /
analyzed: gang de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi las kyi rnam par smin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyi mtha' 'dod pa de ni /
translated: one who seeks the limit of the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Awakened One’s power of knowing the ripening of actions

original: nam mkha'i mtha' 'dod do //
analyzed: nam mkha'i mtha' 'dod do //
translated: seeks the limit of space.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa'i las rnam par smin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs bsam gyis mi khyab pa de thos nas mngon par dad /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa'i las rnam par smin pa mkhyen pa'i stobs bsam gyis mi khyab pa de thos nas mngon par dad /
translated: The bodhisattvas, having heard this inconceivable power of the Tathāgata’s knowledge of the ripening of karma, will have faith in it,

original: yid ches / rab tu rtog /🔽som @87a *// nyi med /
analyzed: yid ches / rab tu rtog / som @87a *// nyi med /
translated: will have conviction in it,🔽will have certainty about it,

original: the tshom mi za /
analyzed: the tshom mi za /
translated: will not doubt it,

original: rgya cher dga' mgu ste rangs pa rnyed na nam mkha' lta bur bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir ngo mtshar dang / rmad du 'du shes bskyed do //🔽'di la chos nyid ni /
analyzed: rgya cher dga' mgu ste rangs pa rnyed na nam mkha' lta bur bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir ngo mtshar dang / rmad du 'du shes bskyed do // 'di la chos nyid ni /
translated: and will be very happy, joyful, and delighted. They will think of it as inconceivable, like space, and will develop a sense of wonder and amazement.

original: 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di yin te /
translated: This is the nature of things:

original: de la 'di skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces bya'o //
translated: This is what it says:

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rgyu dang smin la mkhas //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rgyu dang smin la mkhas //
translated: The Tathāgata is skilled in causes and results.🔽The one with eyes knows the accomplishment of all actions.

original: spyan ldan las rnams kun gyi sgrub pa mkhyen; ;dus gsum la ni rgyal ba chags pa med //
analyzed: spyan ldan las rnams kun gyi sgrub pa mkhyen; ;dus gsum la ni rgyal ba chags pa med //
translated: The Victorious One is unattached to the three times.

original: sems can kun gyi spyod pa rab tu mkhyen //
analyzed: sems can kun gyi spyod pa rab tu mkhyen //
translated: He knows the conduct of all sentient beings.🔽He knows the causes of happiness and suffering

original: 'gro ba lnga yi sems can thams cad kyi //
analyzed: 'gro ba lnga yi sems can thams cad kyi //
translated: For all sentient beings in the five destinies,

original: bde dang sdug bsngal rgyu ni gang 'gyur dang // 'jug pa gang dag sdug bsngal rgyur 'gyur ba //
analyzed: bde dang sdug bsngal rgyu ni gang 'gyur dang // 'jug pa gang dag sdug bsngal rgyur 'gyur ba //
translated: And what causes them to engage in suffering.

original: de dag de bzhin bde gshegs rab tu mkhyen //
analyzed: de dag de bzhin bde gshegs rab tu mkhyen //
translated: The Sugata knows them all.🔽The Sugata knows the ripening of good and bad karma,

original: dkar nag las rnams kyi ni rnam smin dang // rgyu dang rnam smin ji ltar 'gyur ba yang //
analyzed: dkar nag las rnams kyi ni rnam smin dang // rgyu dang rnam smin ji ltar 'gyur ba yang //
translated: The causes and the ripening,

original: de dag de bzhin bde gshegs rab mkhyen te //
analyzed: de dag de bzhin bde gshegs rab mkhyen te //
translated: And the Sugata knows them all.

original: phyag gi mthil na yid bzhin nor bu bzhin //
analyzed: phyag gi mthil na yid bzhin nor bu bzhin //
translated: They are like wish-fulfilling gems in the palm of the hand.

original: las gang rnam smin chung ngu'i rgyu dag las //
analyzed: las gang rnam smin chung ngu'i rgyu dag las //
translated: The Sugata knows the causes of small ripening🔽And the limitless results that arise from them,

original: 'bras bu dag ni tshad med 'byin pa dang // tshad med gang dag chung ngu'i rgyur 'gyur ba //
analyzed: 'bras bu dag ni tshad med 'byin pa dang // tshad med gang dag chung ngu'i rgyur 'gyur ba //
translated: And the limitless causes that are small,🔽And the Sugata knows them all.

original: de dag de bzhin bde gshegs rab tu mkhyen //
analyzed: de dag de bzhin bde gshegs rab tu mkhyen //
translated: The Sugata knows without exception🔽The causes that ripen into the result of being a śrāvaka,🔽The causes that become the enlightenment of a pratyekabuddha,

original: nyan thos nyid du 'bras bu smin 'gyur dang // rang rgyal byang chub rgyur ni gang 'gyur dang // bla med ye shes stobs ni sbyin 'gyur ba //
analyzed: nyan thos nyid du 'bras bu smin 'gyur dang // rang rgyal byang chub rgyur ni gang 'gyur dang // bla med ye shes stobs ni sbyin 'gyur ba //
translated: And the causes that give rise to the strength of unsurpassed wisdom.

original: de dag ma lus bde gshegs @87b rab tu mkhyen //
analyzed: de dag ma lus bde gshegs @87b rab tu mkhyen //
translated: The Sugata knows them all.

original: las kyi rgyu gang sdug bsngal smin byed pa //
analyzed: las kyi rgyu gang sdug bsngal smin byed pa //
translated: The Sugata knows the causes of karma that ripen as suffering,

original: de yang bde ba'i 'bras bu smin byed dang // las kyi rgyu gang bde ba sbyin byed pa //
analyzed: de yang bde ba'i 'bras bu smin byed dang // las kyi rgyu gang bde ba sbyin byed pa //
translated: The cause of happiness is the ripening of happiness,

original: sdug bsngal 'bras bu bya ba thams cad mkhyen //
analyzed: sdug bsngal 'bras bu bya ba thams cad mkhyen //
translated: And the cause of suffering is the ripening of suffering.🔽The cause of happiness is the ripening of happiness,🔽And the cause of suffering is the ripening of suffering.🔽The cause of happiness is the ripening of happiness,🔽And the cause of suffering is the ripening of suffering.🔽The cause of happiness is the ripening of happiness,

original: sdug bsngal rgyus ni sdug bsngal nyid gnas dang // bde ba'i rgyus kyang bde ba nyid gnas dang // las kyi rang bzhin rang bzhin ma yin pa //
analyzed: sdug bsngal rgyus ni sdug bsngal nyid gnas dang // bde ba'i rgyus kyang bde ba nyid gnas dang // las kyi rang bzhin rang bzhin ma yin pa //
translated: And the cause of suffering is the ripening of suffering.

original: rgyu ldan bde bar gshegs pas rab tu mkhyen //
analyzed: rgyu ldan bde bar gshegs pas rab tu mkhyen //
translated: The cause of happiness is the ripening of happiness,🔽And the cause of suffering is the ripening of suffering.

original: 'gro ba lnga yi sems can thams cad kyi //
analyzed: 'gro ba lnga yi sems can thams cad kyi //
translated: The cause of happiness is the ripening of happiness,🔽And the cause of suffering is the ripening of suffering.🔽The cause of happiness is the ripening of happiness,

original: dus gsum sdug bsngal bgrod pa gang 'jug pa //🔽nyams med de nyid de bzhin gzhan min par //
analyzed: dus gsum sdug bsngal bgrod pa gang 'jug pa // nyams med de nyid de bzhin gzhan min par //
translated: And the cause of suffering is the ripening of suffering.

original: sangs rgyas mkhyen pas rgyal ba rab tu mkhyen //
analyzed: sangs rgyas mkhyen pas rgyal ba rab tu mkhyen //
translated: The cause of happiness is the ripening of happiness,🔽And the cause of suffering is the ripening of suffering.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: The cause of happiness is the ripening of happiness,🔽And the cause of suffering is the ripening of suffering.🔽The cause of happiness is the ripening of happiness,

original: 'di ni / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs gnyis pa ste /
translated: And the cause of suffering is the ripening of suffering.

original: stobs de dang ldan pas /
analyzed: stobs de dang ldan pas /
translated: The cause of happiness is the ripening of happiness,🔽And the cause of suffering is the ripening of suffering.🔽The cause of happiness is the ripening of happiness,🔽And the cause of suffering is the ripening of suffering.🔽The cause of happiness is the ripening of happiness,🔽And the cause of suffering is the ripening of suffering.🔽The cause of happiness is the ripening of happiness,🔽And the cause of suffering is the ripening of suffering.🔽The cause of happiness is the ripening of happiness,🔽And the cause of suffering is the ripening of suffering.🔽The cause of happiness is the ripening of happiness,🔽And the cause of suffering is the ripening of suffering.🔽The cause of happiness is the ripening of happiness,🔽And the cause of suffering is the ripening of suffering.🔽The cause of happiness is the ripening of happiness,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'khor gyi nang du sengge'i sgra yang dag par sgrog cing /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'khor gyi nang du sengge'i sgra yang dag par sgrog cing /
translated: And the cause of suffering is the ripening of suffering.

original: dge sbyong ngam /
analyzed: dge sbyong ngam /
translated: a monk,

original: bram ze'am / lha'am /
analyzed: bram ze'am / lha'am /
translated: a brahmin,

original: bdud dam; tshangs pa gang gis kyang 'jig rten 'dir chos dang mthun par ma bskor ba tshangs pa'i 'khor lo rab tu bskor ro ////🔽bam po lnga pa /
analyzed: bdud dam; tshangs pa gang gis kyang 'jig rten 'dir chos dang mthun par ma bskor ba tshangs pa'i 'khor lo rab tu bskor ro //// bam po lnga pa /
translated: a god, a demon, or a Brahmā, the Tathāgata turns the holy wheel of the Dharma in the world, which has never been turned in accordance with the Dharma by any mendicant, brahmin, god, demon, or Brahmā.”🔽“Moreover, Śāriputra, by the power of the Tathāgata’s knowledge of the various dhātus and of the world, he knows the various dhātus and the world as they are.🔽He knows the various dhātus and the world as they are in their specific modes.🔽He knows the various dhātus and the world as they are in their specific characteristics.🔽He knows the various dhātus and the world as they are in their specific natures.

original: gzhan yang sh'a ri'i bu; de bzhin gshegs pas mos pa du ma dang / mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis sems can gzhan rnams dang / gang zag gzhan dag gi mos pa du @88a *//
analyzed: gzhan yang sh'a ri'i bu; de bzhin gshegs pas mos pa du ma dang / mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis sems can gzhan rnams dang / gang zag gzhan dag gi mos pa du @88a *//
translated: He knows the various dhātus and the world as they are in their specific bases.🔽He knows the various dhātus and the world as they are in their specific bases of arising.🔽He knows the various dhātus and the world as they are in their specific bases of cessation.🔽He knows the various dhātus and the world as they are in their specific bases of purification.🔽He knows the various dhātus and the world as they are in their specific bases of non-purification.

original: ma dang / mos pa sna tshogs rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //🔽skyes bu gang zag gang 'dod chags la gnas shing zhe sdang la mos pa'ang rgyas par bya ste /
analyzed: ma dang / mos pa sna tshogs rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to // skyes bu gang zag gang 'dod chags la gnas shing zhe sdang la mos pa'ang rgyas par bya ste /
translated: He knows the various dhātus and the world as they are in their specific bases of purification and non-purification.🔽He knows the various dhātus and the world as they are in their specific bases of the path.🔽He knows the various dhātus and the world as they are in their specific bases of the non-path.

original: gti mug la gnas shing zhe sdang la mos pa de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: gti mug la gnas shing zhe sdang la mos pa de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows the various dhātus and the world as they are in their specific bases of the path and the non-path.🔽He knows the various dhātus and the world as they are in their specific bases of the worldly.🔽He knows the various dhātus and the world as they are in their specific bases of the supramundane.🔽He knows the various dhātus and the world as they are in their specific bases of the worldly and the supramundane.🔽He knows the various dhātus and the world as they are in their specific bases of the conditioned.🔽He knows the various dhātus and the world as they are in their specific bases of the unconditioned.🔽He knows the various dhātus and the world as they are in their specific bases

original: gang zag gang mi dge ba la gnas shing mi dge ba la mos pa de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: gang zag gang mi dge ba la gnas shing mi dge ba la mos pa de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata knows those persons who are established in non-virtue and are inclined towards non-virtue.🔽The Tathāgata knows those persons who are established in virtue and are inclined towards virtue.🔽The Tathāgata knows those persons who are inclined towards the vast, though their application is inferior.

original: gang zag gang dge ba la gnas shing dge ba la mos pa de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: gang zag gang dge ba la gnas shing dge ba la mos pa de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata knows those persons who are inclined towards the inferior, though their application is vast.🔽The Tathāgata knows those persons who are inclined towards the inferior, though their application is vast.

original: gang zag gang sbyor ba dman zhing rgya chen po la mos pa de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: gang zag gang sbyor ba dman zhing rgya chen po la mos pa de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata knows those persons who are inclined towards the vast, though their application is inferior.🔽The Tathāgata knows those persons who are inclined towards the inferior, though their application is inferior.🔽The Tathāgata knows those persons who are inclined towards the vast, though their application is vast.🔽The Tathāgata knows those persons who are inclined towards the inferior, though their application is vast.🔽The Tathāgata knows those persons who are inclined towards the vast, though their application is inferior.🔽The Tathāgata knows those persons who are inclined towards the inferior, though their application is inferior.🔽The Tathāgata knows those persons who are inclined towards the vast, though their application is vast.🔽The Tathāgata knows those persons who are inclined towards the inferior, though their application is vast.🔽The Tathāgata knows those persons who are inclined towards the vast, though their application is inferior.🔽The Tathāgata knows those persons who are inclined towards the inferior, though their application is inferior.🔽The Tathāgata knows those persons who are inclined towards the vast, though their application is vast.🔽The Tathāgata knows those persons who are inclined towards the inferior, though their application is vast.🔽The Tathāgata knows those persons who are inclined towards the vast, though their application is inferior.🔽The Tathāgata knows those persons who are inclined towards the inferior, though their application is inferior.🔽The Tathāgata knows those persons who are inclined towards the vast, though their application is vast.🔽The Tathāgata knows those persons who are inclined towards the inferior, though their application is vast.🔽The Tathāgata knows those persons who are inclined towards the vast, though their application is inferior.

original: gang zag gang sbyor ba rgya che zhing dman pa la mos pa de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to; ;gang zag gang sbyor ba dman zhing khyad par la gnas par 'gyur ba de dag kyang de bzhin🔽gshegs pas yang dag ba ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: gang zag gang sbyor ba rgya che zhing dman pa la mos pa de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to; ;gang zag gang sbyor ba dman zhing khyad par la gnas par 'gyur ba de dag kyang de bzhin🔽gshegs pas yang dag ba ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata knows those persons who are inclined towards the inferior, though their application is inferior.🔽The Tathā

original: mos pa gang gis khyad par la sbyor ba dman pa la gnas par 'gyur ba de dag kyang de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //🔽mos pa gang gis log pa nyid du @88b nges pa'i khams thob par 'gyur ba de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //🔽mos pa gang gis yang dag pa nyid du nges pa'i khams thob par 'gyur ba de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: mos pa gang gis khyad par la sbyor ba dman pa la gnas par 'gyur ba de dag kyang de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to // mos pa gang gis log pa nyid du @88b nges pa'i khams thob par 'gyur ba de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to // mos pa gang gis yang dag pa nyid du nges pa'i khams thob par 'gyur ba de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata thoroughly knows, in accordance with reality, those interests that are based on inferior application.🔽The Tathāgata thoroughly knows, in accordance with reality, those interests that lead to the attainment of the spiritual lineage that is destined for perdition.🔽The Tathāgata thoroughly knows, in accordance with reality, those interests that lead to the attainment of the spiritual lineage that is destined for enlightenment.

original: mos pa gang gis yang dag pa nyid du nges pa'i rnam par grol ba 'thob par 'gyur ba de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: mos pa gang gis yang dag pa nyid du nges pa'i rnam par grol ba 'thob par 'gyur ba de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata thoroughly knows, in accordance with reality, those interests that lead to the attainment of the liberation of one who is destined for enlightenment.

original: mos pa gang gis 'dod pa'i khams su 'gro bar 'gyur ba de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //🔽mos pa gang gis gzugs kyi khams su 'gro bar 'gyur ba de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: mos pa gang gis 'dod pa'i khams su 'gro bar 'gyur ba de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to // mos pa gang gis gzugs kyi khams su 'gro bar 'gyur ba de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata has perfect knowledge of the inclinations that lead to the desire realm,🔽the inclinations that lead to the form realm,

original: mos pa gang gis gzugs med pa'i khams su 'gro bar 'gyur ba de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: mos pa gang gis gzugs med pa'i khams su 'gro bar 'gyur ba de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: the inclinations that lead to the formless realm,

original: mos pa gang gis khams gsum du 'gro bar 'gyur ba de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: mos pa gang gis khams gsum du 'gro bar 'gyur ba de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: and the inclinations that lead to the three realms.

original: mos pa gang gis dman pa la brten cing dman pa nyid gnon pa dang / khyad par la brten cing khyad par la gnon pa de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //🔽mos pa gang gis khyad par @89a *//
analyzed: mos pa gang gis dman pa la brten cing dman pa nyid gnon pa dang / khyad par la brten cing khyad par la gnon pa de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to // mos pa gang gis khyad par @89a *//
translated: He knows just as it is the inferior aspiration that is based on the inferior and that overcomes the inferior, and the superior aspiration that is based on the superior and that overcomes the superior.🔽He knows just as it is the aspiration that, having gone to the superior, becomes based on the inferior.

original: du song nas dman pa la gnas par 'gyur ba de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: du song nas dman pa la gnas par 'gyur ba de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows just as it is the aspiration that, having gone to the inferior, becomes based on the superior.

original: mos pa gang gis skye ba tha dad pa dang / kha dog tha dad pa dang / yongs su longs spyod tha dad pa rab tu 'dzin par 'gyur ba de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: mos pa gang gis skye ba tha dad pa dang / kha dog tha dad pa dang / yongs su longs spyod tha dad pa rab tu 'dzin par 'gyur ba de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows just as it is the aspiration that, having gone to the different births, different colors, and different enjoyments, becomes based on the different births, different colors, and different enjoyments.

original: mos pa gang gis rtse mo las nyams par 'gyur ba de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: mos pa gang gis rtse mo las nyams par 'gyur ba de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows just as it is the aspiration that, having gone to the peak, becomes based on the peak.

original: mos pa gang gis rnam par grol ba thob par 'gyur ba de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //🔽mkhyen nas kyang de bzhin du chos ston to //
analyzed: mos pa gang gis rnam par grol ba thob par 'gyur ba de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to // mkhyen nas kyang de bzhin du chos ston to //
translated: The Tathāgata has perfect knowledge of the inclinations of beings, of the various kinds of inclinations of beings.🔽And having that perfect knowledge, he teaches the Dharma accordingly.🔽

original: de ltar na /🔽sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: de ltar na / sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: The Tathāgata has perfect knowledge of the various inclinations of beings, and having perfect knowledge of them, he teaches the Dharma accordingly.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs gang yin pa de ni /
translated: “Śāriputra, the Tathāgata has the power of knowing the various inclinations of beings.

original: mtha' yas mu med de /
analyzed: mtha' yas mu med de /
translated: It is infinite and limitless,

original: nam mkha' dang mtshungs shing mnyam mo //🔽byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa'i mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs de thos nas mngon par dad /🔽yid ches / rab tu rtog /🔽som nyi med /🔽the tshom mi za /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang mtshungs shing mnyam mo // byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa'i mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs de thos nas mngon par dad / yid ches / rab tu rtog / som nyi med / the tshom mi za /
translated: and is equal to the unequaled.

original: rgya cher dga' mgu ste rangs pa rnyed nas nam mkha' lta bur bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir ngo mtshar dang / rmad du 'du shes bskyed do //
analyzed: rgya cher dga' mgu ste rangs pa rnyed nas nam mkha' lta bur bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir ngo mtshar dang / rmad du 'du shes bskyed do //
translated: “The bodhisattvas, having heard this power of the Tathāgata that knows the various inclinations of beings, will have faith in it, will aspire to it, will believe in it, will be convinced of it, will have no doubt in it, will have no uncertainty in it, will rejoice greatly, will be elated, will be enraptured, will be satisfied, and will be delighted by hearing the Dharma talk of the Tathāgata that is related to this power.🔽They will conceive of it as inconceivable, as like space, and as marvelous.🔽“Śāriputra, the bodhisattvas, the great beings, should train in this Dharma discourse called ‘The Tathāgata’s Inconceivable Secret of His Body, Speech, and Mind.’

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis don 'di nyid rgya cher @89b bstan pa'i phyir de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis don 'di nyid rgya cher @89b bstan pa'i phyir de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs so //
translated: Then the Bhagavat, in order to teach this topic in detail, at that time spoke these verses:🔽The various inclinations of this world,

original: 'jig rten 'di mos sna tshogs dang // de bzhin blo gros tshad med pa //
analyzed: 'jig rten 'di mos sna tshogs dang // de bzhin blo gros tshad med pa //
translated: and likewise the immeasurable understandings,

original: de dag gi ni mos pa'i sems //
analyzed: de dag gi ni mos pa'i sems //
translated: the inclinations of their minds,

original: thams cad 'dren pas rab tu mkhyen //
analyzed: thams cad 'dren pas rab tu mkhyen //
translated: the Guide of all knows them.

original: gang dag 'dod chags mos pa la //
analyzed: gang dag 'dod chags mos pa la //
translated: Those who are inclined to desire,🔽who abide in aversion, and in delusion,

original: zhe sdang la ni gnas 'gyur dang // zhe sdang gnas shing gti mug la //
analyzed: zhe sdang la ni gnas 'gyur dang // zhe sdang gnas shing gti mug la //
translated: those who are inclined to aversion,

original: gang dag mos pa rab tu mkhyen //
analyzed: gang dag mos pa rab tu mkhyen //
translated: the Guide knows them.

original: gti mug gnas shing 'dod chags kyi //
analyzed: gti mug gnas shing 'dod chags kyi //
translated: Those who abide in delusion,

original: sems rgyud bsam gyis mi khyab pa //
analyzed: sems rgyud bsam gyis mi khyab pa //
translated: whose mind-streams are inconceivable,

original: bar bar du ni 'jug pa dag /
analyzed: bar bar du ni 'jug pa dag /
translated: who sometimes enter

original: de dag 'dren pas rab tu mkhyen //
analyzed: de dag 'dren pas rab tu mkhyen //
translated: the Guide knows them.

original: gang dag sbyor ba dman gyur la //
analyzed: gang dag sbyor ba dman gyur la //
translated: Those whose application is inferior,🔽but who are inclined to the vast,

original: rgya chen la ni mos pa dang // sbyor ba dam pa de dag gi /
analyzed: rgya chen la ni mos pa dang // sbyor ba dam pa de dag gi /
translated: and those whose application is excellent,

original: dman par 'gyur ba 'dren pas mkhyen //
analyzed: dman par 'gyur ba 'dren pas mkhyen //
translated: the Guide knows their inferiority.

original: log pa'i rjes su song ba dang // 'gro ba med par 'byung ba dang // khams gsum las ni rnam grol ba'i //
analyzed: log pa'i rjes su song ba dang // 'gro ba med par 'byung ba dang // khams gsum las ni rnam grol ba'i //
translated: And those who are liberated from the three realms,

original: mos pa dag kyang rab tu mkhyen //
analyzed: mos pa dag kyang rab tu mkhyen //
translated: The Buddha knows their aspirations.🔽Those who have different births, different colors,🔽Different enjoyments,

original: skye dang kha dog tha dad dang // nye bar spyod pa'i khyad par dang // gang dag spyi bo las nyams pa //
analyzed: skye dang kha dog tha dad dang // nye bar spyod pa'i khyad par dang // gang dag spyi bo las nyams pa //
translated: And those who have fallen from the peak,

original: rkang gnyis gtso bos rab tu mkhyen //
analyzed: rkang gnyis gtso bos rab tu mkhyen //
translated: The supreme human knows them all.🔽Knowing their various aspirations,

original: mos pa sna tshogs rab mkhyen nas; ;'dren pa chos rnams ston pa mdzad //
analyzed: mos pa sna tshogs rab mkhyen nas; ;'dren pa chos rnams ston pa mdzad //
translated: The Guide teaches the Dharma.

original: sangs rgyas kyi ni stobs gsum la //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ni stobs gsum la //
translated: The Buddha’s third power

original: rgyal ba'i thugs sras rab tu mos //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i thugs sras rab tu mos //
translated: Is fully understood by the Victor’s heart sons.

original: sh'a ri'i bu //
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu //
translated: Śāriputra,

original: 'di ni // de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs gsum pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni // de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs gsum pa ste /
translated: This is the third power of the Tathāgatas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa stobs de dag ldan pas de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas khyu mchog gi @90a *//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa stobs de dag ldan pas de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas khyu mchog gi @90a *//
translated: Endowed with these powers, the Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Enlightened Buddha is the supreme bull.

original: gnas su zhal gyis 'che zhing 'khor gyi nang du sengge'i sgra yang dag par sgrog ste /
analyzed: gnas su zhal gyis 'che zhing 'khor gyi nang du sengge'i sgra yang dag par sgrog ste /
translated: He is able to teach in a place and to roar the lion’s roar in the midst of the assembly.

original: dge sbyong ngam //
analyzed: dge sbyong ngam //
translated: He teaches in the right way and roars the lion’s roar in the midst of the assembly.🔽“No one in the world can oppose him, whether a monk,

original: bram ze'am / lha'am /
analyzed: bram ze'am / lha'am /
translated: a brahmin,

original: bdud dam / tshangs pa sus kyang 'jig rten du chos dang mthun par ma bskor ba tshangs pa'i 'khor lo rab tu bskor ro //
analyzed: bdud dam / tshangs pa sus kyang 'jig rten du chos dang mthun par ma bskor ba tshangs pa'i 'khor lo rab tu bskor ro //
translated: a god, a Māra, or a Brahmā. He turns the wheel of Brahmā that has never been turned in the world in accordance with the Dharma.

original: gzhan yang sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: gzhan yang sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Moreover, Śāriputra,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas khams du ma dang / khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis 'jig rten rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //🔽khams gang gis 'jig rten bsod nams kyi 'du byed gsog pa de yang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas khams du ma dang / khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis 'jig rten rnams yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to // khams gang gis 'jig rten bsod nams kyi 'du byed gsog pa de yang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: the Tathāgata, with the power of knowing the various dhātus and the different aspirations of beings, knows the world as it is.🔽He knows as it is the dhātu through which beings accumulate meritorious actions.

original: khams gang gis bsod nams ma yin pa'i 'du byed gsog pa de yang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: khams gang gis bsod nams ma yin pa'i 'du byed gsog pa de yang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows as it is the dhātu through which beings accumulate demeritorious actions.

original: khams gang gis mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed gsog pa de yang de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: khams gang gis mi g-yo ba'i 'du byed gsog pa de yang de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata knows perfectly well the elements by which one accumulates the unmoving formations.

original: khams gang gis 'byung ba'i khams su 'jog par 'gyur ba de yang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: khams gang gis 'byung ba'i khams su 'jog par 'gyur ba de yang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata knows perfectly well the elements by which one is established in the element of arising.

original: gzhan yang sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: gzhan yang sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Moreover, Śāriputra,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas mig gi khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyang rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas mig gi khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyang rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: the Tathāgata knows perfectly the eye element, the form element, and the eye consciousness element.

original: ji ltar rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: How does he know perfectly?

original: nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows perfectly as inner emptiness, outer emptiness, and inner and outer emptiness.

original: yid kyi khams dang / chos kyi khams dang / @90b yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi bar du yang rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: yid kyi khams dang / chos kyi khams dang / @90b yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi bar du yang rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows perfectly the mind element, the dharma element, and the mind consciousness element.

original: ji ltar rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: How does he know perfectly?

original: nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: nang stong pa nyid dang / phyi stong pa nyid dang / phyi nang stong pa nyid du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows the emptiness of the internal, the emptiness of the external, and the emptiness of both the internal and the external.

original: sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows the earth element, the water element, the fire element, and the wind element.

original: ji ltar rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: How does he know them?

original: nam mkha'i khams ji lta ba de bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams ji lta ba de bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows them as the space element.

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / gzugs med pa'i khams rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows the desire realm, the form realm, and the formless realm.

original: ji ltar rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar rab tu mkhyen ce na /
translated: How does he know them?

original: kun tu rtog pa las myung  bar rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: kun tu rtog pa las myung  bar rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows them as conceptualization.

original: 'dus byas kyi khams ni /
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi khams ni /
translated: The conditioned realm

original: mngon par 'du byed pa'i mtshan nyid du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa'i mtshan nyid du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: he knows as having the characteristic of formation.

original: 'dus ma byas kyi khams ni /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi khams ni /
translated: The unconditioned realm

original: mngon par 'du mi byed pa'i mtshan nyid du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: mngon par 'du mi byed pa'i mtshan nyid du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: he knows as having the characteristic of non-formation.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i khams ni /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa'i khams ni /
translated: The defiled realm

original: phyis 'byung ba'i nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid du rab tu mkhyen to //🔽rnam par byang ba'i khams ni /
analyzed: phyis 'byung ba'i nyon mongs pa'i mtshan nyid du rab tu mkhyen to // rnam par byang ba'i khams ni /
translated: He knows the characteristics of the future afflictions.

original: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i mtshan nyid du rab tu mkhyen to //🔽'du byed kyi khams ni /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba'i mtshan nyid du rab tu mkhyen to // 'du byed kyi khams ni /
translated: He knows the characteristics of the pure realm as being naturally luminous.

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa ma rig pa'i mtshan nyid du rab tu mkhyen to //🔽mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings ni /
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa ma rig pa'i mtshan nyid du rab tu mkhyen to // mya ngan las 'das pa'i dbyings ni /
translated: He knows the characteristics of the realm of formations as being incorrect ignorance.

original: tshul bzhin rig pa'i mtshan nyid du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: tshul bzhin rig pa'i mtshan nyid du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows the characteristics of the realm of nirvana as being correct knowledge.

original: 'di ltar 'jig rten gnas pa'i khams gang yin pa dang / 'jig rten gnas pa khams gang la gnas pa dang / khams gang la rjes su chags pa dang / khams gang la gnas pa dang / khams gang la sbyor ba dang / khams @91a *//
analyzed: 'di ltar 'jig rten gnas pa'i khams gang yin pa dang / 'jig rten gnas pa khams gang la gnas pa dang / khams gang la rjes su chags pa dang / khams gang la gnas pa dang / khams gang la sbyor ba dang / khams @91a *//
translated: Thus, he knows the realm of the world’s existence, the realm of the world’s existence in which the world exists, the realm of the world’s existence to which the world is attached, the realm of the world’s existence in which the world abides, the realm of the world’s existence in which the world engages, the realm of the world’s existence in which the world is born, the realm of the world’s existence in which the world ceases, the realm of the world’s existence in which the world is liberated, the realm of the world’s existence in which the world is purified, and the realm of the world’s existence in which the world is not purified.

original: gang gis bsam pa dang / khams gang la nges par sems pa dang / khams gang la brten pa de yang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to; ;mkhyen nas kyang chos ston to //🔽de ltar sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: gang gis bsam pa dang / khams gang la nges par sems pa dang / khams gang la brten pa de yang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to; ;mkhyen nas kyang chos ston to // de ltar sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Having known this, he teaches the Dharma.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i khams du ma dang / khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs mtha' yas mu med de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i khams du ma dang / khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs mtha' yas mu med de /
translated: Śāriputra, the Thus-Gone One’s power of knowing the various elements and numerous elements is infinite and limitless.

original: nam mkha' dang mtshungs shing mnyam mo //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang mtshungs shing mnyam mo //
translated: It is equal to and the same as space.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa khams du ma dang / khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs la mngon par dad /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa khams du ma dang / khams sna tshogs mkhyen pa'i stobs la mngon par dad /
translated: Bodhisattvas have faith in the Thus-Gone One’s power of knowing the various elements and numerous elements.

original: yid ches / rab tu rtog /
analyzed: yid ches / rab tu rtog /
translated: They believe in it, understand it,

original: som nyi med /
analyzed: som nyi med /
translated: are free from doubt,🔽and are free from uncertainty.

original: the tshom mi za; rgya cher dga' mgu ste rangs pa rnyed nas nam mkha' lta bur bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir ngo mtshar dang / rmad du 'du shes bskyed do //🔽'di la chos nyid ni /
analyzed: the tshom mi za; rgya cher dga' mgu ste rangs pa rnyed nas nam mkha' lta bur bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir ngo mtshar dang / rmad du 'du shes bskyed do // 'di la chos nyid ni /
translated: They are delighted, joyful, and elated. They develop a sense of wonder and amazement because it is inconceivable like space.

original: 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di yin te /
translated: The nature of this is as follows.

original: 'di la 'di skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la 'di skad ces bya'o //
translated: This is what is called🔽“The Buddha knows the various elements

original: 'jig rten kun na sems can gang //🔽sna tshogs khams la gnas pa dag /
analyzed: 'jig rten kun na sems can gang // sna tshogs khams la gnas pa dag /
translated: Of sentient beings in the world

original: khams gang 'jug pa ci 'dra ba //🔽sangs rgyas kyis ni rab tu mkhyen //
analyzed: khams gang 'jug pa ci 'dra ba // sangs rgyas kyis ni rab tu mkhyen //
translated: And the way in which they enter the elements.

original: bsod nams bsod nams min mi g-yo //
analyzed: bsod nams bsod nams min mi g-yo //
translated: He knows merit, demerit, and the unmoving,

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'ang de bzhin te //
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ba'ang de bzhin te //
translated: And also what will arise.

original: khams rnams gang la gnas nas su //
analyzed: khams rnams gang la gnas nas su //
translated: Abiding in which elements

original: mya ngan 'das pa zhi la reg /
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa zhi la reg /
translated: Will one reach the peace of nirvāṇa?

original: mig gi khams dang gzugs kyi khams //
analyzed: mig gi khams dang gzugs kyi khams //
translated: He knows the eye element and the form element,🔽And also the eye consciousness itself.

original: mig gi rnam par shes nyid dang // rna ba sna dang lce dang lus //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes nyid dang // rna ba sna dang lce dang lus //
translated: He knows the ear, nose, tongue, and body,

original: yid kyi khams kyang rab tu mkhyen //🔽chos kyi khams dang yid kyi ni //
analyzed: yid kyi khams kyang rab tu mkhyen // chos kyi khams dang yid kyi ni //
translated: And also the mind element.🔽He knows the phenomena element and also

original: rnam par shes pa nyid kyang mkhyen //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa nyid kyang mkhyen //
translated: The mind consciousness itself.🔽He knows the inner elements to be empty,

original: nang gi khams ni stong @91b pa dang; ;phyi rol dag kyang stong par mkhyen //
analyzed: nang gi khams ni stong @91b pa dang; ;phyi rol dag kyang stong par mkhyen //
translated: And also the outer to be empty.🔽He knows the earth, water, and fire elements,

original: sa dang chu dang me dag dang // rlung gi khams kyang de bzhin te //
analyzed: sa dang chu dang me dag dang // rlung gi khams kyang de bzhin te //
translated: And also the wind element.

original: khams rnams bzhi po de dag ni //
analyzed: khams rnams bzhi po de dag ni //
translated: These four elements

original: nam mkha' mtshungs par rab tu mkhyen //
analyzed: nam mkha' mtshungs par rab tu mkhyen //
translated: And are the same as space.

original: 'dod pa'i khams dang gzugs kyi khams //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams dang gzugs kyi khams //
translated: The desire realm and the form realm,

original: gzugs med pa yi khams nyid kyang //
analyzed: gzugs med pa yi khams nyid kyang //
translated: And the formless realm itself,

original: kun tu rtog las byung bar ni //
analyzed: kun tu rtog las byung bar ni //
translated: All arise from conceptualization.

original: de ltar sangs rgyas rab tu mkhyen //
analyzed: de ltar sangs rgyas rab tu mkhyen //
translated: The buddhas know this to be so.

original: ji ltar nam mkha' mtha' yas pa /
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' mtha' yas pa /
translated: Just as space is infinite,

original: de bzhin khams rnams mu med de //
analyzed: de bzhin khams rnams mu med de //
translated: The elements are also boundless.

original: thams cad sangs rgyas rab mkhyen kyang //
analyzed: thams cad sangs rgyas rab mkhyen kyang //
translated: Although the buddhas know all this,

original: mkhyen to snyam du rlom sems med //
analyzed: mkhyen to snyam du rlom sems med //
translated: They do not think, “I know.”

original: khams ni skye ba ma yin zhing //
analyzed: khams ni skye ba ma yin zhing //
translated: The elements are unborn

original: rnam pa kun tu 'gag med de //🔽khams 'di mya ngan 'das par ni //
analyzed: rnam pa kun tu 'gag med de // khams 'di mya ngan 'das par ni //
translated: And never cease in any way.

original: skyes bu dam pas rab tu mkhyen //
analyzed: skyes bu dam pas rab tu mkhyen //
translated: The sublime beings know🔽That the elements are nirvāṇa.

original: ji ltar nam mkha' mtha' yas pa //
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' mtha' yas pa //
translated: Just as space is infinite,

original: sangs rgyas ye shes de 'dra ste //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ye shes de 'dra ste //
translated: So is the wisdom of the buddhas.

original: mos pa sna tshogs rab sprul pa //
analyzed: mos pa sna tshogs rab sprul pa //
translated: They emanate various aspirations

original: ye shes nges ni rab tu mkhyen //
analyzed: ye shes nges ni rab tu mkhyen //
translated: And know the certainty of wisdom.🔽Knowing the various aspirations,

original: mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen nas su; ;sems can bye ba rnam par 'dul //
analyzed: mos pa sna tshogs mkhyen nas su; ;sems can bye ba rnam par 'dul //
translated: They tame millions of beings.

original: sangs rgyas stobs ni bzhi pa la //
analyzed: sangs rgyas stobs ni bzhi pa la //
translated: In the fourth power of the buddhas,

original: rgyal pa'i thugs sras dad par byed //
analyzed: rgyal pa'i thugs sras dad par byed //
translated: The heart-sons of the Victorious One are inspired with faith.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: 'di ni / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bzhi pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bzhi pa ste /
translated: this is the fourth power of the tathāgatas.

original: sus kyang 'jig rten 'dir chos dang mthun pa zhes bya ba'i bar du rgyas par bya'o //
analyzed: sus kyang 'jig rten 'dir chos dang mthun pa zhes bya ba'i bar du rgyas par bya'o //
translated: No one in this world can dispute this, in accordance with the Dharma, and so on at length.

original: gzhan yang sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: gzhan yang sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Moreover, Śāriputra,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbang po dang / brtson 'grus kyi rim pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis sems can gzhan dang / gang zag gzhan rnams kyi dbang po dang / brtson 'grus kyi rim pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i dbang po dang / brtson 'grus kyi rim pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyis sems can gzhan dang / gang zag gzhan rnams kyi dbang po dang / brtson 'grus kyi rim pa yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: by the power of knowing the faculties and the degrees of spiritual practice of others, the Tathāgata knows the faculties and the degrees of spiritual practice of other beings and other persons just as they are.

original: ji ltar rab tu mkhyen ce na /🔽dbang po @92a *//
analyzed: ji ltar rab tu mkhyen ce na / dbang po @92a *//
translated: How does he know?

original: rtul ba'ang rab tu mkhyen to //🔽dbang po bar ma yang rab tu mkhyen to //🔽dbang po rno ba yang rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: rtul ba'ang rab tu mkhyen to // dbang po bar ma yang rab tu mkhyen to // dbang po rno ba yang rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows the dull faculties.🔽He knows the middling faculties.🔽He knows the sharp faculties.

original: dbang po khyad par du 'phags pa yang rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: dbang po khyad par du 'phags pa yang rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows the superior faculties.

original: dbang po dman pa yang rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: dbang po dman pa yang rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows the inferior faculties.🔽He knows just as it is the faculties that have reached the end of desire, the faculties that have reached the end of hatred, and the faculties that have reached the end of ignorance.🔽He knows just as it is the faculties that have reached the end of desire, hatred, and ignorance.🔽He knows just as it is the faculties that have reached the end of desire, hatred, and ignorance.

original: yongs su rtogs pa'i dbang po ji lta bus mthar phyin pa'i 'dod chags skye ba dang / mthar phyin pa'i zhe sdang skye ba dang / mthar phyin pa'i gti mug skye ba de yang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: yongs su rtogs pa'i dbang po ji lta bus mthar phyin pa'i 'dod chags skye ba dang / mthar phyin pa'i zhe sdang skye ba dang / mthar phyin pa'i gti mug skye ba de yang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows just as it is the faculties that have reached the end of desire, hatred, and ignorance.

original: yongs su rtog pa'i dbang po ji lta bus 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug brtan pa skye ba de yang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: yongs su rtog pa'i dbang po ji lta bus 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug brtan pa skye ba de yang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows just as it is the faculties that have reached the end of desire, hatred, and ignorance.🔽He knows just as it is the faculties that have reached the end of desire, hatred, and ignorance.🔽He knows just as it is the faculties that have reached the end of desire, hatred, and ignorance.🔽He knows just as it is the faculties that have reached the end of desire, hatred, and ignorance.🔽He knows just as it is the faculties that have reached the end of desire, hatred, and ignorance.🔽He knows just as it is the faculties that have reached the end of desire, hatred, and ignorance.🔽He knows just as it is the faculties that have reached the end of desire, hatred, and ignorance.🔽He knows just as it is the faculties that have reached the end of desire, hatred, and ignorance.🔽He knows just as it is the faculties that have reached the end of desire, hatred, and ignorance.🔽He knows just as it is the faculties that have reached the end of desire, hatred, and ignorance.🔽He knows just as it is the faculties that have reached the end of desire, hatred, and ignorance.🔽He knows just as it is the faculties that have reached the end of desire, hatred, and ignorance.🔽He knows just as it is the faculties that have reached the end of desire, hatred, and ignorance.🔽He knows just as it is the faculties that have reached the end of desire, hatred, and ignorance.🔽He knows just as it is the faculties that have reached the end of desire, hatred, and ignorance.🔽He knows just as it is the faculties that have reached the end of desire, hatred, and ignorance.🔽He knows just as it is the faculties that have reached the end of desire, hatred, and ignorance.

original: yongs su rtog pa'i dbang po ji lta bus 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug yang skye ba de yang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: yongs su rtog pa'i dbang po ji lta bus 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug yang skye ba de yang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows just as it is the faculties that have reached the end of desire, hatred, and ignorance.🔽He knows just as it

original: yongs su rtog pa'i dbang po ji lta bus snrel zhi'i 'dong chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug skye ba de yang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //🔽yongs su rtog pa'i dbang po ji lta bus tshar bcad cing /
analyzed: yongs su rtog pa'i dbang po ji lta bus snrel zhi'i 'dong chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug skye ba de yang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to // yongs su rtog pa'i dbang po ji lta bus tshar bcad cing /
translated: Whatever faculties of conceptualization give rise to attachment, aversion, and delusion, the Tathāgata knows them all exactly as they are.

original: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug skye ba de yang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug skye ba de yang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: Whatever faculties of conceptualization give rise to the destruction of attachment, aversion, and delusion, the Tathāgata knows them all exactly as they are.

original: dbang po gang dag mi dge ba'i rgyu las byung ba dang / dbang po gang dag dge ba'i rgyu las byung ba dang / dbang po gang dag mi g-yo ba'i rgyu las byung ba dang / dbang po @92b gang dag 'byung ba'i rgyu las byung ba de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: dbang po gang dag mi dge ba'i rgyu las byung ba dang / dbang po gang dag dge ba'i rgyu las byung ba dang / dbang po gang dag mi g-yo ba'i rgyu las byung ba dang / dbang po @92b gang dag 'byung ba'i rgyu las byung ba de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: Whatever faculties arise from unwholesome causes, whatever faculties arise from wholesome causes, whatever faculties arise from unshakable causes, and whatever faculties arise from arising causes, the Tathāgata knows them all exactly as they are.

original: gzhan yang sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: gzhan yang sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Moreover, Śāriputra,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas mig gi dbang po yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen pa nas gong ma bzhin rab tu mkhyen pa nas gong ma bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas mig gi dbang po yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen pa nas gong ma bzhin rab tu mkhyen pa nas gong ma bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: The Tathāgata knows the eye faculty just as it is.

original: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi dbang po yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi dbang po yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind faculties just as they are.

original: pho'i dbang po dang / mo'i dbang po dang / srog gi dbang po dang / bde ba'i dbang po dang / sdug bsngal gyi dbang po dang / yid mi bde ba'i dbang po dang / yid bde ba'i dbang po dang / btang snyoms kyi dbang po yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: pho'i dbang po dang / mo'i dbang po dang / srog gi dbang po dang / bde ba'i dbang po dang / sdug bsngal gyi dbang po dang / yid mi bde ba'i dbang po dang / yid bde ba'i dbang po dang / btang snyoms kyi dbang po yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows the male faculty, female faculty, life faculty, pleasure faculty, pain faculty, mental dissatisfaction faculty, mental satisfaction faculty, and equanimity faculty just as they are.

original: dad pa'i dbang po dang / brtson 'grus kyi dbang po dang / dran pa'i dbang po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po dang / shes rab kyi dbang po yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: dad pa'i dbang po dang / brtson 'grus kyi dbang po dang / dran pa'i dbang po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po dang / shes rab kyi dbang po yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: and the faculty of wisdom.🔽He also knows as it really is the faculty of knowing what is not yet known,🔽the faculty of perfect knowledge,

original: mi shes pa kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po dang / kun shes pa'i dbang po dang / kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: mi shes pa kun shes par byed pa'i dbang po dang / kun shes pa'i dbang po dang / kun shes pa dang ldan pa'i dbang po yang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: and the faculty of the possession of perfect knowledge.

original: dbang po gang mig gi dbang po'i rgyu las byung la /
analyzed: dbang po gang mig gi dbang po'i rgyu las byung la /
translated: “He also knows as it really is the cause from which the eye faculty arises.

original: rna ba'i dbang po la gnas par 'gyur te /🔽sna la ma yin /
analyzed: rna ba'i dbang po la gnas par 'gyur te / sna la ma yin /
translated: It arises from the ear faculty,

original: lce la ma yin /🔽lus kyi dbang po la ma yin pa de yang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: lce la ma yin / lus kyi dbang po la ma yin pa de yang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: but not from the nose faculty,🔽not from the tongue faculty,🔽and not from the body faculty.

original: gang rna ba'i dbang po'i rgyu las byung la //
analyzed: gang rna ba'i dbang po'i rgyu las byung la //
translated: He also knows as it really is the cause from which the ear faculty arises.

original: sna'i dbang po la gnas par 'gyur ba dang / gang sna'i dbang po'i rgyu las byung la /
analyzed: sna'i dbang po la gnas par 'gyur ba dang / gang sna'i dbang po'i rgyu las byung la /
translated: He knows perfectly the faculties that are present in the nose sense-faculty, and those that arise from the nose sense-faculty.

original: lce'i dbang po @93a *//🔽la gnas par 'gyur ba dang / gang lce'i dbang po'i rgyu las byung la /
analyzed: lce'i dbang po @93a *// la gnas par 'gyur ba dang / gang lce'i dbang po'i rgyu las byung la /
translated: He knows perfectly the faculties that are present in the tongue sense-faculty, and those that arise from the tongue sense-faculty.🔽He knows perfectly the faculties that are present in the body sense-faculty, and those that arise from the body sense-faculty.🔽He knows perfectly the faculties that are present in the mental faculty, and those that arise from the mental faculty.

original: lus kyi dbang po la gnas par 'gyur ba de yang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rang tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: lus kyi dbang po la gnas par 'gyur ba de yang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rang tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows perfectly the faculties that are present in the male faculty, and those that arise from the male faculty.🔽He knows perfectly the faculties that are present in the female faculty, and those that arise from the female faculty.

original: sems can gang sbyin pa'i dbang po can yin la /
analyzed: sems can gang sbyin pa'i dbang po can yin la /
translated: He knows perfectly the faculties that are present in the life faculty, and those that arise from the life faculty.🔽He knows perfectly the faculties that are present in the faculties of pleasure, joy, and satisfaction, and those that arise from the faculties of pleasure, joy, and satisfaction.🔽He knows perfectly the faculties that are present in the faculty of mental pain, and those that arise from the faculty of mental pain.🔽He knows perfectly the faculties that are present in the faculty of indifference, and those that arise from the faculty of indifference.🔽He knows perfectly the faculties that are present in the faculty of coming to know the unknown, and those that arise from the faculty of coming to know the unknown.

original: de yang tshul khrims la sbyor ba de la de bzhin gshegs pas dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pas de la sbyin pa'i gtam ston to //
analyzed: de yang tshul khrims la sbyor ba de la de bzhin gshegs pas dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pas de la sbyin pa'i gtam ston to //
translated: He knows perfectly the faculties that are present in the faculty of perfect knowledge, and those that arise from the faculty of perfect knowledge.🔽He knows perfectly the faculties that are present in the faculty of the possession of perfect knowledge, and those that arise from the faculty of the possession of perfect knowledge.

original: gang zag tshul khrims kyi dbang po can yin la /
analyzed: gang zag tshul khrims kyi dbang po can yin la /
translated: He knows perfectly the faculties that are present in the faculty of faith, and those that arise from the faculty of faith.🔽He knows perfectly the faculties that are present in the faculty of vigor, and those that arise from the faculty of vigor.🔽He knows perfectly the faculties that are present in the faculty of mindfulness, and those that arise from the faculty of mindfulness.🔽He knows perfectly the faculties that are present in the faculty of concentration, and those that arise from the faculty of concentration.🔽He knows perfectly the faculties that are present in the faculty of wisdom, and those that arise from the faculty of wisdom.

original: de yang sbyin pa la sbyor ba de la de bzhin gshegs pas dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pas tshul khrims kyi gtam ston to //
analyzed: de yang sbyin pa la sbyor ba de la de bzhin gshegs pas dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pas tshul khrims kyi gtam ston to //
translated: He knows perfectly the faculties that are present in the faculty of skill in means, and those that arise from the faculty of skill in means.

original: sems can gang bzod pa'i dbang po can yin la /
analyzed: sems can gang bzod pa'i dbang po can yin la /
translated: He knows perfectly the faculties

original: de yang brtson 'grus la sbyor ba de la de bzhin gshegs pas dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pas bzod pa'i gtam ston to //
analyzed: de yang brtson 'grus la sbyor ba de la de bzhin gshegs pas dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pas bzod pa'i gtam ston to //
translated: The Tathāgata, knowing their faculties to be superior, teaches them the discourse on patience.

original: sems can gang brtson 'grus kyi dbang po can yin la /
analyzed: sems can gang brtson 'grus kyi dbang po can yin la /
translated: There are sentient beings who have the faculty of effort,

original: de yang bzod pa la sbyor ba de la de bzhin gshegs pas dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pas brtson 'grus kyi gtam ston to //
analyzed: de yang bzod pa la sbyor ba de la de bzhin gshegs pas dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pas brtson 'grus kyi gtam ston to //
translated: but who are engaged in patience. The Tathāgata, knowing their faculties to be superior, teaches them the discourse on effort.

original: sems can gang bsam gtan gyi dbang po can yin la /
analyzed: sems can gang bsam gtan gyi dbang po can yin la /
translated: There are sentient beings who have the faculty of concentration,

original: de yang shes rab la sbyor ba de la de bzhin gshegs pas dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pas bsam gtan gyi gtam ston to //
analyzed: de yang shes rab la sbyor ba de la de bzhin gshegs pas dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pas bsam gtan gyi gtam ston to //
translated: but who are engaged in wisdom. The Tathāgata, knowing their faculties to be superior, teaches them the discourse on concentration.

original: sems can gang shes rab kyi dbang po can yin la /
analyzed: sems can gang shes rab kyi dbang po can yin la /
translated: There are sentient beings who have the faculty of wisdom,

original: de yang shes rab la sbyor ba de la de bzhin gshegs pas dbang po @93b mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pas shes rab kyi gtam ston to //
analyzed: de yang shes rab la sbyor ba de la de bzhin gshegs pas dbang po @93b mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pas shes rab kyi gtam ston to //
translated: but who are engaged in wisdom. The Tathāgata, knowing their faculties to be superior, teaches them the discourse on wisdom.

original: gong ma bzhin du sbyar te byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos thams cad la yang bya'o //
analyzed: gong ma bzhin du sbyar te byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos thams cad la yang bya'o //
translated: The same is to be applied to all the elements of awakening.

original: sems can gang nyan thos kyi theg pa'i dbang po can yin la //
analyzed: sems can gang nyan thos kyi theg pa'i dbang po can yin la //
translated: There are sentient beings who have the faculties of the vehicle of the hearers,

original: de yang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la sbyor ba de la de bzhin gshegs pas dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pas nyan thos kyi theg pa'i gtam ston to //
analyzed: de yang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la sbyor ba de la de bzhin gshegs pas dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pas nyan thos kyi theg pa'i gtam ston to //
translated: and they are to be brought to the vehicle of the solitary buddhas. The Tathāgata, knowing their faculties to be superior or not superior, teaches them the vehicle of the hearers.

original: sems can gang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'i dbang po can yin la /
analyzed: sems can gang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'i dbang po can yin la /
translated: There are sentient beings who have the faculties of the vehicle of the solitary buddhas,

original: de yang nyan thos kyi theg pa la sbyor ba de la de bzhin gshegs pas dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pas rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'i gtam ston to //
analyzed: de yang nyan thos kyi theg pa la sbyor ba de la de bzhin gshegs pas dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pas rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'i gtam ston to //
translated: and they are to be brought to the vehicle of the hearers. The Tathāgata, knowing their faculties to be superior or not superior, teaches them the vehicle of the solitary buddhas.

original: sems can gang theg pa chen po'i dbang po can yin la /
analyzed: sems can gang theg pa chen po'i dbang po can yin la /
translated: There are sentient beings who have the faculties of the Great Vehicle,🔽and they are to be brought to the Great Vehicle. The Tathāgata, knowing their faculties to be superior or not superior, teaches them the Great Vehicle.

original: de yang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la sbyor ba de la de bzhin gshegs pas dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pas theg pa chen po'i gtam ston to //🔽sems can gang tha ma'i dbang po can yin la /
analyzed: de yang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la sbyor ba de la de bzhin gshegs pas dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pas theg pa chen po'i gtam ston to // sems can gang tha ma'i dbang po can yin la /
translated: The Tathāgata, knowing their faculties to be supreme or not supreme, teaches the Great Vehicle to those who are applying themselves to the Great Vehicle.🔽The Tathāgata, knowing their faculties to be supreme or not supreme, teaches the Dharma of the supreme vehicle to those who are applying themselves to the supreme vehicle.🔽The Tathāgata, knowing their faculties to be supreme or not supreme, teaches the Dharma of the middling vehicle to those who are applying themselves to the middling vehicle.🔽The Tathāgata, knowing their faculties to be supreme or not supreme, teaches the Dharma of the inferior vehicle to those who are applying themselves to the inferior vehicle.🔽The Tathāgata, knowing their faculties to be supreme or not supreme, teaches the Dharma of the supreme vehicle to those who are applying themselves to the supreme vehicle.

original: de yang theg pa chen po la sbyor ba de la de bzhin gshegs pas dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pas dbang po tha ma'i gtam ston to //
analyzed: de yang theg pa chen po la sbyor ba de la de bzhin gshegs pas dbang po mchog dang mchog ma yin pa mkhyen pas dbang po tha ma'i gtam ston to //
translated: The Tathāgata, knowing their faculties to be supreme or not supreme, teaches the Dharma of the middling vehicle to those who are applying themselves to the middling vehicle.🔽The Tathāgata, knowing their faculties to be supreme or not supreme, teaches the Dharma of the inferior vehicle to those who are applying themselves to the inferior vehicle.

original: sems can gang skal ba med pa'i dbang po can skal pa med par snang ba de dag de bzhin gshegs pas skal ba med cing snod ma yin par rig nas btang snyoms su 'jog go /🔽sems can skal pa yod pa'i dbang po can skal ba yod par snang ba dag la de bzhin gshegs pas skal ba yod cing snod du rig nas ri mor byas shing @94a *//
analyzed: sems can gang skal ba med pa'i dbang po can skal pa med par snang ba de dag de bzhin gshegs pas skal ba med cing snod ma yin par rig nas btang snyoms su 'jog go / sems can skal pa yod pa'i dbang po can skal ba yod par snang ba dag la de bzhin gshegs pas skal ba yod cing snod du rig nas ri mor byas shing @94a *//
translated: The Tathāgata, knowing their faculties to be supreme or not supreme, teaches the Dharma of the supreme vehicle to those who are applying themselves to the supreme vehicle.🔽The Tathāgata, knowing their faculties to be supreme or not supreme, teaches the Dharma of the middling vehicle to those who are applying themselves to the middling vehicle.🔽The Tathāgata, knowing their faculties to be supreme or not supreme, teaches the Dharma of the inferior vehicle to those who are applying themselves to the inferior vehicle.

original: chos ston te /🔽de ltar sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: chos ston te /🔽de ltar sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: The Tathāgata, knowing their faculties to be supreme or not supreme, teaches the Dharma of the supreme vehicle to those who are applying themselves to the supreme vehicle.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas sems can thams cad kyi dbang po yongs su smin pa rnams kyang rab tu mkhyen /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas sems can thams cad kyi dbang po yongs su smin pa rnams kyang rab tu mkhyen /
translated: The Thus-Gone One knows the faculties of all sentient beings that are ripe,

original: dbang po yongs su ma smin pa rnams kyang rab tu mkhyen /
analyzed: dbang po yongs su ma smin pa rnams kyang rab tu mkhyen /
translated: and he also knows those that are not ripe.

original: 'byung ba'i dbang po rnams kyang rab tu mkhyen /
analyzed: 'byung ba'i dbang po rnams kyang rab tu mkhyen /
translated: He knows the faculties that will emerge,

original: 'byung ba ma yin pa'i dbang po rnams kyang rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: 'byung ba ma yin pa'i dbang po rnams kyang rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: and he also knows those that will not emerge.

original: sems can gyi dbang po'i rnam pa gang yin pa dang / sbyor ba gang yin pa dang / bsam pa gang yin pa dang / gang gi rgyu las byung ba dang / rkyen gang yin pa dang / dmigs pa gang yin pa dang / rgyu mthun pa gang yin pa dang /
analyzed: sems can gyi dbang po'i rnam pa gang yin pa dang / sbyor ba gang yin pa dang / bsam pa gang yin pa dang / gang gi rgyu las byung ba dang / rkyen gang yin pa dang / dmigs pa gang yin pa dang / rgyu mthun pa gang yin pa dang /
translated: The Thus-Gone One knows all the aspects of sentient beings’ faculties, their application, their intentions, their causes, their conditions, their objects, and their concordant tendencies.

original: sems can gyi dbang po'i mtha' gang yin pa de dag thams cad de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: sems can gyi dbang po'i mtha' gang yin pa de dag thams cad de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Thus-Gone One knows all the limits of sentient beings’ faculties just as they are.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad gsungs te /
translated: The Blessed One spoke thus,🔽and the monks rejoiced in and praised what the Blessed One had said.

original: bde bar gshegs pas de skad bka' stsal nas ston pas yang 'di skad gsungs so //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pas de skad bka' stsal nas ston pas yang 'di skad gsungs so //
translated: further said this:

original: 'gro ba'i dbang po de ni dbang po'i pha rol song //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i dbang po de ni dbang po'i pha rol song //
translated: “That faculty of beings has gone beyond the range of faculties.

original: sems can rnams kyi spyod dang bsam pa'i cho ga mkhyen //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi spyod dang bsam pa'i cho ga mkhyen //
translated: He knows the conduct and thoughts of beings.

original: 'gro ba gang dag gi ni dbang po ci 'dra ba //
analyzed: 'gro ba gang dag gi ni dbang po ci 'dra ba //
translated: Whatever the faculties of beings are,

original: de 'drar mi yi sengge de la chos 'chad do //
analyzed: de 'drar mi yi sengge de la chos 'chad do //
translated: to them the Lion among Men teaches the Dharma accordingly.

original: dbang po dag ni rab 'bring tha mar gyur pa rnams //
analyzed: dbang po dag ni rab 'bring tha mar gyur pa rnams //
translated: The faculties are of the highest, middling, and lowest kinds.

original: de la bde gshegs ye shes rmad du byung ba 'jug /
analyzed: de la bde gshegs ye shes rmad du byung ba 'jug /
translated: The Sugata’s marvelous wisdom penetrates them.

original: sems can bsam pa thar pa'i snod du gyur mkhyen nas //
analyzed: sems can bsam pa thar pa'i snod du gyur mkhyen nas //
translated: Knowing the thoughts of beings to be vessels of liberation,

original: spyod pa mkhyen cing mkhas pa mchog gi chos ston to //
analyzed: spyod pa mkhyen cing mkhas pa mchog gi chos ston to //
translated: he teaches the Dharma of the supreme skilled one.🔽Those who are born at the end, who are established in afflictions,🔽those people whose faculties are middling,

original: gang dag mthar @94b phyin skye zhing nyon mongs brten pa dang // mi gang rnams kyi dbang po yang bar gyur pa dang // skyes bu gang gi dbang po snrel zhing gyur pa yi //
analyzed: gang dag mthar @94b phyin skye zhing nyon mongs brten pa dang // mi gang rnams kyi dbang po yang bar gyur pa dang // skyes bu gang gi dbang po snrel zhing gyur pa yi //
translated: and those beings whose faculties are mixed—

original: spyod pa mkhyen nas de ltar mthun pa'i chos ston to //
analyzed: spyod pa mkhyen nas de ltar mthun pa'i chos ston to //
translated: knowing their conduct, he teaches the Dharma accordingly.

original: skyes bu gang gi dge ba'i dbang por gyur pa dang // mi dge ba yi dbang por gyur pa rnams kyang de bzhin mkhyen //
analyzed: skyes bu gang gi dge ba'i dbang por gyur pa dang // mi dge ba yi dbang por gyur pa rnams kyang de bzhin mkhyen //
translated: “They know the faculties of beings, whether they are faculties of virtue or nonvirtue.

original: mig nas bzung ste yid kyi bar gyi dbang po dang // yid mi bde dang sdug bsngal dbang mkhyen chos kyang ston //🔽dad brtson dran dang ting 'dzin de bzhin shes rab dang // skyes bu gang la dbang po 'di dag yod pa ni //
analyzed: mig nas bzung ste yid kyi bar gyi dbang po dang // yid mi bde dang sdug bsngal dbang mkhyen chos kyang ston // dad brtson dran dang ting 'dzin de bzhin shes rab dang // skyes bu gang la dbang po 'di dag yod pa ni //
translated: They know the faculties of the eyes and so on up to the mind, and they teach the Dharma knowing the faculties of mental dissatisfaction and suffering.🔽“They teach the Dharma of faith, diligence, mindfulness, absorption, and wisdom. They teach the Dharma of the faculties of beings.

original: de la dad pa'i gtam ston de bzhin brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan shes rab dag kyang dam pa'i don du ston //
analyzed: de la dad pa'i gtam ston de bzhin brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan shes rab dag kyang dam pa'i don du ston //
translated: They teach the Dharma of faith, diligence, absorption, and wisdom.

original: mi yi dbang po rnam pa spyod pa'i bye brag gang //🔽mi gang bsam pa ci 'jug de yi dbang po yang //
analyzed: mi yi dbang po rnam pa spyod pa'i bye brag gang // mi gang bsam pa ci 'jug de yi dbang po yang //
translated: “They know the different kinds of conduct of the lords of humans.🔽They know the faculties of those who have the intention to be a buddha.

original: chos mchog rtogs pas de dag gi ni spyod pa mkhyen //
analyzed: chos mchog rtogs pas de dag gi ni spyod pa mkhyen //
translated: They know the conduct of those who have realized the supreme Dharma.

original: sdug bsngal kun las thar par byed pa'i chos 'chad do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal kun las thar par byed pa'i chos 'chad do //
translated: They teach the Dharma that liberates from all suffering.

original: gang gi dbang po sangs rgyas byang chub phyir nges la //
analyzed: gang gi dbang po sangs rgyas byang chub phyir nges la //
translated: “They know the faculties of those who are certain to be buddhas.

original: nyan thos shes pa'i rjes 'jug cho ga mi shes la //
analyzed: nyan thos shes pa'i rjes 'jug cho ga mi shes la //
translated: The śrāvakas follow the knowledge of the ritual, but do not know it.

original: de la byang chub reg 'gyur rgya chen gtam rab ston //
analyzed: de la byang chub reg 'gyur rgya chen gtam rab ston //
