translated: They teach the vast discourse that will lead to the attainment of enlightenment.

original: bde gshegs stobs ni mtha' yas thul dka' lnga pa'o //
analyzed: bde gshegs stobs ni mtha' yas thul dka' lnga pa'o //
translated: The Sugata’s fifth power is the knowledge of the various dhātus, which is difficult to overcome.

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs lnga pa ste; sus kyang 'jig rten 'di ni chos dang mthun pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs lnga pa ste; sus kyang 'jig rten 'di ni chos dang mthun pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: This is the fifth tathāgata power of the tathāgatas, by which the tathāgatas declare that they set in motion the unexcelled wheel of the Dharma, etc., in the world with its devas, māras, and brahmakas, in this world with its monks and brahmans, and devas and people.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs gang zhe na /
translated: “What, Śāriputra, is the tathāgatas’ power of knowledge of the various dhātus?

original: 'di la sh'a ri'i bu /🔽de bzhin @95a *//
analyzed: 'di la sh'a ri'i bu / de bzhin @95a *//
translated: Here, Śāriputra,

original: gshegs pas thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //🔽ji ltar rab tu mkhyen ce na /🔽yang dag par nges pa'i sems can gyi khams rab tu mkhyen /
analyzed: gshegs pas thams cad du 'gro ba'i lam yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to // ji ltar rab tu mkhyen ce na / yang dag par nges pa'i sems can gyi khams rab tu mkhyen /
translated: the Tathāgata has the knowledge of the various dhātus.🔽He knows the dhātu of beings who are definite in their destiny.

original: yang dag par ma nges pa'i sems can gyi khams rab tu mkhyen /
analyzed: yang dag par ma nges pa'i sems can gyi khams rab tu mkhyen /
translated: He knows the dhātu of beings who are indefinite in their destiny.

original: log par nges pa'i sems can gyi khams rab tu mkhyen /
analyzed: log par nges pa'i sems can gyi khams rab tu mkhyen /
translated: He knows the realms of sentient beings who are certain to be wrong.

original: ma nges pa'i sems can gyi khams kyang de bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //🔽rgyu'i stobs can sngon gyi sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa zur tsam gyis go ba /
analyzed: ma nges pa'i sems can gyi khams kyang de bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to // rgyu'i stobs can sngon gyi sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa zur tsam gyis go ba /
translated: He also knows the realms of sentient beings who are uncertain.

original: dbang po rno ba'i sems can de dag la de bzhin gshegs pas chos bstan kyang rung /
analyzed: dbang po rno ba'i sems can de dag la de bzhin gshegs pas chos bstan kyang rung /
translated: “Those sentient beings who have the power of causes, who are endowed with previous training, who understand through just a hint, and who have sharp faculties, whether the Tathāgata teaches them the Dharma

original: ma bstan kyang rung /🔽de rnam par grol ba'i skal ba yod pa de dag de bzhin gshegs pas sngon gyi rgyu'i stobs mkhyen nas de bzhin du mthun par chos ston to; ;ma nges pa'i sems can gyi khams rkyen gyi stobs can yongs su smin par bya ba'i mtshan nyid can gal te
analyzed: ma bstan kyang rung / de rnam par grol ba'i skal ba yod pa de dag de bzhin gshegs pas sngon gyi rgyu'i stobs mkhyen nas de bzhin du mthun par chos ston to; ;ma nges pa'i sems can gyi khams rkyen gyi stobs can yongs su smin par bya ba'i mtshan nyid can gal te
translated: or not,🔽have the fortune of being liberated. The Tathāgata, knowing the power of their previous causes, teaches them the Dharma in a way that accords with that.

original: mthun par 'doms shing rjes su ston pa dang phrad na /
analyzed: mthun par 'doms shing rjes su ston pa dang phrad na /
translated: “The realms of sentient beings who are uncertain and have the power of conditions, who have the characteristic of being ripened, if they encounter being instructed and advised in a way that accords with that,

original: rnam par grol bar 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: rnam par grol bar 'gyur gyi /
translated: will be liberated.

original: rjes su ston pa dang ma phrad na /
analyzed: rjes su ston pa dang ma phrad na /
translated: If they do not encounter being instructed and advised,🔽they will not be liberated.

original: rnam par grol bar mi 'gyur ba de dag la yang de bzhin gshegs pas de ltar rkyen dang / rgyu dang ldan pa'i gtam yang dag par gsungs te /
analyzed: rnam par grol bar mi 'gyur ba de dag la yang de bzhin gshegs pas de ltar rkyen dang / rgyu dang ldan pa'i gtam yang dag par gsungs te /
translated: The Tathāgata teaches them the Dharma discourse that has the aspect of causes and conditions,

original: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa las chos de thos nas tshul bzhin rab tu sbyor bas 'bras bu thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pa las chos de thos nas tshul bzhin rab tu sbyor bas 'bras bu thob par 'gyur te /
translated: so that they will attain the fruit of right practice.

original: de dag gi don du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams 'jig rten du 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de dag gi don du sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams 'jig rten du 'byung ngo //
translated: For their sake, the Bhagavān Buddhas appear in the world.

original: @95b log par nges pa'i sems can gyi khams yongs su sbyang ba ma byas pa /
analyzed: @95b log par nges pa'i sems can gyi khams yongs su sbyang ba ma byas pa /
translated: “The Tathāgata teaches the Dharma to those beings who are not vessels, who have not purified the realm of a sentient being,

original: kho re chung ba /🔽blun pa / snod du ma gyur pa'i sems can de dag la de bzhin gshegs pas chos bstan kyang rung /
analyzed: kho re chung ba / blun pa / snod du ma gyur pa'i sems can de dag la de bzhin gshegs pas chos bstan kyang rung /
translated: who are of little faith,🔽who are foolish, and who are not vessels, whether or not they are vessels.

original: ma bstan kyang rung ste /
analyzed: ma bstan kyang rung ste /
translated: Whether or not he teaches them the Dharma,

original: rnam par grol ba'i skal pa med pa de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas snod ma yin par rig nas btang snyoms su 'jog ste /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i skal pa med pa de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas snod ma yin par rig nas btang snyoms su 'jog ste /
translated: the Tathāgata, knowing that they are not vessels, remains indifferent.

original: de dag gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams go gyon to //
analyzed: de dag gi phyir byang chub sems dpa' rnams go gyon to //
translated: For their sake, the bodhisattvas don their armor.

original: gzhan yang sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: gzhan yang sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Moreover, Śāriputra,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas 'dod chags kyi lam rnam pa gsum rab tu mkhyen te //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas 'dod chags kyi lam rnam pa gsum rab tu mkhyen te //
translated: the Tathāgata knows well the three kinds of paths of desire.

original: 'dod chags kyi lam sdug pa'i rnam pa las skye ba yang yod //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi lam sdug pa'i rnam pa las skye ba yang yod //
translated: There is a path of desire that arises from the aspect of beauty.

original: 'dod chags kyi lam rjes su chags pa'i rnam pa las skye ba yang yod /
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi lam rjes su chags pa'i rnam pa las skye ba yang yod /
translated: There is a path of desire that arises from the aspect of attachment.

original: 'dod chags kyi lam sngon gyi rgyu las skye ba yang yod do //
analyzed: 'dod chags kyi lam sngon gyi rgyu las skye ba yang yod do //
translated: There is a path of desire that arises from a previous cause.

original: zhes sdang gi lam rnam pa gsum yang rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: zhes sdang gi lam rnam pa gsum yang rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: He also knows well the three kinds of paths of hatred.

original: zhe sdang gi lam khong khro ba'i mtshan ma las skye ba yang yod /
analyzed: zhe sdang gi lam khong khro ba'i mtshan ma las skye ba yang yod /
translated: There is a path of hatred that arises from the aspect of anger.

original: bsam pa yongs su rdzogs pa las skye ba yang yod /
analyzed: bsam pa yongs su rdzogs pa las skye ba yang yod /
translated: There is a path of hatred that arises from the aspect of a completed thought.

original: sngon gyi bag la nyal ba las skye ba yang yod do //
analyzed: sngon gyi bag la nyal ba las skye ba yang yod do //
translated: There is a path of hatred that arises from a previous latent tendency.

original: gti mug gi lam rnam pa gsum yang rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: gti mug gi lam rnam pa gsum yang rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: He also knows well the three kinds of paths of delusion.

original: gti mug gi lam ma rig pa'i rgyu las skye ba yang yod /
analyzed: gti mug gi lam ma rig pa'i rgyu las skye ba yang yod /
translated: There is a path of delusion that arises from the cause of ignorance.

original: gti mug gi lam 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu las skye ba yang yod /
analyzed: gti mug gi lam 'jig tshogs la lta ba'i rgyu las skye ba yang yod /
translated: There is a path of delusion that arises from the cause of the view of the transitory collection.

original: gti mug gi lam the tshom gyi rgyu las skye ba yang yod do //
analyzed: gti mug gi lam the tshom gyi rgyu las skye ba yang yod do //
translated: There is also a path of delusion that arises from the cause of doubt.

original: de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata knows all of these just as they are.

original: gzhan yang sh'a ri'i bu /🔽dbang po rna ba'i phyir mngon par shes pa myur la sla ba'i lam yang de @96a *//
analyzed: gzhan yang sh'a ri'i bu / dbang po rna ba'i phyir mngon par shes pa myur la sla ba'i lam yang de @96a *//
translated: “Moreover, Śāriputra,

original: bzhin gshegs pas rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: bzhin gshegs pas rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: the Tathāgata knows the path of swift and easy supernormal knowledge due to the faculty of the ear.

original: dbang po rtul pa'i phyir mngon par shes pa bul la dka' ba'i lam yang rab tu mkhyen to //🔽dbang po rno ba'i phyir mngon par shes pa myur la sla ba'i lam yang rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: dbang po rtul pa'i phyir mngon par shes pa bul la dka' ba'i lam yang rab tu mkhyen to // dbang po rno ba'i phyir mngon par shes pa myur la sla ba'i lam yang rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows the path of slow and difficult supernormal knowledge due to the faculty of dullness.🔽He knows the path of swift and easy supernormal knowledge due to the faculty of sharpness.

original: dbang po rtul pa'i phyir mngon par shes pa bul la dka' ba'i lam yang rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: dbang po rtul pa'i phyir mngon par shes pa bul la dka' ba'i lam yang rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows the path of slow and difficult supernormal knowledge due to the faculty of dullness.

original: dmigs pa bor ba'i phyir mngon par shes pa bul la bul ba'i lam yang rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: dmigs pa bor ba'i phyir mngon par shes pa bul la bul ba'i lam yang rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows the path of slow and slow supernormal knowledge due to the faculty of being cast aside.

original: lam gyi rgyun ma bcad pa'i phyir mngon par shes pa myur la bul ba'i lam yang rab tu mkhyen to //🔽yongs su thug pa med par dbugs 'byin pa'i phyir mngon par shes pa bul la myur ba'i lam yang rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: lam gyi rgyun ma bcad pa'i phyir mngon par shes pa myur la bul ba'i lam yang rab tu mkhyen to // yongs su thug pa med par dbugs 'byin pa'i phyir mngon par shes pa bul la myur ba'i lam yang rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: He knows the path of quick and slow superknowledge in order to not cut off the continuity of the path.🔽He knows the path of slow and quick superknowledge in order to give rise to complete satisfaction.

original: de la ma chags pa'i phyir mngon par shes pa myur la bul ba'i lam yang rab tu mkhyen to //🔽so sor rtog pa'i stobs yongs su rdzogs par byed la sgom pa'i stobs la ma yin pa'i lam yang yod /
analyzed: de la ma chags pa'i phyir mngon par shes pa myur la bul ba'i lam yang rab tu mkhyen to // so sor rtog pa'i stobs yongs su rdzogs par byed la sgom pa'i stobs la ma yin pa'i lam yang yod /
translated: He knows the path of quick and slow superknowledge in order to not be attached to that.🔽There is a path that perfects the power of discernment but not the power of meditation.

original: sgom pa'i stobs yongs su rdzogs par byed la so sor rtog pa'i stobs la ma yin pa'i lam yang yod /
analyzed: sgom pa'i stobs yongs su rdzogs par byed la so sor rtog pa'i stobs la ma yin pa'i lam yang yod /
translated: There is a path that perfects the power of meditation but not the power of discernment.

original: sgoms pa'i stobs dang / so sor rtog pa'i stobs yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i lam yang yod /
analyzed: sgoms pa'i stobs dang / so sor rtog pa'i stobs yongs su rdzogs par byed pa'i lam yang yod /
translated: There is a path that perfects both the power of meditation and the power of discernment.

original: so sor rtog pa'i stobs dang / sgom pa'i stobs yongs su rdzogs par mi byed pa'i lam yang yod de /
analyzed: so sor rtog pa'i stobs dang / sgom pa'i stobs yongs su rdzogs par mi byed pa'i lam yang yod de /
translated: There is a path that does not perfect either the power of meditation or the power of discernment.

original: de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata knows them as they really are.

original: bsam pa @96b phun sum tshogs la sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa ma yin pa'i lam yang yod /
analyzed: bsam pa @96b phun sum tshogs la sbyor ba phun sum tshogs pa ma yin pa'i lam yang yod /
translated: “There is the path that is endowed with the right thought but not endowed with the right application.

original: sbyor ba phun sum tshogs la bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa ma yin pa'i lam yang yod /
analyzed: sbyor ba phun sum tshogs la bsam pa phun sum tshogs pa ma yin pa'i lam yang yod /
translated: There is the path that is endowed with the right application but not endowed with the right thought.

original: bsam pa yang phun sum tshogs pa ma yin la sbyor ba yang phun sum tshogs pa ma yin pa'i lam yang yod /
analyzed: bsam pa yang phun sum tshogs pa ma yin la sbyor ba yang phun sum tshogs pa ma yin pa'i lam yang yod /
translated: There is the path that is not endowed with the right thought and not endowed with the right application.

original: bsam pa yang phun sum tshogs la sbyor ba yang phun sum tshogs pa'i lam yang yod /
analyzed: bsam pa yang phun sum tshogs la sbyor ba yang phun sum tshogs pa'i lam yang yod /
translated: There is the path that is endowed with the right thought and endowed with the right application.

original: de yang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //🔽lus sbyong la ngag la ma yin sems la ma yin pa'i lam yang yod /🔽ngag sbyong la lus la ma yin sems la ma yin pa'i lam yang yod /
analyzed: de yang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to // lus sbyong la ngag la ma yin sems la ma yin pa'i lam yang yod / ngag sbyong la lus la ma yin sems la ma yin pa'i lam yang yod /
translated: The Tathāgata knows them as they really are.🔽“There is the path that purifies the body but not the speech and not the mind.🔽There is the path that purifies the speech but not the body and not the mind.

original: sems sbyong la lus lam yin dag lam yin pa'i lam yang yod /
analyzed: sems sbyong la lus lam yin dag lam yin pa'i lam yang yod /
translated: There is the path that purifies the mind but not the body and not the speech.

original: lus lam yin ngag lam yin la sems kyang mi sbyong ba'i lam yang yod /
analyzed: lus lam yin ngag lam yin la sems kyang mi sbyong ba'i lam yang yod /
translated: There are paths that are not purified by body, speech, or mind.

original: lus dang ngag dang sems sbyong ba'i lam yang yod de /
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang sems sbyong ba'i lam yang yod de /
translated: There are paths that are purified by body, speech, and mind.

original: de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata knows all of these as they truly are.

original: de ltar sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: de ltar sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Śāriputra,

original: sems can thams cad kyi 'jug pa'i rgyu dang / ldog pa'i rgyu'i lam ji snyed pa thams cad du de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes thogs pa med par 'jug go /
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi 'jug pa'i rgyu dang / ldog pa'i rgyu'i lam ji snyed pa thams cad du de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes thogs pa med par 'jug go /
translated: the Tathāgata’s wisdom penetrates all the causes of the engagement and disengagement of all beings.

original: de ltar sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: de ltar sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Śāriputra,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i kun tu 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs de ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i kun tu 'gro ba'i lam mkhyen pa'i stobs de ni /
translated: the Tathāgata’s power of knowing the path that leads everywhere

original: mtha' yas mu med nam mkha' dang mtshungs shing mnyam mo //
analyzed: mtha' yas mu med nam mkha' dang mtshungs shing mnyam mo //
translated: is infinite and limitless, and is equal to space.

original: byang chub sems dpas de thos nas mngon par dad /🔽yid ches / rab tu rtog /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas de thos nas mngon par dad / yid ches / rab tu rtog /
translated: ” When the bodhisattvas heard this, they had faith,🔽had confidence,

original: som @97a *// nyi med; the tshom mi za /
analyzed: som @97a *// nyi med; the tshom mi za /
translated: had certainty, and were without doubt or hesitation.

original: rgya cher dga' mgu ste rangs pa rnyed cing nam mkha' lta bur bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir ngo mtshar dang / rmad du 'du shes bskyed do; ;de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis don de nyid rgya cher bstan pa'i phyir de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs so //
analyzed: rgya cher dga' mgu ste rangs pa rnyed cing nam mkha' lta bur bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir ngo mtshar dang / rmad du 'du shes bskyed do; ;de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis don de nyid rgya cher bstan pa'i phyir de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs so //
translated: Then the Bhagavat, in order to teach this topic in detail, recited these verses:

original: thams cad lam ni bde gshegs rab tu mkhyen //
analyzed: thams cad lam ni bde gshegs rab tu mkhyen //
translated: The Sugata knows all the paths.

original: sems can khams ni nges rgyu bcas pa mkhyen //
analyzed: sems can khams ni nges rgyu bcas pa mkhyen //
translated: He knows the realms of sentient beings and their various courses.🔽He knows the characteristics of complete ripening, the uncertainty,

original: yongs su smin pa'i mtshan nyid ma nges dang // de bzhin dbang po rgyu dang ldan pa mkhyen //
analyzed: yongs su smin pa'i mtshan nyid ma nges dang // de bzhin dbang po rgyu dang ldan pa mkhyen //
translated: And likewise the faculties and their causes.

original: 'dod chags lam ni rnam pa gsum dang ldan //
analyzed: 'dod chags lam ni rnam pa gsum dang ldan //
translated: The path of desire is endowed with three aspects.

original: zhe sdang lam gsum de bzhin gti mug ldan //
analyzed: zhe sdang lam gsum de bzhin gti mug ldan //
translated: The path of hatred is threefold, and likewise the path of delusion.

original: rnam gsum rgya chen mtha' yas nyon mongs ldan //
analyzed: rnam gsum rgya chen mtha' yas nyon mongs ldan //
translated: The path of the three is endowed with the afflictions of the vast and the limitless.

original: lam la rkyen dang rgyu ni ston pas mkhyen //
analyzed: lam la rkyen dang rgyu ni ston pas mkhyen //
translated: The Teacher knows the conditions and causes of the path.

original: dka' ba'i lam la rno bar 'gyur ba dang // de bzhin dbang po rtul zhing bul ba dang // sla ba'i lam la rno bar 'gyur ba dang // de bzhin bul ba'ang 'jig rten mgon pos mkhyen //
analyzed: dka' ba'i lam la rno bar 'gyur ba dang // de bzhin dbang po rtul zhing bul ba dang // sla ba'i lam la rno bar 'gyur ba dang // de bzhin bul ba'ang 'jig rten mgon pos mkhyen //
translated: “The Protector of the World knows those who are sharp on the difficult path, And those who are dull and slow, And those who are sharp on the easy path, And those who are slow, too.

original: bul ba'i lam la sbyor ba bul ba yod; ;de bzhin bul ba yin la sbyor ba rno //
analyzed: bul ba'i lam la sbyor ba bul ba yod; ;de bzhin bul ba yin la sbyor ba rno //
translated: “There are those who are slow on the slow path, And those who are slow but sharp,

original: myur ba'i lam la bul bar 'gyur ba dang // de bzhin de la ma chags myur ba'ang yod //
analyzed: myur ba'i lam la bul bar 'gyur ba dang // de bzhin de la ma chags myur ba'ang yod //
translated: And those who are slow on the fast path, And those who are fast without attachment.

original: lam ni so sor rtog pa skyed byed la //
analyzed: lam ni so sor rtog pa skyed byed la //
translated: “The path may produce discernment,

original: yang dag sgom pa skyed pa ma yin dang // sgom pa dag ni skyed par byed pa dang // gnyis ka khyad par sbyor ldan skyed pa yod //
analyzed: yang dag sgom pa skyed pa ma yin dang // sgom pa dag ni skyed par byed pa dang // gnyis ka khyad par sbyor ldan skyed pa yod //
translated: But not the correct meditation, Or it may produce the meditation, Or it may produce both in combination.

original: lam ni bsam pa yongs su sbyong byed la //
analyzed: lam ni bsam pa yongs su sbyong byed la //
translated: “The path may purify the intention,

original: sbyor ba dag ni sbyong @97b bar mi byed yod //
analyzed: sbyor ba dag ni sbyong @97b bar mi byed yod //
translated: But not the application,

original: res 'ga' gnyis ka sbyong bar byed pa'ang yod //
analyzed: res 'ga' gnyis ka sbyong bar byed pa'ang yod //
translated: Or it may purify both.

original: de dag sangs rgyas thams cad gzigs pas mkhyen //
analyzed: de dag sangs rgyas thams cad gzigs pas mkhyen //
translated: All of these are known by the Buddha, the Omniscient One.

original: lus ni rnam par sbyong la ngag mi sbyong //
analyzed: lus ni rnam par sbyong la ngag mi sbyong //
translated: They purify the body but not the speech,🔽And they do not purify the mind.

original: sems kyang rnam par sbyong ba ma yin dang // ngag rnams dang ni lus kyang rab sbyong la //
analyzed: sems kyang rnam par sbyong ba ma yin dang // ngag rnams dang ni lus kyang rab sbyong la //
translated: They purify the speech and the body,

original: sems ni res 'ga' mi sbyong ba yang yod //🔽sems ni rab sbyong ngag la ma yin te //
analyzed: sems ni res 'ga' mi sbyong ba yang yod // sems ni rab sbyong ngag la ma yin te //
translated: But sometimes they do not purify the mind.🔽They purify the mind but not the speech,🔽And they do not purify the body.

original: lus kyang rnam par sbyong ba ma yin dang // ngag dang de bzhin sems kyang rab sbyong la //
analyzed: lus kyang rnam par sbyong ba ma yin dang // ngag dang de bzhin sems kyang rab sbyong la //
translated: They purify the speech and the body,

original: res 'ga' lus ni sbyong bar mi 'gyur yod //
analyzed: res 'ga' lus ni sbyong bar mi 'gyur yod //
translated: But sometimes they do not purify the body.🔽They purify the path of the body, and likewise the speech and mind,🔽And how they turn back and engage—

original: lus dang de bzhin ngag sems sbyong lam dang // ji ltar ldog dang 'jug par 'gyur ba rnams; ;sangs rgyas thams cad gzigs pas rab mkhyen te //
analyzed: lus dang de bzhin ngag sems sbyong lam dang // ji ltar ldog dang 'jug par 'gyur ba rnams; ;sangs rgyas thams cad gzigs pas rab mkhyen te //
translated: All the buddhas, with their vision, know this.

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs kyi stobs drug pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs kyi stobs drug pa'o //
translated: This is the sixth power of the tathāgatas.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Śāriputra,

original: 'di ni / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi stobs drug pa ste; stobs de dang ldan pas de bzhin gshegs pa khyu mchog gi gnas su zhal gyis 'che ba nas sus kyang 'jig rten du chos dang mthun pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: 'di ni / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi stobs drug pa ste; stobs de dang ldan pas de bzhin gshegs pa khyu mchog gi gnas su zhal gyis 'che ba nas sus kyang 'jig rten du chos dang mthun pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: This is the sixth power of the Tathāgatas. Endowed with this power, the Tathāgata claims the place of the chief bull, and roars the lion’s roar in the assemblies.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar ba dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang ldang ba mkhyen pa'i stobs gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar ba dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang ldang ba mkhyen pa'i stobs gang zhe na /
translated: “What is the Tathāgata’s power of knowledge of what is right and wrong?

original: 'di la sh'a ri'i bu /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa bdag dang / pha rol gyi bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / @98a *//
analyzed: 'di la sh'a ri'i bu / de bzhin gshegs pa bdag dang / pha rol gyi bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / @98a *//
translated: Here, Śāriputra,🔽the Tathāgata has the knowledge of the right and wrong ways of entering the absorptions, liberations, concentrations, and attainments,

original: rnam par byang ba dang ldang ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: rnam par byang ba dang ldang ba yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: and of the afflictions and purification related to them.

original: ji ltar rab tu mkhyen ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar rab tu mkhyen ce na /

original: sems can rnams kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu gang yin pa dang / rkyen gang yin pa de yang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu gang yin pa dang / rkyen gang yin pa de yang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //

original: sems can rnams kyi rnam par dag pa'i rgyu gang yin pa dang / rkyen gang yin pa de yang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to //🔽de la rgyu gang /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi rnam par dag pa'i rgyu gang yin pa dang / rkyen gang yin pa de yang de bzhin gshegs pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen to // de la rgyu gang /

original: rkyen gang zhe na /
analyzed: rkyen gang zhe na /

original: sems can thams cad kyi kun nas nyon mongs pa'i rgyu ni /

original: gzhan yang rgyu gnyis dang / rkyen gnyis te /

analyzed: skye ba med par rab tu rtog pa dang / nges par gyur ba la mi reg pa'o //

original: gzhan yang rgyu gnyis dang / rkyen gnyis te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rgyu gnyis dang / rkyen gnyis te /

analyzed: rkang par ldan pa dang / rig pas rnam par grol ba mngon sum du byed pa'o //

analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo la sgom pa dang / rang bzhin kyis rnam par grol bar shes pa'o //

analyzed: zad pa shes pa dang / mi skye ba shes pa'o //

original: gzhan yang rgyu gnyis dang / rkyen gnyis te /
analyzed: gzhan yang rgyu gnyis dang / rkyen gnyis te /

analyzed: bden pa rjes su rtogs pa dang / bden pa rjes su 'thob pa'o //

original: rgyu de dang / rkyen de dag ni /
analyzed: rgyu de dang / rkyen de dag ni /

analyzed: gzhan yang sh'a ri'i bu /

analyzed: rnam par dag par dmigs pa yang tshad med do //

original: sh'a ri'i bu /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa ni /🔽ye shes 'di lta bu dang ldan pas 'dod pa dag las dben pa /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu / de bzhin gshegs pa ni / ye shes 'di lta bu dang ldan pas 'dod pa dag las dben pa /
translated: There is also the establishment of the object of affliction through thorough discernment of reality in the object of purification, and the establishment of the object of purification in the object of affliction.🔽There is also the establishment of the object of affliction through thorough discernment of reality in the object of purification, and the establishment of the object of purification in the object of affliction.🔽There is also the establishment of the object of affliction through thorough discernment of reality in the object of purification, and the establishment of the object of purification in the object of affliction.🔽There is also the establishment of the object of affliction through thorough discernment of reality in the object of purification, and the establishment of the object of purification in the object of affliction.🔽There is also the establishment of the object of affliction through thorough discernment of reality in the object of purification, and the establishment of the object of purification in the object of affliction.

original: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa /
analyzed: sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnams las dben pa /
translated: There is also the establishment of the object of affliction through thorough discernment of reality in the object of purification, and the establishment of the object of purification in the object of affliction.🔽There is also the establishment of the object of affliction through thorough discernment of reality in the object of purification, and the establishment of the object of purification in the object of affliction.🔽There is also the establishment of the object of affliction through thorough discernment of reality in the object of purification, and the establishment of the object

original: rtog pa dang bcas pa dpyod pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: rtog pa dang bcas pa dpyod pa dang bcas pa /
translated: with thought and investigation,

original: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan dang po rdzogs par byas te gnas so //
analyzed: dben pa las skyes pa'i dga' ba dang bde ba can bsam gtan dang po rdzogs par byas te gnas so //
translated: and with the joy and bliss born of seclusion.

original: bsam gtan dang po rdzogs par byas te gnas nas 'gog pa las ldang ba dang / 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs nas bsam gtan dang po las ldang ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po rdzogs par byas te gnas nas 'gog pa las ldang ba dang / 'gog pa la snyoms par zhugs nas bsam gtan dang po las ldang ba'i bar du'o //
translated: Having perfected the first concentration, he rises from the first concentration and enters the cessation attainment, and having entered the cessation attainment, he rises in the first concentration.

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad la rjes su mthun par snyoms par 'jug go /🔽mi mthun par yang @99b snyoms par 'jug go /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad la rjes su mthun par snyoms par 'jug go / mi mthun par yang @99b snyoms par 'jug go /
translated: He enters the eight liberations in forward order.🔽He enters the eight liberations in reverse order.

original: rjes su mthun pa dang mi mthun par snyoms par 'jug ste /
analyzed: rjes su mthun pa dang mi mthun par snyoms par 'jug ste /
translated: He enters the eight liberations in forward and reverse order.

original: brgyad gang zhe na /
analyzed: brgyad gang zhe na /
translated: What are the eight?

original: 'di lta ste /🔽gzugs can gzugs rnams la lta ba 'di ni /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / gzugs can gzugs rnams la lta ba 'di ni /
translated: They are as follows:

original: rnam par thar pa dang po'o //🔽nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams la lta ba 'di ni /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa dang po'o // nang gzugs med par 'du shes pas phyi rol gyi gzugs rnams la lta ba 'di ni /
translated: The first liberation is when one with form sees forms.

original: rnam par thar pa gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa gnyis pa'o //
translated: The second liberation is when one who is without internal form perceives forms.

original: sdug pa'i rnam par thar pa la sdug pa nyid du mos par 'gyur ba de ni; rnam par thar pa gsum pa'o //🔽nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la snyoms par 'jug pa de ni /
analyzed: sdug pa'i rnam par thar pa la sdug pa nyid du mos par 'gyur ba de ni; rnam par thar pa gsum pa'o // nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la snyoms par 'jug pa de ni /
translated: The third liberation is the liberation of the will to beauty in the form of the beautiful.

original: rnam par thar pa bzhi pa'o //🔽rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched la snyoms par 'jug pa de ni /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa bzhi pa'o // rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched la snyoms par 'jug pa de ni /
translated: The fourth liberation is the attainment of the sphere of infinite space.

original: rnam par thar pa lnga pa'o //🔽ci yang med pa'i skye mched la snyoms par 'jug pa de ni /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa lnga pa'o // ci yang med pa'i skye mched la snyoms par 'jug pa de ni /
translated: The fifth liberation is the attainment of the sphere of infinite consciousness.

original: rnam par thar pa drug pa'o //🔽'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la snyoms par 'jug pa de ni /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa drug pa'o // 'du shes med 'du shes med min skye mched la snyoms par 'jug pa de ni /
translated: The sixth liberation is the attainment of the sphere of nothingness.

original: rnam par thar pa bdun pa'o //🔽'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa de ni /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa bdun pa'o // 'du shes dang tshor ba 'gog pa de ni /
translated: The seventh liberation is the attainment of the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception.

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad pa ste /
translated: The eighth liberation is the attainment of the cessation of perception and feeling.🔽These are the eight liberations.

original: rnam par thar pa brgyad po 'di dag la rjes su mthun pa dang / mi mthun par yang snyoms par 'jug /🔽snrel zhir yang snyoms par 'jug go /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa brgyad po 'di dag la rjes su mthun pa dang / mi mthun par yang snyoms par 'jug /🔽snrel zhir yang snyoms par 'jug go /
translated: One enters into them in a progressive and reverse order, and also in a leaping manner.

original: ting nge 'dzin la yang ting nge 'dzin ston la /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la yang ting nge 'dzin ston la /
translated: He teaches samādhi.

original: snyoms par 'jug pas rtogs par ston kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la tha dad par 'gyur ba gang yang med /
analyzed: snyoms par 'jug pas rtogs par ston kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin la tha dad par 'gyur ba gang yang med /
translated: He teaches realization through meditative absorption, but there is no difference in the samādhi of the tathāgatas.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni /
translated: The Tathāgata

original: ting nge 'dzin la dmigs pa las ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par gzhag par bya ba med /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la dmigs pa las ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par gzhag par bya ba med /
translated: does not enter samādhi by observing samādhi.

original: @100a *// de bzhin gshegs pa ni /
analyzed: @100a *// de bzhin gshegs pa ni /
translated: The Tathāgata

original: ting nge 'dzin gcig gis ting nge 'dzin thams cad 'grub bo //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gcig gis ting nge 'dzin thams cad 'grub bo //
translated: accomplishes all samādhis through a single samādhi.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni /
translated: The Tathāgata

original: ting nge 'dzin las ma bzhengs par ting nge 'dzin thams cad la snyoms par 'jug kyang de bzhin gshegs pa ni /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin las ma bzhengs par ting nge 'dzin thams cad la snyoms par 'jug kyang de bzhin gshegs pa ni /
translated: enters into all samādhis without rising from a single samādhi.🔽The Tathāgata

original: sems gcig nas gcig tu 'jug pa med do //
analyzed: sems gcig nas gcig tu 'jug pa med do //
translated: does not move from one mind to another.🔽The Tathāgata

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la sems mnyam par ma gzhag pa mi dmigs so //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la sems mnyam par ma gzhag pa mi dmigs so //
translated: does not observe an unbalanced mind.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin de sus kyang lta mi nus te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin de sus kyang lta mi nus te /
translated: No one can see the samādhi of the Tathāgata.

original: nyan thos kyi ting nge 'dzin ni /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi ting nge 'dzin ni /
translated: The samādhi of the śrāvakas

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi ting nge 'dzin gyis zil gyis non to //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi ting nge 'dzin gyis zil gyis non to //
translated: and the meditative absorption of the pratyekabuddhas.🔽

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi ting nge 'dzin ni /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi ting nge 'dzin ni /
translated: The samādhi of the pratyekabuddhas is outshone.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis zil gyis non to //🔽byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin ni /🔽sangs rgyas kyi ting nge 'dzin gyis zil gyis non to; ;de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin gyis zil gyis non to // byang chub sems dpa'i ting nge 'dzin ni / sangs rgyas kyi ting nge 'dzin gyis zil gyis non to; ;de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin ni /
translated: The samādhi of the bodhisattvas is outshone.🔽The samādhi of the buddhas is outshone.

original: zil gyis ma non pa ste /
analyzed: zil gyis ma non pa ste /
translated: The samādhi of the tathāgatas is not outshone.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes ni /
translated: The wisdom of the tathāgatas

original: zil gyis ma non par 'jug go /🔽gdams pa gang dang rjes su bstan pa gang gis nyan thos rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin bskyed pa de yang de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: zil gyis ma non par 'jug go / gdams pa gang dang rjes su bstan pa gang gis nyan thos rnams kyi ting nge 'dzin bskyed pa de yang de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: is not outshone.🔽The Tathāgata knows the instructions and teachings through which the samādhis of the śrāvakas are produced.

original: de bzhin du rang sangs rgyas kyi dang / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de bzhin du rang sangs rgyas kyi dang / de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata knows the instructions and teachings through which the samādhis of the pratyekabuddhas and bodhisattvas are produced.

original: mkhyen nas kyang de bzhin du 'doms shing de bzhin du rjes su ston to //
analyzed: mkhyen nas kyang de bzhin du 'doms shing de bzhin du rjes su ston to //
translated: Knowing this, he teaches accordingly and instructs accordingly.

original: de ltar sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: de ltar sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: In this way, Śāriputra,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsam gtan dang / rnam @100b par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang ldang ba mkhyen pa'i stobs de ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i bsam gtan dang / rnam @100b par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa'i kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba dang ldang ba mkhyen pa'i stobs de ni /
translated: the Tathāgata’s power of knowing the defilements, purification, and emergence of the concentrations, liberations, meditative stabilizations, and absorptions

original: mtha' yas mu med de /
analyzed: mtha' yas mu med de /
translated: is infinite and limitless.

original: nam mkha' dang mtshungs shing mnyam mo //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang mtshungs shing mnyam mo //
translated: It is equal to and the same as space.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de thos nas mngon par dad /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de thos nas mngon par dad /
translated: When the bodhisattvas hear this, they have faith,

original: yid ches / rab tu rtog /🔽som nyi med /
analyzed: yid ches / rab tu rtog / som nyi med /
translated: they have confidence, they have conviction,🔽they are without doubt,

original: the tshom mi za /
analyzed: the tshom mi za /
translated: they are without uncertainty,

original: rgya cher dga' mgu ste rangs pa rnyed cing nam mkha' lta bur bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir ngo mtshar dang / rmad du 'du shes bskyed do //
analyzed: rgya cher dga' mgu ste rangs pa rnyed cing nam mkha' lta bur bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir ngo mtshar dang / rmad du 'du shes bskyed do //
translated: and they are overjoyed, delighted, and rejoice. Because it is inconceivable like space, they develop the perception of wonder and amazement.

original: 'di la chos nyid ni /
analyzed: 'di la chos nyid ni /
translated: Here is the reality of this:

original: 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di yin te /
translated: it is like this.

original: de la 'di skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces bya'o //
translated: This is what is said about it:

original: gang gis sems can nyon mongs shing //
analyzed: gang gis sems can nyon mongs shing //
translated: “Those who are afflicted by afflictions

original: gang gis sems can rnams dag 'gyur //
analyzed: gang gis sems can rnams dag 'gyur //
translated: By which sentient beings are purified.

original: de yang dpa' bo chen pos mkhyen //
analyzed: de yang dpa' bo chen pos mkhyen //
translated: The Great Hero knows that too.

original: mkhyen nas gtam rnams ston par mdzad //
analyzed: mkhyen nas gtam rnams ston par mdzad //
translated: Knowing, he teaches the discourses.

original: gang du ma rig skye 'gyur ba //
analyzed: gang du ma rig skye 'gyur ba //
translated: Where ignorance arises,

original: nyon mongs rgyu ni tshul bzhin min //
analyzed: nyon mongs rgyu ni tshul bzhin min //
translated: The cause of afflictions is incorrect thinking.

original: de yi rkyen ni 'du byed de //
analyzed: de yi rkyen ni 'du byed de //
translated: Its condition is formation,

original: sdug bsngal rab tu skye bar 'gyur //
analyzed: sdug bsngal rab tu skye bar 'gyur //
translated: From which suffering arises.

original: srid pa'i yan lag skyed pa yi //
analyzed: srid pa'i yan lag skyed pa yi //
translated: The limbs of existence are produced

original: thams cad rtsa ba tshul bzhin min //
analyzed: thams cad rtsa ba tshul bzhin min //
translated: From the root of incorrect thinking.

original: de nyid sangs rgyas rab mkhyen nas //
analyzed: de nyid sangs rgyas rab mkhyen nas //
translated: The Buddha knows that reality

original: de bzhin du yang ston par mdzad //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang ston par mdzad //
translated: And teaches it accordingly.

original: las kyi rtsa ba nyon mongs pa //
analyzed: las kyi rtsa ba nyon mongs pa //
translated: The root of karma is the afflictions,

original: mi mkhas mngon par 'du byed de //🔽sdug bsngal 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i bar //
analyzed: mi mkhas mngon par 'du byed de // sdug bsngal 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i bar //
translated: Which the unwise form.🔽The condition of that is consciousness,

original: de yi rkyen ni rnam par shes //
analyzed: de yi rkyen ni rnam par shes //
translated: Which leads to the arising of suffering.

original: gang gis sems can dag 'gyur ba //
analyzed: gang gis sems can dag 'gyur ba //
translated: By which sentient beings are purified

original: rgyu gnyis dang ni rkyen gnyis te //
analyzed: rgyu gnyis dang ni rkyen gnyis te //
translated: Are the two causes and two conditions:🔽The concordant sound from another

original: gzhan las rjes su mthun sgra dang // nang du tshul bzhin lta ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan las rjes su mthun sgra dang // nang du tshul bzhin lta ba'o //
translated: And the proper view within.

original: tshul bzhin rgyu ni zhi gnas te //
analyzed: tshul bzhin rgyu ni zhi gnas te //
translated: The proper cause is śamatha,

original: lhag mthong bar ni rkyen yin no //
analyzed: lhag mthong bar ni rkyen yin no //
translated: And the conditions for insight.🔽The Guide knows well

original: sems can gang gis 'gror 'gyur @101a *//🔽ba; ;de yang 'dren pas rab tu mkhyen //
analyzed: sems can gang gis 'gror 'gyur @101a *// ba; ;de yang 'dren pas rab tu mkhyen //
translated: Which beings will go to which realms.

original: tshul khrims la ni rnal 'byor gnas //
analyzed: tshul khrims la ni rnal 'byor gnas //
translated: The yogi who abides in discipline

original: chos rnams stong par rab tu rtogs //
analyzed: chos rnams stong par rab tu rtogs //
translated: Realizes phenomena to be empty.

original: thar pa'i sgo ni bsgoms pas na //
analyzed: thar pa'i sgo ni bsgoms pas na //
translated: By meditating on the door of liberation,

original: srid pa dog las thar par 'gyur //
analyzed: srid pa dog las thar par 'gyur //
translated: They will be liberated from the prison of existence.

original: de dag sangs rgyas rab mkhyen nas //🔽rnam sbyong skyes bu bud med la //
analyzed: de dag sangs rgyas rab mkhyen nas // rnam sbyong skyes bu bud med la //
translated: The Buddha, knowing this,🔽Teaches emptiness and signlessness🔽To men and women

original: stong pa nyid dang mtshan med dang // rnam par thar pa rab tu ston //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang mtshan med dang // rnam par thar pa rab tu ston //
translated: Who are to be trained.

original: bsam gtan la ni snyoms zhugs pa //
analyzed: bsam gtan la ni snyoms zhugs pa //
translated: Those who enter into meditative concentration,

original: rang rgyal dang ni nyan thos rnams //
analyzed: rang rgyal dang ni nyan thos rnams //
translated: The pratyekabuddhas and the śrāvakas,

original: de dag rnams kyang dog par bshad //
analyzed: de dag rnams kyang dog par bshad //
translated: They too are said to be in a prison.

original: de yi 'gran zla yod par gsungs //
analyzed: de yi 'gran zla yod par gsungs //
translated: It is said they have rivals.

original: sangs rgyas bsam gtan rnam thar la //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bsam gtan rnam thar la //
translated: The Buddha’s meditative concentrations and liberations

original: dgra dang bcas med dog pa med //
analyzed: dgra dang bcas med dog pa med //
translated: Have no rivals and no prison.

original: sangs rgyas kyi ni stobs bdun pa //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ni stobs bdun pa //
translated: The Buddha’s seventh power

original: pha rol rgol bas thul bar dka'//
analyzed: pha rol rgol bas thul bar dka'//
translated: Is difficult for opponents to overcome.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: 'di ni / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bdun pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyis de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bdun pa ste /
translated: This is the seventh power of the Tathāgata.

original: stobs de dang ldan pas de bzhin gshegs pa khyu mchog gi gnas su zhal gyis 'che ba nas sus kyang 'jig rten 'dir chos dang mthun par zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: stobs de dang ldan pas de bzhin gshegs pa khyu mchog gi gnas su zhal gyis 'che ba nas sus kyang 'jig rten 'dir chos dang mthun par zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: Endowed with this power, the Tathāgata claims the place of the chief bull,🔽roars his lion’s roar in the assemblies, and sets rolling the Wheel of Brahmā.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mngon sum du byed pa mkhyen pa'i stobs gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mngon sum du byed pa mkhyen pa'i stobs gang zhe na /
translated: “What, Śāriputra, is the Tathāgata’s knowledge of the recollection of former abodes and existences?

original: 'di la sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: 'di la sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Here, Śāriputra,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas bla na med pa'i ye shes kyis bdag dang sems can gzhan rnams dang / gang zag gzhan dag gi sngon gyi gnas rnam pa du ma rjes su dran no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas bla na med pa'i ye shes kyis bdag dang sems can gzhan rnams dang / gang zag gzhan dag gi sngon gyi gnas rnam pa du ma rjes su dran no //
translated: the Tathāgata, with his unsurpassed knowledge, recollects his various former abodes and existences.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: That is to say,

original: skye ba gcig gam /
analyzed: skye ba gcig gam /
translated: he recollects one birth,🔽two births,

original: gnyis sam / gsum mam /
analyzed: gnyis sam / gsum mam /
translated: three births,🔽four births,

original: bzhi'am / lnga'am @101b bcu'am /
analyzed: bzhi'am / lnga'am @101b bcu'am /
translated: five births,🔽ten births,🔽twenty births,

original: nyi shu'am / sum cu'am /
analyzed: nyi shu'am / sum cu'am /
translated: thirty births,🔽forty births,

original: bzhi bcu'am / lnga bcu'am /🔽skye ba brgya'am /
analyzed: bzhi bcu'am / lnga bcu'am / skye ba brgya'am /
translated: fifty births,🔽a hundred births,

original: skye ba stong ngam /
analyzed: skye ba stong ngam /
translated: a thousand births,🔽a hundred thousand births,

original: skye ba brgya stong nas skye ba bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong gi bar du rjes su dran no //
analyzed: skye ba brgya stong nas skye ba bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong gi bar du rjes su dran no //
translated: I remember one hundred thousand eons, up to many quintillions of eons.

original: 'jig pa'i bskal pa'am /🔽'chags pa'i bskal pa'am /
analyzed: 'jig pa'i bskal pa'am / 'chags pa'i bskal pa'am /
translated: I remember many eons of destruction,🔽many eons of evolution,

original: 'jig pa dang 'chags pa'i bskal pa'am /🔽'jig pa'i bskal pa du ma'am /
analyzed: 'jig pa dang 'chags pa'i bskal pa'am / 'jig pa'i bskal pa du ma'am /
translated: many eons of destruction and evolution,🔽many eons of destruction,

original: 'chags pa'i bskal pa du ma'am /
analyzed: 'chags pa'i bskal pa du ma'am /
translated: many eons of evolution,🔽many eons of destruction and evolution.

original: 'jig pa dang 'chags pa'i bskal pa du ma zhig na nga sngon che ge mo zhig tu byung ste /
analyzed: 'jig pa dang 'chags pa'i bskal pa du ma zhig na nga sngon che ge mo zhig tu byung ste /

original: ming ni / 'di zhes bya /🔽rus ni / 'di zhes bya /
analyzed: ming ni / 'di zhes bya / rus ni / 'di zhes bya /
translated: with such and such a name,

original: rigs ni / 'di zhes bya /🔽zas ni / 'di lta bu zhig za za /
analyzed: rigs ni / 'di zhes bya / zas ni / 'di lta bu zhig za za /
translated: such and such a family,🔽such and such food,

original: kha dog ni /
analyzed: kha dog ni /
translated: such and such a life span,

original: 'di lta bu /🔽mtshan ma ni /🔽'di lta bu /
analyzed: 'di lta bu / mtshan ma ni / 'di lta bu /
translated: such and such a long or short life,

original: dbyibs ni / 'di lta bu /
analyzed: dbyibs ni / 'di lta bu /
translated: such and such a good or bad appearance,🔽such and such a good or bad complexion,🔽such and such a good or bad body,

original: tshe ni / 'di tsam zhig thub /🔽yun ni / 'di srid cig gnas /🔽bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ni /
analyzed: tshe ni / 'di tsam zhig thub / yun ni / 'di srid cig gnas / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ni /
translated: such and such a good or bad life,

original: 'di lta bu zhig myong ste /
analyzed: 'di lta bu zhig myong ste /
translated: such and such a good or bad experience of pleasure and pain.

original: bdag de nas shi 'phos nas che ge mo zhig tu skyes so //
analyzed: bdag de nas shi 'phos nas che ge mo zhig tu skyes so //
translated: I died there and was born here.

original: bdag de nas shi 'phos nas 'dir skyes so //
analyzed: bdag de nas shi 'phos nas 'dir skyes so //
translated: I died from there and was reborn here.

original: zhes 'di lta bu'i rnam pa dang bcas /
analyzed: zhes 'di lta bu'i rnam pa dang bcas /
translated: In this way, with such aspects,

original: yul phyogs dang bcas /
analyzed: yul phyogs dang bcas /
translated: with such a region,

original: gzhi ci las gyur pa dang bcas par bdag dang gzhan gyi sngon gyi gnas du ma rjes su dran no //
analyzed: gzhi ci las gyur pa dang bcas par bdag dang gzhan gyi sngon gyi gnas du ma rjes su dran no //
translated: with such a basis, I and others remember many former abodes.

original: sems can gang gi sngon gyi rgyu ji lta bu dang / rgyu gang gis sems can du 'gyur ba'i rgyu de yang de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: sems can gang gi sngon gyi rgyu ji lta bu dang / rgyu gang gis sems can du 'gyur ba'i rgyu de yang de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: The Tathāgata knows the past causes of sentient beings, and the causes by which sentient beings become causes of sentient beings.

original: mkhyen nas kyang de bzhin du chos ston to //
analyzed: mkhyen nas kyang de bzhin du chos ston to //
translated: Knowing that, he teaches the Dharma accordingly.

original: 'das pa'i sems can thams cad kyi 'das pa'i sems kyi rgyud kyang rab tu mkhyen no //
analyzed: 'das pa'i sems can thams cad kyi 'das pa'i sems kyi rgyud kyang rab tu mkhyen no //
translated: He also knows the past mental continuums of all sentient beings in the past.

original: sems gang gi 'og tu gang la dmigs pa'i sems skyes pa dang / @102a *//
analyzed: sems gang gi 'og tu gang la dmigs pa'i sems skyes pa dang / @102a *//
translated: He knows the mind that arises in dependence on which mind, and the object of observation on which it focuses.🔽He also knows all the objects of observation that cease due to incompleteness.

original: dmigs pa gang ma tshang bas 'gags pa de thams cad kyang de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: dmigs pa gang ma tshang bas 'gags pa de thams cad kyang de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata knows all that.

original: de ltar sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: de ltar sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Śāriputra,

original: gang sems can gcig gi sems gcig nas gcig tu sems 'di lta bu zhig gi 'og tu sems 'di lta bu zhig byung ngo //🔽zhes bya ba de ni /
analyzed: gang sems can gcig gi sems gcig nas gcig tu sems 'di lta bu zhig gi 'og tu sems 'di lta bu zhig byung ngo // zhes bya ba de ni /
translated: If one knows the mind of one being,🔽then one knows the mind of all beings.🔽

original: bskal pa gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du yang tshig gis bshad pas ston par mi nus te /
analyzed: bskal pa gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du yang tshig gis bshad pas ston par mi nus te /
translated: “The mind of a single being, from one lifetime to the next, is such that it is impossible to describe it in words, even in as many eons as there are grains of sand in the Ganges River.

original: de bzhin du sems can thams cad kyi yang thams cad de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de bzhin du sems can thams cad kyi yang thams cad de bzhin du de bzhin gshegs pas rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: In the same way, the Thus-Gone One knows the minds of all beings in their entirety.

original: tha ma'i mtha'i bar gyi bskal par de bzhin gshegs pas sems can de dag gi sems rnams bshad kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes mthar thug bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: tha ma'i mtha'i bar gyi bskal par de bzhin gshegs pas sems can de dag gi sems rnams bshad kyang de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes mthar thug bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Even if the Thus-Gone One were to describe the minds of those beings for eons equal to the number of grains of sand in the Ganges River, the Thus-Gone One’s wisdom would not reach its limit.

original: de ltar sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: de ltar sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mngon sum du byed pa mkhyen pa'i stobs ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mngon sum du byed pa mkhyen pa'i stobs ni /
translated: the Thus-Gone One’s knowledge of the ability to recollect past lives

original: bsam gyis mi khyab /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab /
translated: is inconceivable,

original: mtshungs pa med /
analyzed: mtshungs pa med /
translated: incomparable,

original: tshad med / grangs med /
analyzed: tshad med / grangs med /
translated: immeasurable,

original: brjod du med de /
analyzed: brjod du med de /
translated: and inexpressible.

original: de'i mtha'i gnas ni /
analyzed: de'i mtha'i gnas ni /
translated: Its limit

original: bde bar bstan mi nus so //🔽sangs rgyas kyi khyu mchog tu gyur pas de bzhin gshegs pa sems can de dag la kye sems can rnams /
analyzed: bde bar bstan mi nus so // sangs rgyas kyi khyu mchog tu gyur pas de bzhin gshegs pa sems can de dag la kye sems can rnams /
translated: It is impossible to teach them with ease.🔽The Tathāgata, the supreme leader of beings, causes them to remember, saying:

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dang / de sangs rgyas la bskyed pa'am /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba de dang / de sangs rgyas la bskyed pa'am /
translated: “O beings, remember those roots of virtue that you have planted in the Buddha,

original: nyan thos la bskyed pa'am /
analyzed: nyan thos la bskyed pa'am /
translated: those that you have planted in the disciples,

original: rang sangs rgyas la bskyed pa'am /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas la bskyed pa'am /
translated: those that you have planted in the solitary buddhas,

original: chos la bskyed pa de dag dran par gyis shig ces dran par mdzad do //
analyzed: chos la bskyed pa de dag dran par gyis shig ces dran par mdzad do //
translated: and those that you have planted in the Dharma!”

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: de dag kyang sangs rgyas kyi mthus dran par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang sangs rgyas kyi mthus dran par 'gyur ro //
translated: They remember through the power of the Buddha.

original: de bzhin gshegs @102b pas de dag la dge ba'i rtsa ba la dmigs pa de las chos 'di lta bur ston te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs @102b pas de dag la dge ba'i rtsa ba la dmigs pa de las chos 'di lta bur ston te /
translated: The Tathāgata teaches them the Dharma in such a way that they focus on those roots of virtue,

original: ci nas sems can de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par 'gyur zhing mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du la la ni /🔽nyan thos kyi theg pas /
analyzed: ci nas sems can de dag bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub las phyir mi ldog par 'gyur zhing mos pa ji lta ba bzhin du la la ni / nyan thos kyi theg pas /
translated: so that those beings will not turn back from unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, and so that, in accordance with their aspirations, some will be in the Vehicle of the Disciples,

original: la la ni /
analyzed: la la ni /
translated: some will be in the Vehicle of the Solitary Sages,🔽and some will be in the Great Vehicle.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pas 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pas 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: some will attain the vehicle of the pratyekabuddhas,

original: la la ni /
analyzed: la la ni /
translated: and some will generate

original: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed do //
analyzed: bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed do //
translated: the mind set on unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: de ltar sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: de ltar sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: In this way, Śāriputra,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mngon sum du byed pa shes pa'i stobs ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sngon gyi gnas rjes su dran pa mngon sum du byed pa shes pa'i stobs ni /
translated: the thus-gone ones’ power of recollecting their former abodes and actualizing the knowledge of it

original: mtha' yas mu med de /
analyzed: mtha' yas mu med de /
translated: is limitless and boundless.🔽It is equal to and the same as space.

original: nam mkha' dang mtshungs shing mnyam mo; ;byang chub sems dpa' de thos nas mngon par dad /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang mtshungs shing mnyam mo; ;byang chub sems dpa' de thos nas mngon par dad /
translated: When the bodhisattvas hear this, they will have faith,

original: yid ches / rab tu rtog /🔽som nyi med /
analyzed: yid ches / rab tu rtog / som nyi med /
translated: confidence, and understanding.🔽They will be free from doubt and uncertainty,

original: the tshom mi za ba nas nam mkha' lta bur bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: the tshom mi za ba nas nam mkha' lta bur bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i bar du'o //
translated: and they will be inconceivable like space.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad gsungs te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis de skad gsungs te /
translated: The Blessed One spoke thus,

original: bde bar gshegs pas de skad bka' stsal nas ston pas yang 'di skad gsungs so //🔽bdag gi dang ni de bzhin gzhan dag gi /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pas de skad bka' stsal nas ston pas yang 'di skad gsungs so // bdag gi dang ni de bzhin gzhan dag gi /
translated: and the Well-Gone One, the Teacher, said this:🔽“The light of the world recollects

original: 'jig rten sgron mas sngon gyi dran pa ni //
analyzed: 'jig rten sgron mas sngon gyi dran pa ni //
translated: his former abodes

original: bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig mtha' yas pa //
analyzed: bskal pa bye ba khrag khrig mtha' yas pa //
translated: “For countless millions of eons,

original: skyu ru ra lnga lag mthil bzhag pa bzhin //
analyzed: skyu ru ra lnga lag mthil bzhag pa bzhin //
translated: Like a myrobalan fruit in the palm of the hand,

original: ming rus de bzhin kha dog rnam par rtog /
analyzed: ming rus de bzhin kha dog rnam par rtog /
translated: Name, caste, and color are imagined.

original: tshe dang gnas dang 'chi 'pho 'gro ba dang / gang gi rgyu la sems can brtson ldan pa //
analyzed: tshe dang gnas dang 'chi 'pho 'gro ba dang / gang gi rgyu la sems can brtson ldan pa //
translated: “Life, abode, death, and rebirth, and the causes of beings,

original: de mkhyen pa ni de la chos kyang 'chad //
analyzed: de mkhyen pa ni de la chos kyang 'chad //
translated: The one who knows this teaches the Dharma to them.

original: 'gro ba rnams kyi sems dang sems byung chos //
analyzed: 'gro ba rnams kyi sems dang sems byung chos //
translated: The minds and mental factors of beings,🔽“The infinite past,

original: gang dag 'das pa mtha' yas mu med pa //🔽gang gi 'og tu @103a *//
analyzed: gang dag 'das pa mtha' yas mu med pa // gang gi 'og tu @103a *//
translated: And the future,

original: sems gang byung ba kun /
analyzed: sems gang byung ba kun /
translated: All the minds that will arise,

original: rgyal ba'i ye shes chen po mnga' bas mkhyen //
analyzed: rgyal ba'i ye shes chen po mnga' bas mkhyen //
translated: Are known by the Victor’s great wisdom.

original: sems can gcig gi sems rgyud sngon 'das pa //
analyzed: sems can gcig gi sems rgyud sngon 'das pa //
translated: “The mind-stream of a single being in the past,

original: bde bar gshegs pas rab tu mkhyen pa ni //🔽bskal pa gangg'a'i klung gi bye snyed du //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pas rab tu mkhyen pa ni // bskal pa gangg'a'i klung gi bye snyed du //
translated: The Sugata fully knows,🔽Even if he were to explain it

original: bshad kyang de yi mtha' mar phyin mi 'gyur //
analyzed: bshad kyang de yi mtha' mar phyin mi 'gyur //
translated: For eons equal to the sands of the Ganges, he would not reach the end.

original: sngon gyi spyod pa ji snyed de dag ni //
analyzed: sngon gyi spyod pa ji snyed de dag ni //
translated: “All those past deeds,🔽Even if I were to explain them

original: phyi ma'i mtha' yi bar du ngas bshad kyang //
analyzed: phyi ma'i mtha' yi bar du ngas bshad kyang //
translated: Until the end of time,

original: mtshungs pa med pa'i ye shes mi zad de //
analyzed: mtshungs pa med pa'i ye shes mi zad de //
translated: “The inexhaustible, incomparable wisdom

original: bcom ldan ye shes rgya mtsho 'di 'dra'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan ye shes rgya mtsho 'di 'dra'o //
translated: Is the ocean of the Bhagavān’s wisdom.

original: sngon gyi rgyal la bsti stang gang byas shing //
analyzed: sngon gyi rgyal la bsti stang gang byas shing //
translated: “The respect that was shown to the previous victors

original: sems can gang dag dge ba'i bsam gyur pa //
analyzed: sems can gang dag dge ba'i bsam gyur pa //
translated: And the beings who have become virtuous

original: sangs rgyas rdzu 'phrul stobs kyi shugs la gnas //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rdzu 'phrul stobs kyi shugs la gnas //
translated: Are established in the power of the Buddha’s miracles.

original: sngon dag dge ba byas pa rnams kyang dran //
analyzed: sngon dag dge ba byas pa rnams kyang dran //
translated: “They remember the previous virtuous actions

original: sngon ni bsod nams ji 'dra byas pa rnams //
analyzed: sngon ni bsod nams ji 'dra byas pa rnams //
translated: And the various previous merits that were created.

original: de dag rnams kyang ston pa'i mthus dran te //
analyzed: de dag rnams kyang ston pa'i mthus dran te //
translated: Through the power of the Teacher they remember

original: de dag dran nas gnas ni gsum la 'khod //
analyzed: de dag dran nas gnas ni gsum la 'khod //
translated: And, remembering, they are established in the three abodes.

original: thar pa'i gnas las phyir yang mi ldog 'gyur //
analyzed: thar pa'i gnas las phyir yang mi ldog 'gyur //
translated: “They will not turn back from the abode of liberation.

original: bde gshegs sngon gyi sbyor ba mtha' yas te //
analyzed: bde gshegs sngon gyi sbyor ba mtha' yas te //
translated: The Sugata’s infinite previous practice

original: sems can thams cad kyis ni bsam mi nus //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyis ni bsam mi nus //
translated: Is inconceivable to all beings.🔽“The bodhisattvas, the great beings, have faith

original: mtha' yas grags pa'i stobs ni brgyad pa la //🔽rgyal sras bdag nyid chen po dad par 'gyur //
analyzed: mtha' yas grags pa'i stobs ni brgyad pa la // rgyal sras bdag nyid chen po dad par 'gyur //
translated: In the eighth strength of the one of infinite renown.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Śāriputra,

original: 'di ni / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs brgyad pa ste /🔽stobs de dang ldan pas zhes bya ba nas chos dang mthun pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: 'di ni / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs brgyad pa ste / stobs de dang ldan pas zhes bya ba nas chos dang mthun pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: This is the eighth tathāgata activity of the tathāgatas.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i lha'i mig rjes su dran pa mngon sum du byed pa mkhyen pa'i stobs gang zhe na /🔽'di la sh'a ri'i @103b bu; de bzhin gshegs pas bla na med pa'i ye shes dang / mi las shin tu 'das pa'i lha'i mig rnam par dag pas sems can rnams 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba dang / bzang po dang / ngan pa dang /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i lha'i mig rjes su dran pa mngon sum du byed pa mkhyen pa'i stobs gang zhe na / 'di la sh'a ri'i @103b bu; de bzhin gshegs pas bla na med pa'i ye shes dang / mi las shin tu 'das pa'i lha'i mig rnam par dag pas sems can rnams 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye ba dang / bzang po dang / ngan pa dang /
translated: Endowed with this power, the Tathāgata, Arhat, Perfectly Awakened One, Mindfully and with Clear Comprehension, properly goes out into the open air, into the space in front of the door.

original: kha dog mdzes pa dang / kha dog mi sdug pa dang / bde 'gror 'gro ba dang / ngan 'gror 'gro ba rnams gzigs so //🔽sems can 'di dag ni /
analyzed: kha dog mdzes pa dang / kha dog mi sdug pa dang / bde 'gror 'gro ba dang / ngan 'gror 'gro ba rnams gzigs so // sems can 'di dag ni /
translated: Here, Śāriputra, the Tathāgata, with his unobstructed, purified, and fully accomplished divine eye, sees beings dying and being born, of good and bad appearance, of good and bad destiny, of good and bad circumstances, and he sees how they go to the lower and higher realms in accordance with their deeds.🔽He sees it like this:

original: lus kyis nyes par spyod pa dang ldan /
analyzed: lus kyis nyes par spyod pa dang ldan /
translated: ‘These beings, who have acted badly in body,

original: ngag gis nyes par spyod pa dang ldan /
analyzed: ngag gis nyes par spyod pa dang ldan /
translated: who have acted badly in speech,

original: yid kyis nyes par spyod pa dang ldan pa /
analyzed: yid kyis nyes par spyod pa dang ldan pa /
translated: They engage in negative physical, verbal, and mental actions.

original: 'phags pa la skur pa 'debs pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa la skur pa 'debs pa /
translated: They disparage the noble ones.

original: log par lta ba dag ste /
analyzed: log par lta ba dag ste /
translated: They hold wrong views.

original: de dag log par lta ba'i las yang dag par blangs pa'i rgyus lus zhig ste shi ba'i 'og tu ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal bar skye'o //
analyzed: de dag log par lta ba'i las yang dag par blangs pa'i rgyus lus zhig ste shi ba'i 'og tu ngan song ngan 'gro log par ltung ba sems can dmyal bar skye'o //
translated: Due to the causes of their wrong views, when their bodies collapse and they die, they fall into the lower realms and are born in the hells.

original: dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten du'ang de bzhin no //🔽yang sems can 'di dag ni; lus kyis legs par spyod pa dang ldan /
analyzed: dud 'gro'i skye gnas dang / gshin rje'i 'jig rten du'ang de bzhin no // yang sems can 'di dag ni; lus kyis legs par spyod pa dang ldan /
translated: The same is true for those born as animals and those in the world of Yama.

original: ngag gis legs par spyod pa dang ldan /🔽yid kyis legs par spyod pa dang ldan te /
analyzed: ngag gis legs par spyod pa dang ldan / yid kyis legs par spyod pa dang ldan te /
translated: “ ‘These beings engage in positive physical, verbal, and mental actions.

original: 'phags pa rnams la skur pa mi 'debs pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams la skur pa mi 'debs pa /
translated: They do not disparage the noble ones.🔽They hold right views.

original: yang dag par lta ba ste; de dag yang dag par lta ba yang dag par blangs pa'i rgyus lus zhig nas bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du lhar skye'o //
analyzed: yang dag par lta ba ste; de dag yang dag par lta ba yang dag par blangs pa'i rgyus lus zhig nas bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du lhar skye'o //
translated: Due to the causes of their right views, when their bodies collapse and they die, they go to the higher realms and are born among the gods.’

original: zhes sems can rnams kyi las ji ltar bsags pa rnams rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: zhes sems can rnams kyi las ji ltar bsags pa rnams rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: Thus, the Tathāgata knows the accumulation of karma of all sentient beings.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i lha'i mig de ni /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i lha'i mig de ni /
translated: “The divine eye of the Tathāgata

original: phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing nam mkha'i mtha' chos kyi dbyings tshad med pa brjod du med pa gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma las @104a *//🔽kyang shin tu 'das pa thams cad na sangs rgyas kyi zhing gang ji snyed snang bar gyur pa de dag thams cad ni /
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing nam mkha'i mtha' chos kyi dbyings tshad med pa brjod du med pa gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma las @104a *// kyang shin tu 'das pa thams cad na sangs rgyas kyi zhing gang ji snyed snang bar gyur pa de dag thams cad ni /
translated: sees all the buddhafields in the ten directions, as many as there are, throughout the infinite, inexpressible, and limitless reaches of space and the realm of phenomena, beyond the sands of the Ganges River.🔽It sees all the buddhafields that appear

original: 'tshig pa dang / 'jig pa dang / 'chags par gzigs so; ;sems can gang dag kha cig snang bar gyur pa de dag thams cad ni /
analyzed: 'tshig pa dang / 'jig pa dang / 'chags par gzigs so; ;sems can gang dag kha cig snang bar gyur pa de dag thams cad ni /
translated: and it sees the burning, destruction, and formation of those buddhafields. It sees all the sentient beings who appear

original: 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye bar gzigs so //
analyzed: 'chi 'pho ba dang / skye bar gzigs so //
translated: and it sees their death, transmigration, and rebirth.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang dag kha cig snang bar gyur pa de dag thams cad ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang dag kha cig snang bar gyur pa de dag thams cad ni /
translated: It sees all the bodhisattvas who appear🔽and it sees their descent into the womb, their birth, their departure from home, their seat of awakening, and their turning of the wheel of the Dharma.

original: dga' ldan gnas nas 'chi 'pho ba dang / ma'i rum du 'jug pa dang / btsa' ba dang / gom pa bdun 'dor ba dang / btsun mo'i 'khor gyi dang du 'jug pa dang / mngon par 'byung bar gzigs so //
analyzed: dga' ldan gnas nas 'chi 'pho ba dang / ma'i rum du 'jug pa dang / btsa' ba dang / gom pa bdun 'dor ba dang / btsun mo'i 'khor gyi dang du 'jug pa dang / mngon par 'byung bar gzigs so //
translated: He saw the Bodhisattva descending from the Tuṣita heaven, entering his mother’s womb, being born, taking up the life of a householder, renouncing it, practicing austerities, going to the place of enlightenment, sitting on the seat of enlightenment, conquering the hosts of Māra, becoming perfectly enlightened, turning the wheel of the Dharma, and passing into the great nirvāṇa.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang dag kha cig snang bar gyur pa de dag thams cad ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gang dag kha cig snang bar gyur pa de dag thams cad ni /
translated: He saw all the blessed buddhas who had appeared,

original: byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar gzigs so //
analyzed: byang chub mngon par rdzogs par 'tshang rgya bar gzigs so //
translated: and he saw them all attaining perfect buddhahood.

original: chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba dang / tshe'i 'du byed 'dor ba dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar yang gzigs so //
analyzed: chos kyi 'khor lo rab tu bskor ba dang / tshe'i 'du byed 'dor ba dang / yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar yang gzigs so //
translated: He saw them turning the wheel of the Dharma, renouncing their life force, and passing into parinirvāṇa.

original: nyan thos gang dag kha cig snang bar gyur pa de dag thams cad ni /
analyzed: nyan thos gang dag kha cig snang bar gyur pa de dag thams cad ni /
translated: He saw all the śrāvakas who had appeared,

original: shin tu yongs su mya ngan las 'das pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar gzigs so //
analyzed: shin tu yongs su mya ngan las 'das pas yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar gzigs so //
translated: and he saw them all passing into the parinirvāṇa that has no remainder.

original: rang sangs rgyas gang dag kha cig snang bar gyur pa de dag thams cad ni /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas gang dag kha cig snang bar gyur pa de dag thams cad ni /
translated: He saw all the pratyekabuddhas who had appeared,🔽and he saw them all passing into parinirvāṇa.

original: rdzu 'phrul ston cing yon sbyong bar gzigs so //
analyzed: rdzu 'phrul ston cing yon sbyong bar gzigs so //
translated: He sees those who display miracles and purify their generosity.

original: sems can gang dag snang bar ma gyur pa /
analyzed: sems can gang dag snang bar ma gyur pa /
translated: Those sentient beings who are not visible

original: phyi rol gyi drang srong mngon par shes pa lnga dang ldan pa rnams kyi mig gi lam du mi 'gro ba dang / nyan thos dang / rang @104b sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis kyang mthong bar mi 'gyur ba de dag de bzhin gshegs pa'i lha'i mig gis gzigs so //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi drang srong mngon par shes pa lnga dang ldan pa rnams kyi mig gi lam du mi 'gro ba dang / nyan thos dang / rang @104b sangs rgyas dang / byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyis kyang mthong bar mi 'gyur ba de dag de bzhin gshegs pa'i lha'i mig gis gzigs so //
translated: are not within the range of vision of the external sages who possess the five kinds of supernormal knowledge, and are not seen even by the disciples, solitary buddhas, and bodhisattvas. The Tathāgata sees them with his divine eye.

original: yang de bzhin gshegs pas shing rta'i 'phang lo'i tshad tsam la snang bar ma gyur pa'i sems can rnams gzigs pa de dag ni /
analyzed: yang de bzhin gshegs pas shing rta'i 'phang lo'i tshad tsam la snang bar ma gyur pa'i sems can rnams gzigs pa de dag ni /
translated: Moreover, the Tathāgata sees sentient beings who are not visible in an area the size of a chariot,

original: shin tu mang gi /
analyzed: shin tu mang gi /
translated: and they are very numerous.

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi lha dang mi rnams ni /
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams kyi lha dang mi rnams ni /
translated: The gods and humans of the great billionfold world system

original: de ltar ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar ma yin te /
translated: are not like that.

original: de ltar mi snang bar gyur pa'i sems can gyi khams kyang tshad med do //🔽'di ltar sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: de ltar mi snang bar gyur pa'i sems can gyi khams kyang tshad med do // 'di ltar sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: The realm of sentient beings who are not visible in that way is also immeasurable.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni /
translated: Thus, Śāriputra, the Tathāgata

original: lha'i mig gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing na sems can gang sangs rgyas kyis 'dul bar 'gyur zhes sems can gyi khams la gzigs te /
analyzed: lha'i mig gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing na sems can gang sangs rgyas kyis 'dul bar 'gyur zhes sems can gyi khams la gzigs te /
translated: With the divine eye, he sees the realm of sentient beings, thinking, “In the buddha-fields, which sentient beings will be disciplined by the Buddha?”

original: sems can ji tsam sangs rgyas kyis 'dul bar 'gyur ba de dag gi mdun na de bzhin gshegs pa bzhugs shing /
analyzed: sems can ji tsam sangs rgyas kyis 'dul bar 'gyur ba de dag gi mdun na de bzhin gshegs pa bzhugs shing /
translated: In the presence of those sentient beings who will be disciplined by the Buddha, the Tathāgata remains.

original: sems can de dag 'dul yang sems can gzhan gyis mi shes so //
analyzed: sems can de dag 'dul yang sems can gzhan gyis mi shes so //
translated: And even though he disciplines those sentient beings, others do not know it.

original: de ltar na /
analyzed: de ltar na /
translated: Thus,

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i lha'i mig rjes su dran pa mngon sum du byed pa mkhyen pa'i stobs ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i lha'i mig rjes su dran pa mngon sum du byed pa mkhyen pa'i stobs ni /
translated: the Tathāgata’s knowledge of the divine eye, which is the recollection of the divine eye,

original: mtha' yas mu med de /
analyzed: mtha' yas mu med de /
translated: is infinite and limitless,

original: nam mkha' dang mtshungs shing mnyam mo //
analyzed: nam mkha' dang mtshungs shing mnyam mo //
translated: equal to and the same as space.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de thos nas mngon par dad pa nas nam mkha' lta bur bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de thos nas mngon par dad pa nas nam mkha' lta bur bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: After hearing this, the bodhisattva should have perfect faith in it …

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis don 'di nyid rgya cher bstan pa'i phyir de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis don 'di nyid rgya cher bstan pa'i phyir de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs so //
translated: Then the Bhagavat, in order to teach this topic in detail, at that time spoke these verses:

original: bde bar gshegs pa'i lha'i mig dri med de /
analyzed: bde bar gshegs pa'i lha'i mig dri med de /
translated: “The Sugata’s divine eye is stainless,

original: bskal pa du mar dge ba'i las kyis sbyangs //
