analyzed: bskal pa du mar dge ba'i las kyis sbyangs //
translated: Purified by virtuous karma over many eons.

original: des ni @105a *//🔽rgyal bas phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas zhing //
analyzed: des ni @105a *// rgyal bas phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas zhing //
translated: With that,🔽The Victor sees the vast, inconceivable buddha fields

original: rgya chen bsam gyis mi khyab rnams kyang gzigs //
analyzed: rgya chen bsam gyis mi khyab rnams kyang gzigs //
translated: In the ten directions.

original: 'byung ba dang ni 'jig pa ji snyed pa //
analyzed: 'byung ba dang ni 'jig pa ji snyed pa //
translated: He sees all that arises and perishes,

original: kha cig me yis 'khor cing sems can gnas /
analyzed: kha cig me yis 'khor cing sems can gnas /
translated: Some worlds burning, with sentient beings dwelling there,

original: kha cig sangs rgyas ldan zhing kha cig stong //
analyzed: kha cig sangs rgyas ldan zhing kha cig stong //
translated: Some with buddhas, some empty.

original: thams cad rang byung gi ni spyan gyis gzigs //
analyzed: thams cad rang byung gi ni spyan gyis gzigs //
translated: He sees all with the eye of self-arising.

original: sems can khams ni rgya cher bsam mi khyab //
analyzed: sems can khams ni rgya cher bsam mi khyab //
translated: The realm of sentient beings is vast and inconceivable,🔽As many as there are with form or formless,

original: gzugs can gzugs med gang dag ji snyed dang // gang dag ngan 'gror 'gro dang bde 'gro ba //
analyzed: gzugs can gzugs med gang dag ji snyed dang // gang dag ngan 'gror 'gro dang bde 'gro ba //
translated: Those going to lower realms or higher realms.

original: thams cad rang byung gi ni spyan gyis gzigs //
analyzed: thams cad rang byung gi ni spyan gyis gzigs //
translated: He sees all with the eye of self-arising.

original: sangs rgyas bye ba mang po gang bzhugs dang // rang byung 'dren pa mya ngan gang 'das dang // rang rgyal gang dang nyan thos gang yod pa //
analyzed: sangs rgyas bye ba mang po gang bzhugs dang // rang byung 'dren pa mya ngan gang 'das dang // rang rgyal gang dang nyan thos gang yod pa //
translated: The pratyekabuddhas and the śrāvakas—

original: thams cad rang byung gi ni spyan gyis gzigs //
analyzed: thams cad rang byung gi ni spyan gyis gzigs //
translated: All are seen with the eye of self-arisen ones.

original: byang chub sems dpa' srog chags phan 'dogs pa //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' srog chags phan 'dogs pa //
translated: The bodhisattvas who benefit living beings,

original: gang dag byang chub spyod pa mchog spyod cing //
analyzed: gang dag byang chub spyod pa mchog spyod cing //
translated: Those who practice the supreme conduct of awakening,

original: la la gzhi med gnas ni rtogs gyur pa //
analyzed: la la gzhi med gnas ni rtogs gyur pa //
translated: Some of whom have realized the groundless abode—

original: thams cad rang byung 'dren pa dag gis gzigs //
analyzed: thams cad rang byung 'dren pa dag gis gzigs //
translated: All are seen by the self-arisen guides.

original: gang gis srog chags shin tu phra mthong ba; ;bde gshegs mig ni 'di 'dra dri ma med //
analyzed: gang gis srog chags shin tu phra mthong ba; ;bde gshegs mig ni 'di 'dra dri ma med //
translated: The sugatas’ eye sees even the most subtle living beings.

original: mig stobs bsam gyis mi khyab dgu pa ste //
analyzed: mig stobs bsam gyis mi khyab dgu pa ste //
translated: The ninth power of the inconceivable eye

original: rgyal sras des pa rnams ni mngon par dad //
analyzed: rgyal sras des pa rnams ni mngon par dad //
translated: Is manifestly believed in by the gentle sons of the victors.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: 'di ni / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dgu pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs dgu pa ste /
translated: This is the ninth power of the tathāgatas.

original: stobs de dang ldan pas khyu mchog gi gnas su zhal gyis 'che zhing 'khor gyi nang du sengge'i sgra yang dag par sgrog pa nas @105b sus kyang 'jig rten 'dir chos dang mthun pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: stobs de dang ldan pas khyu mchog gi gnas su zhal gyis 'che zhing 'khor gyi nang du sengge'i sgra yang dag par sgrog pa nas @105b sus kyang 'jig rten 'dir chos dang mthun pa zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: Endowed with this power, he claims the position of the bull, and in the midst of the assembly he roars the lion’s roar. He sets rolling the wheel of Brahmā, of Dharma, which cannot be rolled by any ascetic or brahmin or god or Māra or Brahmā or anyone in the world.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i zag pa zad pa mngon sum du byed pa mkhyen pa'i stobs gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i zag pa zad pa mngon sum du byed pa mkhyen pa'i stobs gang zhe na /
translated: “What, Śāriputra, is the Tathāgata’s knowledge and insight into the destruction of the fluxes?

original: 'di la sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: 'di la sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Here, Śāriputra,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas bla na med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi stobs kyis zag pa thams cad zad pas bdag skye ba ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas bla na med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes kyi stobs kyis zag pa thams cad zad pas bdag skye ba ni /
translated: the Tathāgata, by means of the unsurpassed knowledge and insight of a Tathāgata, has destroyed all the fluxes.

original: zad / tshangs par spyod pa la ni /
analyzed: zad / tshangs par spyod pa la ni /
translated: He has practiced the holy life,

original: bsten / bya ba ni /
analyzed: bsten / bya ba ni /
translated: done what is to be done,

original: byas te / 'di la srid pa gzhan mi shes so //
analyzed: byas te / 'di la srid pa gzhan mi shes so //
translated: and knows that this is his last existence.

original: zhes zag pa med pa /
analyzed: zhes zag pa med pa /
translated: He is free from the fluxes,

original: sems rnam par grol ba /
analyzed: sems rnam par grol ba /
translated: his mind is liberated,

original: rang gi mngon par shes pa lnga mngon sum du byas nas rdzogs par byas te gnas so //
analyzed: rang gi mngon par shes pa lnga mngon sum du byas nas rdzogs par byas te gnas so //
translated: and he has realized the five superknowledges. He lives, having achieved them.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i zag bzad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs de ni /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i zag bzad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs de ni /
translated: The Thus-Gone One’s power of knowing the exhaustion of defilements

original: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba thams cad yang dag par bcom pa'o //
analyzed: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba thams cad yang dag par bcom pa'o //
translated: is the complete destruction of all the connections with habitual tendencies.

original: nyan thos kyi theg pa'i zag pa zad pa ni /
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg pa'i zag pa zad pa ni /
translated: The exhaustion of defilements in the vehicle of the hearers

original: tshad du byas pa'i bag chags yang dag par bcom pa'o //
analyzed: tshad du byas pa'i bag chags yang dag par bcom pa'o //
translated: is the complete destruction of habitual tendencies that are limited.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi zag pa zad pa ni /
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi zag pa zad pa ni /
translated: The exhaustion of defilements in the vehicle of the solitary buddhas

original: tshad yod pa ste /
analyzed: tshad yod pa ste /
translated: is limited.

original: snying rje chen po dang bral ba /
analyzed: snying rje chen po dang bral ba /
translated: They are devoid of great compassion

original: spobs pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: spobs pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: and devoid of eloquence.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i zag pa zad pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i zag pa zad pa ni /
translated: The Thus-Gone One’s exhaustion of defilements

original: rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa /
translated: is endowed with the most sublime of all aspects.

original: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba thams cad yang dag par bcom pa /
analyzed: bag chags kyi mtshams sbyor ba thams cad yang dag par bcom pa /
translated: It is the complete destruction of all the connections with habitual tendencies.

original: snying rje chen pos kun tu bzung ba /
analyzed: snying rje chen pos kun tu bzung ba /
translated: It is sustained by great compassion.🔽It is the view of fearlessness and eloquence.

original: mi 'jigs pa dang spobs pa la lta ba; 'jig rten thams cad kyis zil gyis mi non pa ste /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa dang spobs pa la lta ba; 'jig rten thams cad kyis zil gyis mi non pa ste /
translated: It is not overwhelmed by any world.

original: skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: skad cig gcig dang ldan pa'o //
translated: It is endowed with a single moment.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la las kyi bag chags med /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la las kyi bag chags med /
translated: The Tathāgata has no habitual tendencies of action.

original: nyon mongs pa'i bag chags @106a *//
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i bag chags @106a *//
translated: He has no habitual tendencies of afflictions.

original: med; spyod lam 'khrul pa'i bag chags med do //
analyzed: med; spyod lam 'khrul pa'i bag chags med do //
translated: He has no habitual tendencies of error in deportment.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: nam mkha' yongs su dag pas rdul dang du ba'i 'khrug pa dang lhan cig tu mi gnas pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: nam mkha' yongs su dag pas rdul dang du ba'i 'khrug pa dang lhan cig tu mi gnas pa de bzhin du /
translated: just as the completely pure sky does not remain together with the disturbance of dust and smoke,

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: in the same way, Śāriputra,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyang nyon mongs pa'i bag chags thams cad dang lhan cig tu mi gnas so //🔽de zag pa zad par mkhyen pa de lta bu la rab tu gnas nas zag pa dang bcas pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i zag pa zad pa mkhyen pa'i stobs kyang nyon mongs pa'i bag chags thams cad dang lhan cig tu mi gnas so // de zag pa zad par mkhyen pa de lta bu la rab tu gnas nas zag pa dang bcas pa /
translated: the Tathāgata’s power of knowing the exhaustion of defilements does not remain together with all the habitual tendencies of afflictions.

original: len pa dang bcas pa'i sems can rnams la zag pa zad par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
analyzed: len pa dang bcas pa'i sems can rnams la zag pa zad par bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
translated: Abiding in that kind of knowledge of the exhaustion of defilements, he teaches the Dharma to sentient beings with defilements and grasping in order to exhaust their defilements.

original: len pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir chos ston te /🔽kye ma sems can rnams ni /
analyzed: len pa spang bar bya ba'i phyir chos ston te / kye ma sems can rnams ni /
translated: He teaches the Dharma in order to abandon grasping.

original: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa las byung ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa ma yin pa kun rtog pa las byung ste /
translated: Alas, sentient beings arise from false imagination.

original: zag pa dang len pa rnams mi skyed pa'i phyir yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du khyod kyis rab tu rtogs shig /🔽ces de dag la de bzhin gshegs pas dpe dang tshul gyis ci nas kyang zag pa rnams yang dag pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: zag pa dang len pa rnams mi skyed pa'i phyir yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du khyod kyis rab tu rtogs shig / ces de dag la de bzhin gshegs pas dpe dang tshul gyis ci nas kyang zag pa rnams yang dag pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: You should fully understand them as they are.

original: zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes par 'gyur zhing /
translated: In this way, the Thus-Gone One teaches the Dharma using parables and methods so that they may fully understand the impurities as they are.

original: shes nas kyang chos gang yang mi len te /
analyzed: shes nas kyang chos gang yang mi len te /
translated: Having understood, they do not grasp at any phenomenon.

original: len pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba de lta de lta bur chos ston to //
analyzed: len pa med par yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar 'gyur ba de lta de lta bur chos ston to //
translated: Without grasping, they will attain complete nirvāṇa.

original: de ltar sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: de ltar sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra, in this way

original: de bzhin gshegs pas sems can thams cad kyi zag pa rnams rab tu mkhyen to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas sems can thams cad kyi zag pa rnams rab tu mkhyen to //
translated: the Thus-Gone One fully understands the impurities of all sentient beings.

original: zag pa kun 'byung ba dang / zag pa 'gag pa dang / zag pa 'gag par 'gyur ba'i lam yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
analyzed: zag pa kun 'byung ba dang / zag pa 'gag pa dang / zag pa 'gag par 'gyur ba'i lam yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin rab tu mkhyen te /
translated: He fully understands the origin of the impurities, the cessation of the impurities, and the path that leads to the cessation of the impurities.

original: mkhyen @106b nas kyang de bzhin du chos ston to //
analyzed: mkhyen @106b nas kyang de bzhin du chos ston to //
translated: Having understood, he teaches the Dharma accordingly.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa'i zag pa zad pa mngon sum du byed pa mkhyen pa'i stobs de thos nas mngon par dad /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa'i zag pa zad pa mngon sum du byed pa mkhyen pa'i stobs de thos nas mngon par dad /
translated: The bodhisattvas, having heard about the thus-gone ones’ power of knowing the exhaustion of defilements, will have faith in it,

original: yid ches / rab tu rtog som nyi med cing the tshom mi za ba nas ngo mtshar dang / rmad kyi bar du 'du shes bskyed do //🔽'di la chos nyid ni /
analyzed: yid ches / rab tu rtog som nyi med cing the tshom mi za ba nas ngo mtshar dang / rmad kyi bar du 'du shes bskyed do // 'di la chos nyid ni /
translated: believe in it, understand it, be free of doubt and uncertainty, and give rise to thoughts of wonder and amazement.

original: 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'di yin te /
translated: This is the nature of things.

original: de la 'di skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'di skad ces bya'o //
translated: This is what it says:

original: 'dren pa'i zag pa med pa'i ye shes ni //
analyzed: 'dren pa'i zag pa med pa'i ye shes ni //
translated: The thus-gone ones’ stainless wisdom

original: rgya chen sgrib med dag pa tshad med do //
analyzed: rgya chen sgrib med dag pa tshad med do //
translated: is vast, unobstructed, pure, and immeasurable.

original: stobs bcu'i stobs ni de dang ldan pas na /
analyzed: stobs bcu'i stobs ni de dang ldan pas na /
translated: Endowed with the power of the ten powers,

original: zhi ba'i byang chub mchog 'di rab tu gsung //
analyzed: zhi ba'i byang chub mchog 'di rab tu gsung //
translated: they teach this supreme, peaceful awakening.

original: nyan thos rnams kyi zag zad ye shes ni /
analyzed: nyan thos rnams kyi zag zad ye shes ni /
translated: The hearers’ wisdom of the exhaustion of defilements

original: bag chags ma bcom tshad dang ldan pa yin //
analyzed: bag chags ma bcom tshad dang ldan pa yin //
translated: is not the destruction of habitual tendencies, and it is limited.

original: mi yi dam pa 'dren pa mchog rab kyi //
analyzed: mi yi dam pa 'dren pa mchog rab kyi //
translated: The supreme human, the supreme guide,

original: bag chags bcom zhing tshad dang ldan ma yin //
analyzed: bag chags bcom zhing tshad dang ldan ma yin //
translated: destroys habitual tendencies and is not limited.

original: de bzhin rang rgyal byang chub gang reg pa //
analyzed: de bzhin rang rgyal byang chub gang reg pa //
translated: The pratyekabuddhas’ awakening

original: de la snying rje che dang spobs pa med //
analyzed: de la snying rje che dang spobs pa med //
translated: They have no great compassion and no eloquence.

original: bcom ldan 'das ni zag pa yongs zad pa //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ni zag pa yongs zad pa //
translated: The Bhagavān has completely exhausted defilements,

original: snying rje che dang spobs pa tshad med do //
analyzed: snying rje che dang spobs pa tshad med do //
translated: And has great compassion and immeasurable eloquence.

original: sangs rgyas zag zad mkhyen la gnas nas ni //
analyzed: sangs rgyas zag zad mkhyen la gnas nas ni //
translated: The Buddha, abiding in the knowledge of the exhaustion of defilements,

original: 'gro ba'i zag pa yang dag ma yin zhing //🔽rigs pa'i gnas kyi tshul 'dir ma shes pas //
analyzed: 'gro ba'i zag pa yang dag ma yin zhing // rigs pa'i gnas kyi tshul 'dir ma shes pas //
translated: Knows that the defilements of beings are unreal,🔽And that they have entered wrongly into all these phenomena

original: chos 'di thams cad log par zhugs mkhyen te //
analyzed: chos 'di thams cad log par zhugs mkhyen te //
translated: Because of not knowing this system of the principles of reasoning.

original: de la rgyal ba snying rje cher bskyed nas //
analyzed: de la rgyal ba snying rje cher bskyed nas //
translated: The Jina, generating great compassion for them,🔽Teaches, “Realize the stage of the supreme peace

original: chos 'di mi rtag stong pa bdag med chos //🔽dngos med gsog ste mchog tu zhi ba yi //
analyzed: chos 'di mi rtag stong pa bdag med chos // dngos med gsog ste mchog tu zhi ba yi //
translated: Of these phenomena that are impermanent, empty, selfless,

original: sa la rtogs shig ltos zhes rab tu ston //
analyzed: sa la rtogs shig ltos zhes rab tu ston //
translated: Unreal, and hollow!”🔽Here there is no person, life-force, or individual,

original: 'di la skyes bu srog dang gang zag dang // shed skyes shed bu byad pa bo yang med //
analyzed: 'di la skyes bu srog dang gang zag dang // shed skyes shed bu byad pa bo yang med //
translated: No human, human being, or person.

original: chos 'di thams cad log par nags pas na //
analyzed: chos 'di thams cad log par nags pas na //
translated: All these phenomena are wrongly grasped,

original: ston pa snying rje @107a *//
analyzed: ston pa snying rje @107a *//
translated: And the Teacher, generating compassion,

original: bskyed nas thar ston kyang //
analyzed: bskyed nas thar ston kyang //
translated: Teaches liberation.

original: bde bar gshegs la skyo ba yod med de //
analyzed: bde bar gshegs la skyo ba yod med de //
translated: The Sugata has no weariness.

original: yang dag ye shes nam yang nyams pa med //
analyzed: yang dag ye shes nam yang nyams pa med //
translated: And never loses the wisdom of perfect truth.

original: de phyir rgyal ba rtag tu rnal 'byor sbyor //
analyzed: de phyir rgyal ba rtag tu rnal 'byor sbyor //
translated: “Thus the Victorious One is always engaged in yoga,

original: 'gro la phan phyir chos rnams rab tu ston //
analyzed: 'gro la phan phyir chos rnams rab tu ston //
translated: And teaches the Dharma for the benefit of beings.

original: 'di ni pha rol smra ba 'joms pa'i stobs //
analyzed: 'di ni pha rol smra ba 'joms pa'i stobs //
translated: This is the power that conquers opponents.

original: mtha' yas nam mkha' 'dra ba bcu pa ste //
analyzed: mtha' yas nam mkha' 'dra ba bcu pa ste //
translated: “The tenth power is infinite, like space.

original: mgon po stobs bcu de la gnas gyur nas //
analyzed: mgon po stobs bcu de la gnas gyur nas //
translated: The Lord of Sages, abiding in these ten powers,

original: mtshungs med 'khor lo dam pa rab tu bskor //
analyzed: mtshungs med 'khor lo dam pa rab tu bskor //
translated: Turns the supreme, incomparable wheel.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Śāriputra,

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu pa ste /
translated: this is the tenth power of the tathāgatas.

original: stobs de dang ldan pas de bzhin gshegs pa khyu mchog gi gnas su zhal gyis 'che zhing 'khor gyi nang du sengge'i sgra yang dag par sgrog ste /
analyzed: stobs de dang ldan pas de bzhin gshegs pa khyu mchog gi gnas su zhal gyis 'che zhing 'khor gyi nang du sengge'i sgra yang dag par sgrog ste /
translated: Endowed with this power, the Tathāgata claims the seat of the chief bull and roars the lion’s roar in the assembly.

original: 'jig rten 'dir dge sbyong ngam /
analyzed: 'jig rten 'dir dge sbyong ngam /
translated: In this world, no one, whether a monk,

original: bram ze'i bar du sus kyang chos dang mthun par ma bskor ba /
analyzed: bram ze'i bar du sus kyang chos dang mthun par ma bskor ba /
translated: a brahmin, or anyone else, can turn the wheel in accordance with the Dharma.

original: tshangs pa'i 'khor lo rab tu bskor ro //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i 'khor lo rab tu bskor ro //
translated: The Tathāgata turns the wheel of Brahmā.

original: de ltar sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: de ltar sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Śāriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams la mngon par dad /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa'i yon tan bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs rnams la mngon par dad /
translated: Because the qualities of the tathagatas are inconceivable, bodhisattvas have deep faith in the tathagatas' powers.

original: yid ches / rab tu rtog pa nas ngo mtshar dang / rmad kyi bar du 'du shes bskyed do ////
analyzed: yid ches / rab tu rtog pa nas ngo mtshar dang / rmad kyi bar du 'du shes bskyed do ////
translated: Because the qualities of the Thus-Gone One are inconceivable, bodhisattvas have faith in, trust, and understand the powers of the Thus-Gone One, and they develop a sense of wonder and amazement.

original: bam po drug pa /
analyzed: bam po drug pa /
translated: Chapter 6

original: yang sh'a ri'i bu /🔽ji ltar na /🔽byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa la mngon par dad /
analyzed: yang sh'a ri'i bu / ji ltar na / byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa la mngon par dad /
translated: “Moreover, Śāriputra,

original: yid ches / rab tu rtog /🔽som nyi mi byed /
analyzed: yid ches / rab tu rtog / som nyi mi byed /
translated: how do bodhisattvas have faith in, trust, and understand the inconceivable fearlessness of the thus-gone ones of the past,🔽the inconceivable fearlessness of the thus-gone ones of the future,

original: the tshom mi za ba nas ngo mtshar dang / rmad kyi bar du @107b 'du shes bskyed ce na /
analyzed: the tshom mi za ba nas ngo mtshar dang / rmad kyi bar du @107b 'du shes bskyed ce na /
translated: and the inconceivable fearlessness of the thus-gone ones of the present?

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa ni bzhi po 'di dag ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa ni bzhi po 'di dag ste /
translated: The thus-gone ones have four kinds of fearlessness:

original: mi 'jigs pa de dag dang ldan pas de bzhin gshegs pa 'khor gyi nang du sengge'i sgra yang dag par sgrog cing /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa de dag dang ldan pas de bzhin gshegs pa 'khor gyi nang du sengge'i sgra yang dag par sgrog cing /
translated: Endowed with these four kinds of fearlessness, the Tathāgata proclaims in the midst of the assembly the attainment of true and supreme awakening.

original: khyu mchog gi gnas su zhal gyis 'che ste /🔽dge sbyong ngam /🔽bram ze'am / lha'am /
analyzed: khyu mchog gi gnas su zhal gyis 'che ste / dge sbyong ngam / bram ze'am / lha'am /
translated: He declares the state of the highest and most complete awakening.

original: bdud dam / sus kyang 'jig rten du chos dang mthun par ma bskor ba tshangs pa'i 'khor lo rab tu bskor ro //
analyzed: bdud dam / sus kyang 'jig rten du chos dang mthun par ma bskor ba tshangs pa'i 'khor lo rab tu bskor ro //
translated: No ascetic, brahmin, god, Māra, Brahmā, or anyone else in the world can legitimately dispute that the Tathāgata has attained the highest, complete awakening.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are these four?

original: 'di la sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: 'di la sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa bla na med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes dang ldan pas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa bla na med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes dang ldan pas /
translated: the Tathāgata, endowed with the unsurpassed wisdom of the Tathāgata,

original: 'khor gyi nang du nga yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so //🔽zhes zhal gyis 'che ba de la lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis de bzhin gshegs pa la khyod kyis chos 'di mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas so //
analyzed: 'khor gyi nang du nga yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so // zhes zhal gyis 'che ba de la lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis de bzhin gshegs pa la khyod kyis chos 'di mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas so //
translated: declares in the midst of the assembly, ‘I am a perfectly awakened one.’

original: zhes chos dang mthun par rgol bar byed mi nus so //
analyzed: zhes chos dang mthun par rgol bar byed mi nus so //
translated: The world with its gods cannot legitimately dispute that the Tathāgata has not attained perfect awakening.

original: de la ji ltar na /
analyzed: de la ji ltar na /
translated: How is it that

original: de bzhin gshegs pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya zhe na /
translated: “What is meant by ‘tathāgata, perfectly enlightened, complete and perfect Buddha’?”

original: de bzhin gshegs pas chos thams cad mi mnyam pa med par yang dag par mngon par sangs rgyas te so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams gang yin pa dang / 'phags pa'i chos rnams gang yin pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams gang yin pa dang /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas chos thams cad mi mnyam pa med par yang dag par mngon par sangs rgyas te so so'i skye bo'i chos rnams gang yin pa dang / 'phags pa'i chos rnams gang yin pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams gang yin pa dang /
translated: The Tathāgata has perfectly, truly, and completely awakened to the fact that all phenomena are without distinction. He has awakened to the fact that the phenomena of ordinary beings, the phenomena of āryas, the phenomena of buddhas,

original: slob pa'i chos rnams gang yin pa dang / mi slob pa'i chos rnams gang yin pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams gang yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams @108a *//
analyzed: slob pa'i chos rnams gang yin pa dang / mi slob pa'i chos rnams gang yin pa dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos rnams gang yin pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i chos rnams @108a *//
translated: the phenomena of those in training, the phenomena of those beyond training, the phenomena of pratyekabuddhas, the phenomena of bodhisattvas,

original: mnyam pa nyid kyis mnyam pa gang yin pa dang / 'jig rten gyi chos rnams gang yin pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams gang yin pa dang / kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa dang /
analyzed: mnyam pa nyid kyis mnyam pa gang yin pa dang / 'jig rten gyi chos rnams gang yin pa dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i chos rnams gang yin pa dang / kha na ma tho ba dang bcas pa dang / kha na ma tho ba med pa dang /
translated: the phenomena of the worldly, and the phenomena of the transcendent are all equal. He has awakened to the fact that all phenomena are equal in their equality. He has awakened to the fact that all phenomena are without distinction.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas de dag thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyis mnyam par de bzhin gshegs pas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa dang / zag pa med pa dang / 'dus byas dang / 'dus ma byas de dag thams cad mnyam pa nyid kyis mnyam par de bzhin gshegs pas mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
translated: All of these—the contaminated and the uncontaminated, the conditioned and the unconditioned—are the same, and the Tathāgata has fully awakened to them as they are.

original: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, he is called the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One.

original: de la mnyam pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la mnyam pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: “What is sameness?

original: lta ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid du mnyam mo //
analyzed: lta ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis stong pa nyid du mnyam mo //
translated: It is sameness in emptiness, which is the very essence of views.

original: mtshan ma'i ngo bo nyid kyis mtshan ma med par mnyam mo //
analyzed: mtshan ma'i ngo bo nyid kyis mtshan ma med par mnyam mo //
translated: It is sameness in signlessness, which is the very essence of signs.

original: khams gsum pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis smon pa med par mnyam mo //
analyzed: khams gsum pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis smon pa med par mnyam mo //
translated: It is sameness in wishlessness, which is the very essence of the three realms.

original: skye ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis mi skye bar mnyam mo //
analyzed: skye ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis mi skye bar mnyam mo //
translated: It is sameness in non-arising, which is the very essence of arising.

original: mngon par 'du byed pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis mngon par 'du mi byed par mnyam mo //
analyzed: mngon par 'du byed pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis mngon par 'du mi byed par mnyam mo //
translated: It is sameness in non-conditioning, which is the very essence of conditioning.

original: 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis mi 'byung bar mnyam mo //
analyzed: 'byung ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis mi 'byung bar mnyam mo //
translated: It is sameness in non-occurrence, which is the very essence of occurrence.

original: kun gzhi'i ngo bo nyid kyis kun gzhi med par mnyam mo //
analyzed: kun gzhi'i ngo bo nyid kyis kun gzhi med par mnyam mo //
translated: The nature of the ground of all is the same as the absence of the ground of all.

original: dus gsum gyi ngo bo nyid kyis ji lta ba bzhin du mnyam mo //
analyzed: dus gsum gyi ngo bo nyid kyis ji lta ba bzhin du mnyam mo //
translated: The nature of the three times is the same as reality.

original: ma rig pa dang / srid pa dang / sred pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis rig pa dang rnam par grol bar mnyam mo //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang / srid pa dang / sred pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis rig pa dang rnam par grol bar mnyam mo //
translated: The nature of ignorance, craving, and appropriation is the same as knowledge, liberation, and freedom from desire.

original: 'khor ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis mya ngan las 'das par mnyam mo //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i ngo bo nyid kyis mya ngan las 'das par mnyam mo //
translated: The nature of saṃsāra is the same as nirvāṇa.

original: de ltar sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: de ltar sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: de bzhin gshegs pas chos thams cad mnyam par mngon par @108b rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas chos thams cad mnyam par mngon par @108b rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
translated: the Tathāgata has fully awakened to the sameness of all phenomena.

original: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, he is called the Tathāgata, the Arhat, the Perfectly Enlightened One.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa de yang 'khor thams cad shes par byed pa /🔽'khor thams cad mgu bar byed pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa de yang 'khor thams cad shes par byed pa / 'khor thams cad mgu bar byed pa /
translated: This fearlessness of the Tathāgata is understood by the entire assembly.🔽It delights the entire assembly.

original: 'khor thams cad kyi lus sim par byed pa /
analyzed: 'khor thams cad kyi lus sim par byed pa /
translated: It satisfies the bodies of the entire assembly.

original: 'khor thams cad kyi sems tshim pa skyed pa /
analyzed: 'khor thams cad kyi sems tshim pa skyed pa /
translated: It generates satisfaction in the minds of the entire assembly.

original: 'khor thams cad dga' ba dang / rab tu dga' ba dang / dad pa skyed pa /
analyzed: 'khor thams cad dga' ba dang / rab tu dga' ba dang / dad pa skyed pa /
translated: It delights all the retinue, and generates joy and faith.

original: snying rje chen pos sbyor ba /
analyzed: snying rje chen pos sbyor ba /
translated: It is connected with great compassion.

original: de bzhin nyid kyis mnyam pa /🔽de kho na nyid /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyis mnyam pa / de kho na nyid /
translated: It is the same as suchness.🔽It is reality.

original: de bzhin nyid /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid /
translated: It is suchness.

original: gzhan ma yin pa nyid /🔽mi 'gyur ba nyid /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa nyid / mi 'gyur ba nyid /
translated: It is not other.🔽It is unchanging.

original: mi 'khrugs pa nyid /🔽'byung ba med pa nyid /
analyzed: mi 'khrugs pa nyid / 'byung ba med pa nyid /
translated: It is undisturbed.🔽It is non-arising.

original: 'jig pa med pa nyid /
analyzed: 'jig pa med pa nyid /
translated: It is non-ceasing.

original: rtsod pa med pa nyid de /
analyzed: rtsod pa med pa nyid de /
translated: It is non-contentious.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa la rtsod pa gang yang med do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa la rtsod pa gang yang med do //
translated: There is no contention whatsoever in the Tathāgata’s fearlessness.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa ni /
translated: The Tathāgata’s fearlessness

original: rtsod pa med pa /
analyzed: rtsod pa med pa /
translated: is non-contentious,

original: 'thab pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'thab pa med pa'o //
translated: non-combative.

original: de bzhin nyid kyis mnyam zhing chos kyi dbyings ngos mnyam pa /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyis mnyam zhing chos kyi dbyings ngos mnyam pa /
translated: It is the same as suchness, the same as the realm of phenomena.

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams rab 'byams ma lus pa thams cad la thogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams rab 'byams ma lus pa thams cad la thogs pa med pa'o //
translated: It is unobstructed in all the infinite world systems of the ten directions.

original: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pas 'di lta bu'i chos zab mo phra ba shes par bka' ba de dag mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pas 'di lta bu'i chos zab mo phra ba shes par bka' ba de dag mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as the Tathāgata has taught these profound and subtle dharmas,

original: snying rje chen po la gnas nas bstan pa sna tshogs dang / rnam grangs sna tshogs kyis sems can gzhan rnams dang / gang zag gzhan dag la chos thams cad yang dag par rab tu ston te /
analyzed: snying rje chen po la gnas nas bstan pa sna tshogs dang / rnam grangs sna tshogs kyis sems can gzhan rnams dang / gang zag gzhan dag la chos thams cad yang dag par rab tu ston te /
translated: in the same way, abiding in great compassion, he teaches other beings and other individuals all dharmas in various ways and with various explanations.

original: de'i @109a *// chos de yang de byed pa'i sdug bsngal yang dag par zad pa'i phyir 'byung ngo //🔽gang ston pa ma yin la ston pa'o //
analyzed: de'i @109a *// chos de yang de byed pa'i sdug bsngal yang dag par zad pa'i phyir 'byung ngo // gang ston pa ma yin la ston pa'o //
translated: And that Dharma of his arises in order to put an end to all suffering.

original: zhes khas 'che ba /
analyzed: zhes khas 'che ba /
translated: He is not a teacher, yet he claims to be a teacher.

original: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ma yin la yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas ma yin la yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas so //
translated: He is not a perfect Buddha, yet he claims to be a perfect Buddha.

original: zhes khas 'che ba de dag de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pas zil gyis non nas de dag rgyags pa chad de phan tshun du 'bros so //
analyzed: zhes khas 'che ba de dag de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pas zil gyis non nas de dag rgyags pa chad de phan tshun du 'bros so //
translated: But the Tathāgata, having overcome them with his fearlessness, cuts off their conceit and they flee in different directions.

original: 'di ltar sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: 'di ltar sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa mtha' yas mu med de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa mtha' yas mu med de /
translated: The fearlessness of the Tathāgata is infinite and boundless.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas mu med pa de bzhin du /
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas mu med pa de bzhin du /
translated: Just as space is infinite and boundless,

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa yang mtha' yas mu med de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa yang mtha' yas mu med de /
translated: the fearlessness of the Tathāgata is also infinite and boundless.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: gang de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa'i mtha' 'dod pa ni /
analyzed: gang de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa'i mtha' 'dod pa ni /
translated: those who seek the limits of the fearlessness of the Tathāgata

original: nam mkha'i mtha' 'dod do //
analyzed: nam mkha'i mtha' 'dod do //
translated: are seeking the limits of space.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa de thos nas mngon par dad /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa de thos nas mngon par dad /
translated: When the bodhisattvas hear of the inconceivable fearlessness of the Tathāgata, they give rise to faith,

original: yid ches / rab tu rtog pa nas ngo mtshar dang / rmad kyi bar du 'du shes bskyed do //
analyzed: yid ches / rab tu rtog pa nas ngo mtshar dang / rmad kyi bar du 'du shes bskyed do //
translated: confidence, and understanding, and give rise to a sense of wonder and marvel.

original: 'di ni / mi 'jigs pa dang po'o //
analyzed: 'di ni / mi 'jigs pa dang po'o //
translated: This is the first fearlessness.

original: gzhan yang sh'a ri'i bu /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa bla na med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes dang ldan pas 'khor gyi nang du gshegs nas nga zag pa zad do //
analyzed: gzhan yang sh'a ri'i bu / de bzhin gshegs pa bla na med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes dang ldan pas 'khor gyi nang du gshegs nas nga zag pa zad do //
translated: Moreover, Śāriputra,🔽the Tathāgata, endowed with the unsurpassed wisdom of the Tathāgata, enters the assembly and declares:

original: zhes zhal gyis 'che ste /
analyzed: zhes zhal gyis 'che ste /
translated: I have exhausted the defilements.

original: de la khyod kyis zag pa 'di dag ma zad do //
analyzed: de la khyod kyis zag pa 'di dag ma zad do //
translated: You cannot say that these defilements have not been exhausted.

original: zhes de bzhin gshegs pa la lhar @109b bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis chos dang mthun par rtsod par byed pa med do //
analyzed: zhes de bzhin gshegs pa la lhar @109b bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis chos dang mthun par rtsod par byed pa med do //
translated: The world with its gods, Māra, and Brahmā cannot dispute the Tathāgata’s claim that he has exhausted the defilements in accordance with the Dharma.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i zag pa zad pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i zag pa zad pa ni /
translated: The Tathāgata’s exhaustion of the defilements

original: 'di dag ste /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa 'dod pa'i zag pa las sems rnam par grol bas 'dod chags la spyod pa'i bag chags thams cad bcom mo //
analyzed: 'di dag ste / de bzhin gshegs pa 'dod pa'i zag pa las sems rnam par grol bas 'dod chags la spyod pa'i bag chags thams cad bcom mo //
translated: is as follows:🔽The Tathāgata’s mind is liberated from the defilement of desire. He has destroyed all the latent tendencies to engage in desire.

original: srid pa'i zag pa las sems rnam par grol bas zhe sdang la spyod pa'i bag chags thams cad bcom mo //
analyzed: srid pa'i zag pa las sems rnam par grol bas zhe sdang la spyod pa'i bag chags thams cad bcom mo //
translated: The Tathāgata’s mind is liberated from the defilement of existence. He has destroyed all the latent tendencies to engage in aversion.

original: ma rig pa'i zag pa las sems rnam par grol bas gti mug la spyod pa'i bag chags thams cad bcom mo //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i zag pa las sems rnam par grol bas gti mug la spyod pa'i bag chags thams cad bcom mo //
translated: The Tathāgata’s mind is liberated from the defilement of ignorance. He has destroyed all the latent tendencies to engage in delusion.

original: lta ba'i zag pa las sems rnam par grol bas nyon mongs pa la spyod pa'i bag chags thams cad bcom ste /
analyzed: lta ba'i zag pa las sems rnam par grol bas nyon mongs pa la spyod pa'i bag chags thams cad bcom ste /
translated: The Tathāgata’s mind is liberated from the defilement of views. He has destroyed all the latent tendencies to engage in afflictions.

original: de'i phyir 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob bzung ste de bzhin gshegs pa zag pa zad pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jig rten gyi kun rdzob bzung ste de bzhin gshegs pa zag pa zad pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the Tathāgata is said to have exhausted the contaminants in terms of worldly convention.

original: zhes bya'o // don dam par na 'phags pa'i shes rab dang ye shes kyi mdun na chos gang yongs su shes pa'am /
analyzed: zhes bya'o // don dam par na 'phags pa'i shes rab dang ye shes kyi mdun na chos gang yongs su shes pa'am /
translated: In the ultimate sense, in the presence of the wisdom and knowledge of the noble ones, there is no dharma whatsoever that is fully understood,🔽abandoned,

original: spang ba'am / bsgom pa'am /🔽mngon du 'gyur ba'i chos gang yang mi 'dug go /
analyzed: spang ba'am / bsgom pa'am / mngon du 'gyur ba'i chos gang yang mi 'dug go /
translated: realized, or🔽actualized.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: gang zad pa zhes bya ba de ni /
analyzed: gang zad pa zhes bya ba de ni /
translated: That which is called “exhausted”

original: nam du yang mi zad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nam du yang mi zad pa ma yin no //
translated: is never non-exhausted.

original: de ni / shin tu zad pa nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: de ni / shin tu zad pa nyid yin gyi /
translated: It is utterly exhausted,

original: gnyen pos zad pa zhes mi bya ste /
analyzed: gnyen pos zad pa zhes mi bya ste /
translated: not exhausted by an antidote.

original: de ni / ji lta ba bzhin du zad pa'o //
analyzed: de ni / ji lta ba bzhin du zad pa'o //
translated: It is exhausted just as it is.

original: gang ji lta ba bzhin du zad pa de la zad pa gang yang med do //
analyzed: gang ji lta ba bzhin du zad pa de la zad pa gang yang med do //
translated: That which is exhausted just as it is is not exhausted at all.

original: gang la zad pa gang yang med pa de ni /
analyzed: gang la zad pa gang yang med pa de ni /
translated: That which is not exhausted at all

original: 'dus ma byas pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas pa'o //
translated: is unconditioned.

original: de la skye ba med pa /
analyzed: de la skye ba med pa /
translated: There is no arising in it,

original: 'jig pa med pa /
analyzed: 'jig pa med pa /
translated: no ceasing,

original: gnas med de /
analyzed: gnas med de /
translated: and no abiding.

original: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa byung yang rung /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa byung yang rung /
translated: Therefore, whether the Tathāgata appears

original: ma byung yang rung ste /
analyzed: ma byung yang rung ste /
translated: or does not appear,

original: chos @110a *// nyid chos kyi dbyings ni /
analyzed: chos @110a *// nyid chos kyi dbyings ni /
translated: The dharmadhātu, the nature of phenomena,

original: gnas pa nyid de /
analyzed: gnas pa nyid de /
translated: is the very state of being.

original: de bzhin du de la ye shes zhugs so //
analyzed: de bzhin du de la ye shes zhugs so //
translated: In the same way, wisdom has entered that.

original: gang la 'jug pa med cing mi 'jug pa yang med pa yang de ltar zhugs te /
analyzed: gang la 'jug pa med cing mi 'jug pa yang med pa yang de ltar zhugs te /
translated: It has entered in such a way that there is no entering and no non-entering.

original: de lta bu'i chos kyi tshul gyis zag pa dang zad pa spong ba mi dmigs te /
analyzed: de lta bu'i chos kyi tshul gyis zag pa dang zad pa spong ba mi dmigs te /
translated: In that way, the method of phenomena does not observe the abandonment of defilements and their extinction.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni /
translated: The Tathāgata

original: snying rje chen po la gnas nas zag pa spong ba'i phyir chos ston to //
analyzed: snying rje chen po la gnas nas zag pa spong ba'i phyir chos ston to //
translated: teaches the Dharma in order to abandon defilements by abiding in great compassion.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa de ni /🔽'khor thams cad shes par byed de /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa de ni / 'khor thams cad shes par byed de /
translated: That fearlessness of the Tathāgata🔽is understood by the entire assembly.

original: 'khor thams cad mgu bar byed pa /
analyzed: 'khor thams cad mgu bar byed pa /
translated: It delights the entire assembly.

original: 'khor thams cad kyi lus sim par byed pa /
analyzed: 'khor thams cad kyi lus sim par byed pa /
translated: It satisfies the bodies of the entire assembly.

original: 'khor thams cad kyi sems tshim pa skyed pa; 'khor thams cad dga' ba dang / rab tu dga' ba dang / dad pa skyed pa /
analyzed: 'khor thams cad kyi sems tshim pa skyed pa; 'khor thams cad dga' ba dang / rab tu dga' ba dang / dad pa skyed pa /
translated: It generates satisfaction in the minds of the entire assembly, and it generates joy, delight, and faith in the entire assembly.

original: snying rje chen pos sbyor ba /🔽de bzhin nyid kyis mnyam pa /🔽de kho na nyid /
analyzed: snying rje chen pos sbyor ba / de bzhin nyid kyis mnyam pa / de kho na nyid /
translated: It is connected with great compassion.🔽It is the same as suchness.🔽It is reality.

original: de bzhin nyid /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid /
translated: It is suchness.

original: gzhan ma yin pa nyid /🔽mi 'gyur ba nyid /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa nyid / mi 'gyur ba nyid /
translated: It is not other.🔽It is unchanging.

original: mi 'khrugs pa nyid /🔽'byung ba med pa nyid /
analyzed: mi 'khrugs pa nyid / 'byung ba med pa nyid /
translated: It is undisturbed.🔽It is non-arising.

original: 'jig pa med pa nyid /
analyzed: 'jig pa med pa nyid /
translated: It is non-ceasing.

original: rtsod pa med pa nyid de /
analyzed: rtsod pa med pa nyid de /
translated: It is non-contentious.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa la rtsod pa gang yang med do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa la rtsod pa gang yang med do //
translated: There is no contention whatsoever in the fearlessness of the Tathāgata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa ni /
translated: The fearlessness of the Tathāgata

original: rtsod pa med pa /
analyzed: rtsod pa med pa /
translated: is non-contentious,

original: 'thab pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'thab pa med pa'o //
translated: non-combative.

original: de bzhin nyid kyis mnyam zhing chos kyi dbyings ngos mnyam pa /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyis mnyam zhing chos kyi dbyings ngos mnyam pa /
translated: It is the same as suchness, the same as the realm of phenomena,

original: 'jig rten gyi khams rab 'byams ma lus pa thams cad la thogs pa med do //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams rab 'byams ma lus pa thams cad la thogs pa med do //
translated: and is unobstructed in all the infinite worlds without exception.

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa tshad med /
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa tshad med /
translated: Thus, the Tathāgata, endowed with immeasurable,

original: bsam gyis mi khyab /
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab /
translated: inconceivable,

original: grangs med / dpag tu med pa'i chos dang ldan zhing snying rje chen pos yang dag par zin @110b pa'i sems kyis zag pa spong ba'i phyir sems can rnams la chos ston to //
analyzed: grangs med / dpag tu med pa'i chos dang ldan zhing snying rje chen pos yang dag par zin @110b pa'i sems kyis zag pa spong ba'i phyir sems can rnams la chos ston to //
translated: numerous, and limitless qualities, with a mind fully embraced by great compassion, teaches the Dharma to sentient beings in order to abandon defilements.

original: de ltar sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: de ltar sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Thus, Śāriputra,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa mtha' yas pa nas gang de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa'i mtha' 'dod pa de nam mkha'i mtha' 'dod do //🔽zhes pa'i bar du ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa mtha' yas pa nas gang de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa'i mtha' 'dod pa de nam mkha'i mtha' 'dod do // zhes pa'i bar du ste /
translated: The infinite fearlessness of the Tathagatas is like this. Whoever would seek the limits of the fearlessness of the Tathagatas would be seeking the limits of space.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa de thos nas mngon par dad /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa de thos nas mngon par dad /
translated: The bodhisattvas, having heard this inconceivable fearlessness of the Tathagatas, will be full of faith in it,

original: yid ches / rab tu rtog pas ngo mtshar dang / rmad kyi bar du 'du shes bskyed do //
analyzed: yid ches / rab tu rtog pas ngo mtshar dang / rmad kyi bar du 'du shes bskyed do //
translated: will be full of serene confidence in it, and will conceive the idea that it is wonderful and marvellous.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “ Sariputra,

original: 'di ni / de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa gnyis pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni / de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa gnyis pa ste /
translated: this is the second fearlessness of the Tathagata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa mi 'jigs pa de dang ldan zhes bya ba nas 'jig rten 'dir chos dang mthun par zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa mi 'jigs pa de dang ldan zhes bya ba nas 'jig rten 'dir chos dang mthun par zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: Endowed with this fearlessness of the Tathagata, the Tathagata claims the place of the leader, and in the assemblies he proclaims the doctrine of no-remainder,

original: gzhan yang sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: gzhan yang sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Moreover, Sariputra,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa bla na med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes dang ldan pas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa bla na med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes dang ldan pas /
translated: the Tathagata, endowed with the supreme knowledge of the Tathagata,

original: 'khor gyi nang du gshegs nas bar du gcod pa'i chos rnams la bar du gcod do //
analyzed: 'khor gyi nang du gshegs nas bar du gcod pa'i chos rnams la bar du gcod do //
translated: Having entered the assembly, he proclaims: ‘These are the factors that create obstacles.’

original: zhes zhal gyis 'che ba de la gong ma bzhin du sbyar te /
analyzed: zhes zhal gyis 'che ba de la gong ma bzhin du sbyar te /
translated: As before,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la lhar bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis 'di ni /🔽bar du gcod par 'gyur ba'i chos ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la lhar bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis 'di ni / bar du gcod par 'gyur ba'i chos ma yin no //
translated: the Tathāgata is not contradicted by the world with its gods,

original: zhes rgol bar byed pa med pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: zhes rgol bar byed pa med pa'i bar du'o //
translated: saying: ‘These are not the factors that create obstacles.’

original: de la bar du gcod pa'i chos gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la bar du gcod pa'i chos gang zhe na /
translated: What are the factors that create obstacles?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: bar du gcod par 'gyur ba'i chos gcig ste /
analyzed: bar du gcod par 'gyur ba'i chos gcig ste /
translated: There is one factor that creates obstacles:

original: gcig gang zhe na /
analyzed: gcig gang zhe na /
translated: What is the one factor?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is as follows:

original: bag med pa'i sems so //🔽bar du gcod par 'gyur ba'i @111a *//
analyzed: bag med pa'i sems so // bar du gcod par 'gyur ba'i @111a *//
translated: The mind that is heedless.

original: chos gnyis te /
analyzed: chos gnyis te /
translated: There are two factors that create obstacles:

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are the two factors?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: ngo tsha mi shes pa dang / khrel med pa'o //
analyzed: ngo tsha mi shes pa dang / khrel med pa'o //
translated: Lack of shame and lack of embarrassment.

original: bar du gcod par 'gyur ba'i chos gsum ste /
analyzed: bar du gcod par 'gyur ba'i chos gsum ste /
translated: There are three factors that create obstacles:

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three factors?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: lus kyis nyes par spyad pa dang / ngag gis nyes par spyad pa dang / yid kyis nyes par spyad pa'o //
analyzed: lus kyis nyes par spyad pa dang / ngag gis nyes par spyad pa dang / yid kyis nyes par spyad pa'o //
translated: mental misconduct.

original: bar du gcod par 'gyur ba'i chos bzhi ste /
analyzed: bar du gcod par 'gyur ba'i chos bzhi ste /
translated: “There are four dharmas that are obstacles.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: 'gro ba ma yin par 'gro ba bzhi la /
analyzed: 'gro ba ma yin par 'gro ba bzhi la /
translated: There are four kinds of going that are not going.

original: 'dun pas 'gro ba ma yin par 'gro ba dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / 'jigs pas 'gro ba ma yin par 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: 'dun pas 'gro ba ma yin par 'gro ba dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / 'jigs pas 'gro ba ma yin par 'gro ba'o //
translated: Going that is not going due to desire, going that is not going due to hatred, going that is not going due to confusion, and going that is not going due to fear.

original: bar du gcod par 'gyur ba'i chos lnga ste /
analyzed: bar du gcod par 'gyur ba'i chos lnga ste /
translated: “There are five dharmas that are obstacles.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / chang 'thung ba'o //
analyzed: srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pas log par g-yem pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / chang 'thung ba'o //
translated: killing living beings, taking what has not been given, sexual misconduct, lying, and drinking alcohol.

original: bar du gcod par 'gyur ba'i chos drug ste /
analyzed: bar du gcod par 'gyur ba'i chos drug ste /
translated: “There are six dharmas that are obstacles.

original: drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: drug gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: sangs rgyas la ma gus pa dang / chos dang / dge 'dun dang / bslab pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gtong ba la ma gus pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas la ma gus pa dang / chos dang / dge 'dun dang / bslab pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / gtong ba la ma gus pa'o //
translated: disrespect for the Buddha, the Dharma, the Saṅgha, the training, meditative concentration, and generosity.

original: bar du gcod par 'gyur ba'i chos bdun te /
analyzed: bar du gcod par 'gyur ba'i chos bdun te /
translated: There are seven factors that create obstacles.

original: bdun gang zhe na /
analyzed: bdun gang zhe na /
translated: What are the seven?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are

original: nga rgyal dang / che ba'i nga rgyal dang / nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / log pa'i nga rgyal dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang / cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal lo //
analyzed: nga rgyal dang / che ba'i nga rgyal dang / nga rgyal las kyang nga rgyal dang / nga'o snyam pa'i nga rgyal dang / log pa'i nga rgyal dang / mngon pa'i nga rgyal dang / cung zad snyam pa'i nga rgyal lo //
translated: pride, great pride, pride over pride, pride in thinking “I am,” wrong pride, manifest pride, and the pride of thinking “I am a little bit better.”

original: bar du gcod par 'gyur ba'i chos brgyad de /
analyzed: bar du gcod par 'gyur ba'i chos brgyad de /
translated: There are eight factors that create obstacles.

original: brgyad gang zhe na /
analyzed: brgyad gang zhe na /
translated: What are the eight?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are

original: log pa'i lta ba dang / log pa'i rtog pa dang / log pa'i ngag dang / log pa'i las kyi mtha' @111b dang / log pa'i 'tsho ba dang / log pa'i rtsol ba dang / log pa'i dran pa dang / log pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
analyzed: log pa'i lta ba dang / log pa'i rtog pa dang / log pa'i ngag dang / log pa'i las kyi mtha' @111b dang / log pa'i 'tsho ba dang / log pa'i rtsol ba dang / log pa'i dran pa dang / log pa'i ting nge 'dzin to //
translated: wrong view, wrong thought, wrong speech, wrong action, wrong livelihood, wrong effort, wrong mindfulness, and wrong concentration.

original: bar du gcod par 'gyur ba'i chos dgu ste /
analyzed: bar du gcod par 'gyur ba'i chos dgu ste /
translated: There are nine factors that are obstacles.

original: dgu gang zhe na /
analyzed: dgu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the nine?

original: 'di lta ste /🔽bdag la gnod pa byas so //
analyzed: 'di lta ste / bdag la gnod pa byas so //
translated: They are as follows:🔽“He has harmed me,” and so on,🔽one generates malice.

original: zhes kun nas mnar sems bskyed pa dang / gnod pa byed do //
analyzed: zhes kun nas mnar sems bskyed pa dang / gnod pa byed do //
translated: “He is harming me,”🔽one generates malice.🔽“He will harm me,”

original: zhes kun nas mnar sems bskyed pa dang / gnod par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes kun nas mnar sems bskyed pa dang / gnod par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: one generates malice.🔽“He has harmed my friends,”🔽one generates malice.

original: zhes kun nas mnar sems bskyed pa dang / bdag gi mdza' bo la gnod pa byas so //
analyzed: zhes kun nas mnar sems bskyed pa dang / bdag gi mdza' bo la gnod pa byas so //
translated: “He is harming my friends,”

original: byed do // byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byed do // byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: one generates malice.🔽“He will harm my friends,”🔽one generates malice.

original: zhes sems la kun nas mnar sems bskyed pa dang / bdag dang mi mdza' ba'i don byas so //🔽byed do // byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes sems la kun nas mnar sems bskyed pa dang / bdag dang mi mdza' ba'i don byas so // byed do // byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: “He has benefited my enemies,”🔽one generates malice.🔽“He is benefiting my enemies,”🔽one generates malice.🔽“He will benefit my enemies,”

original: zhes kun nas mnar sems bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: zhes kun nas mnar sems bskyed pa'o //
translated: one generates malice.

original: bar du gcod par 'gyur ba'i chos bcu ste /
analyzed: bar du gcod par 'gyur ba'i chos bcu ste /
translated: There are ten factors that are obstacles.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams yin te /
analyzed: mi dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rnams yin te /
translated: The ten unwholesome courses of action.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / ngag rtsub po dang / tshig kyal pa dang / brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang /
analyzed: srog gcod pa dang / ma byin par len pa dang / 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa dang / brdzun du smra ba dang / phra ma dang / ngag rtsub po dang / tshig kyal pa dang / brnab sems dang / gnod sems dang /
translated: killing, stealing, sexual misconduct, lying, slander, harsh speech, idle talk, covetousness, malice,

original: log par lta ba'o //
analyzed: log par lta ba'o //
translated: and wrong views.

original: de ltar sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: de ltar sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Śāriputra,

original: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang ldan pa'i kun tu sbyor ba ji snyed pa'i chos de dag gis ro myong ba la rjes su lta zhing /
analyzed: tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed pa dang ldan pa'i kun tu sbyor ba ji snyed pa'i chos de dag gis ro myong ba la rjes su lta zhing /
translated: the Tathāgata knows that all those phenomena that are associated with improper mental activity and that are experienced through the fetters

original: gnas pa dang / phyin ci log dang ldan pa dang / 'byung ba la kun nas ldang ba dang / sred pa dang / lta ba la mngon par zhen pa'i zang zing dang bcas /
analyzed: gnas pa dang / phyin ci log dang ldan pa dang / 'byung ba la kun nas ldang ba dang / sred pa dang / lta ba la mngon par zhen pa'i zang zing dang bcas /
translated: are based on the four errors, are associated with the arising of the afflictions, are associated with craving and clinging to views, and are associated with

original: phung po dang bcas pa'i lus kyi @112a *//
analyzed: phung po dang bcas pa'i lus kyi @112a *//
translated: the five aggregates.🔽The Tathāgata knows that all those physical, verbal, and mental actions

original: las dang / ngag gi las dang / yid kyi las de dag thams cad de bzhin gshegs pas bar du gcod par mkhyen to //
analyzed: las dang / ngag gi las dang / yid kyi las de dag thams cad de bzhin gshegs pas bar du gcod par mkhyen to //
translated: are obstacles.

original: bar du gcod par mkhyen nas kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ston to //
analyzed: bar du gcod par mkhyen nas kyang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ston to //
translated: and having understood them to be obstacles, he teaches the Dharma in a way that is in accord with reality.

original: chos bcu po de dag ni bar du gcod par 'gyur pa ste /
analyzed: chos bcu po de dag ni bar du gcod par 'gyur pa ste /
translated: These ten dharmas are obstacles.

original: de dag zhi bar bya ba dang / nye bar zhi bar bya ba dang / spong bar bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa chos ston to //
analyzed: de dag zhi bar bya ba dang / nye bar zhi bar bya ba dang / spong bar bya ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa chos ston to //
translated: The Tathāgata teaches the Dharma in order to pacify, to completely pacify, and to abandon them.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa de yang 'khor thams cad shes par byed pa /🔽'khor thams cad mgu bar byed pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa de yang 'khor thams cad shes par byed pa / 'khor thams cad mgu bar byed pa /
translated: This fearlessness of the Tathāgata is understood by the entire assembly.🔽It delights the entire assembly.

original: 'khor thams cad kyi lus sim par byed pa /
analyzed: 'khor thams cad kyi lus sim par byed pa /
translated: It satisfies the bodies of the entire assembly.

original: 'khor thams cad kyi sems tshim pa skyed pa /
analyzed: 'khor thams cad kyi sems tshim pa skyed pa /
translated: It generates satisfaction in the minds of the entire assembly.🔽It generates joy, rapture, and faith in the entire assembly.

original: 'khor thams cad dga' ba dang / rab tu dga' ba dang / dad pa bskyed pa dang / snying rje chen pos sbyor ba /🔽de bzhin nyid kyis mnyam pa /
analyzed: 'khor thams cad dga' ba dang / rab tu dga' ba dang / dad pa bskyed pa dang / snying rje chen pos sbyor ba / de bzhin nyid kyis mnyam pa /
translated: It is applied with great compassion.🔽It is the same in reality.

original: de kho na nyid /
analyzed: de kho na nyid /
translated: It is reality.

original: de bzhin nyid /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid /
translated: It is suchness.

original: gzhan ma yin pa nyid /🔽mi 'gyur ba nyid /🔽mi 'khrugs pa nyid /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa nyid / mi 'gyur ba nyid / mi 'khrugs pa nyid /
translated: It is non-otherness.🔽It is changelessness.🔽It is imperturbability.

original: 'byung ba med pa nyid /
analyzed: 'byung ba med pa nyid /
translated: It is non-arising.

original: 'jig pa med pa nyid /
analyzed: 'jig pa med pa nyid /
translated: It is non-destruction.

original: rtsod pa med pa nyid /
analyzed: rtsod pa med pa nyid /
translated: It is non-dispute.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa la rtsod pa gang yang med do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa la rtsod pa gang yang med do //
translated: There is no dispute at all in the fearlessness of the Tathāgata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa ni rtsod pa med pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa ni rtsod pa med pa /
translated: The fearlessness of the Tathāgata is non-dispute.

original: 'thab pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'thab pa med pa'o //
translated: It is non-conflict.

original: de bzhin nyid dang mnyam zhing chos kyi dbyings ngos mnyam pa /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang mnyam zhing chos kyi dbyings ngos mnyam pa /
translated: It is the same as suchness and the same as the realm of phenomena.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams rab 'byams ma lus pa thams cad la thogs pa med do //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams rab 'byams ma lus pa thams cad la thogs pa med do //
translated: It is unobstructed in all the infinite worlds without exception.

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa tshad med /
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa tshad med /
translated: Thus, the Tathāgata possesses immeasurable,

original: grangs med / bsam gyis mi khyab /
analyzed: grangs med / bsam gyis mi khyab /
translated: incalculable, inconceivable,

original: gzhal du med /
analyzed: gzhal du med /
translated: immeasurable,

original: brjod du @112b med pa'i chos dang ldan zhing snying rje chen pos yang dag par zin pa'i sems kyi bar du gcod pa'i chos rnams zhi bar bya ba dang / spang bar bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
analyzed: brjod du @112b med pa'i chos dang ldan zhing snying rje chen pos yang dag par zin pa'i sems kyi bar du gcod pa'i chos rnams zhi bar bya ba dang / spang bar bya ba'i phyir chos ston to //
translated: and inexpressible qualities, and teaches the Dharma in order to pacify and abandon the phenomena that obstruct the mind that is fully embraced by great compassion.

original: de ltar sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: de ltar sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Thus, Śāriputra,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa mtha' yas mu med pa nas gang de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa'i mtha' 'dod pa de nam mkha'i mtha' 'dod pa zhes bya ba'i bar du ste /🔽byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa de thos nas mngon par dad /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa mtha' yas mu med pa nas gang de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa'i mtha' 'dod pa de nam mkha'i mtha' 'dod pa zhes bya ba'i bar du ste / byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa de thos nas mngon par dad /
translated: “The infinite, limitless fearlessness of the Tathāgata: whoever seeks the end of the Tathāgata’s fearlessness seeks the end of space.

original: yid ches / rab tu rtog /
analyzed: yid ches / rab tu rtog /
translated: ” When the bodhisattvas heard this inconceivable fearlessness of the Tathāgata, they were filled with faith,

original: so ma nyi med /
analyzed: so ma nyi med /
translated: clear,🔽without doubt,

original: the tshom mi za ba nas ngo mtshar dang / rmad kyi bar du 'du shes bskyed do //
analyzed: the tshom mi za ba nas ngo mtshar dang / rmad kyi bar du 'du shes bskyed do //
translated: and gave rise to thoughts of wonder and amazement.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Śāriputra,

original: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa gsum pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa gsum pa ste /
translated: this is the third fearlessness of the Tathāgata.

original: mi 'jigs pa de dang ldan pas de bzhin gshegs pa 'khor gyi nang du gshegs nas zhes bya ba nas sus kyang 'jig rten du chos dang mthun par zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa de dang ldan pas de bzhin gshegs pa 'khor gyi nang du gshegs nas zhes bya ba nas sus kyang 'jig rten du chos dang mthun par zhes bya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: Endowed with this fearlessness, the Tathāgata enters the assembly and … no one in the world can legitimately dispute it.

original: gzhan yang sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: gzhan yang sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Moreover, Śāriputra,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa bla na med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes dang ldan pas /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa bla na med pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa'i ye shes dang ldan pas /
translated: The Tathāgata, endowed with the unsurpassed wisdom of the Tathāgata,

original: sems can rnams gang la brten pas nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ba 'phags pa'i nges par 'byung ba de byed pa'i sdug bsngal yang dag par zad par 'gyur ba'i lam rab tu mkhyen te /🔽de la 'di ni nges par 'byung ba'i lam ma yin no //
analyzed: sems can rnams gang la brten pas nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ba 'phags pa'i nges par 'byung ba de byed pa'i sdug bsngal yang dag par zad par 'gyur ba'i lam rab tu mkhyen te / de la 'di ni nges par 'byung ba'i lam ma yin no //
translated: knows the path that leads to liberation for sentient beings, the path that noble ones follow to bring about the complete cessation of suffering.

original: zhes de bzhin gshegs pa la lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis chos dang mthun pas rgol bar byed mi nus so //
analyzed: zhes de bzhin gshegs pa la lha dang bcas pa'i 'jig rten gyis chos dang mthun pas rgol bar byed mi nus so //
translated: The Tathāgata cannot be challenged by anyone in the world, including the gods, in accordance with the Dharma, saying, ‘This is not the path to liberation.’

original: nges par 'byung ba'i lam gcig ste gcig gang zhe na /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i lam gcig ste gcig gang zhe na /
translated: There is one path to liberation. What is that one path?

original: 'di @113a *// lta ste /
analyzed: 'di @113a *// lta ste /
translated: It is this:

original: bgrod pa gcig pu'i lam ste /
analyzed: bgrod pa gcig pu'i lam ste /
translated: the path of the single way,

original: gang sems can rnams rnam par dag par 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: gang sems can rnams rnam par dag par 'gyur ba'o //
translated: which purifies sentient beings.

original: nges par 'byung ba'i chos gnyis te /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i chos gnyis te /
translated: There are two dharmas that lead to liberation.

original: gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What are those two?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are this:

original: zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong ngo //
analyzed: zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong ngo //
translated: śamatha and vipaśyanā.

original: nges par 'byung ba'i chos gsum ste /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i chos gsum ste /
translated: There are three dharmas that lead to liberation.

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa'o //
translated: emptiness, signlessness, and wishlessness.

original: nges par 'byung ba'i chos bzhi ste /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i chos bzhi ste /
translated: “There are four dharmas of renunciation.

original: bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: lus su gtogs pa'i dran pa dang / tshor bar gtogs pa'i dran pa dang / sems su gtogs pa'i dran pa dang / chos su gtogs pa'i dran pa ste /
analyzed: lus su gtogs pa'i dran pa dang / tshor bar gtogs pa'i dran pa dang / sems su gtogs pa'i dran pa dang / chos su gtogs pa'i dran pa ste /
translated: mindfulness related to the body, mindfulness related to feelings, mindfulness related to the mind, and mindfulness related to dharmas.

original: 'di ni / nges par 'byung ba'i chos bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'di ni / nges par 'byung ba'i chos bzhi'o //
translated: These are the four dharmas of renunciation.

original: nges par 'byung ba'i chos lnga ste /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i chos lnga ste /
translated: “There are five dharmas of renunciation.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: dad pa'i dbang po dang / brtson 'grus kyi dbang po dang / dran pa'i dbang po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po dang / shes rab kyi dbang po ste /
analyzed: dad pa'i dbang po dang / brtson 'grus kyi dbang po dang / dran pa'i dbang po dang / ting nge 'dzin gyi dbang po dang / shes rab kyi dbang po ste /
translated: the faculty of faith, the faculty of perseverance, the faculty of mindfulness, the faculty of stable attention, and the faculty of wisdom.

original: 'di ni / nges par 'byung ba'i chos lnga'o //
analyzed: 'di ni / nges par 'byung ba'i chos lnga'o //
translated: These are the five dharmas of renunciation.

original: nges par 'byung ba'i chos drug ste /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i chos drug ste /
translated: “There are six dharmas of renunciation.

original: drug gang zhe na /
analyzed: drug gang zhe na /
translated: What are the six?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa dang / chos rjes su dran pa dang / dge 'dun rjes su dran pa dang / tshul khrims rjes su dran pa dang / gtong ba rjes su dran pa dang / lha rjes su dran pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rjes su dran pa dang / chos rjes su dran pa dang / dge 'dun rjes su dran pa dang / tshul khrims rjes su dran pa dang / gtong ba rjes su dran pa dang / lha rjes su dran pa ste /
translated: Recollection of the Buddha, recollection of the Dharma, recollection of the Saṅgha, recollection of moral discipline, recollection of generosity, and recollection of the deities.

original: 'di ni / nges par 'byung ba'i chos drug go /
analyzed: 'di ni / nges par 'byung ba'i chos drug go /
translated: These are the six qualities of renunciation.

original: nges par 'byung ba'i chos bdun te /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i chos bdun te /
translated: “There are seven qualities of renunciation.

original: bdun gang zhe na /
analyzed: bdun gang zhe na /
translated: What are the seven?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / chos rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan @113b lag dang / brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang /
analyzed: dran pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / chos rnam par 'byed pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan @113b lag dang / brtson 'grus yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / dga' ba yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / shin tu sbyangs pa yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang /
translated: The factor of awakening that is correct mindfulness, the factor of awakening that is correct discrimination of phenomena, the factor of awakening that is correct perseverance, the factor of awakening that is correct joy, the factor of awakening that is correct pliancy,

original: ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ste /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag dang / btang snyoms yang dag byang chub kyi yan lag ste /
translated: the factor of awakening that is correct meditative stabilization, and the factor of awakening that is correct equanimity.

original: 'di bdun yang gong ma bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di bdun yang gong ma bzhin no //
translated: These seven are as above.

original: nges par 'byung ba'i chos brgyad de /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i chos brgyad de /
translated: These are the eight.

original: brgyad gang zhe na /
analyzed: brgyad gang zhe na /
translated: What are the eight?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i lam yan lag brgyad pa'o //
translated: The eightfold noble path.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i lta ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtog pa dang / yang dag pa'i ngag dang / yang dag pa'i las kyi mtha' dang / yang dag pa'i 'tsho ba dang / yang dag pa'i rtsol ba dang / yang dag pa'i dran pa dang /
translated: Right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness,

original: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin te /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ting nge 'dzin te /
translated: and right concentration.

original: 'di brgyad kyang gong ma bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di brgyad kyang gong ma bzhin no //
translated: These are the eight.

original: mchog tu dga' ba'i rtsa ba las skyes pa'i chos dgu ste /
analyzed: mchog tu dga' ba'i rtsa ba las skyes pa'i chos dgu ste /
translated: There are nine dharmas that arise from the root of supreme joy.

original: dgu gang zhe na /
analyzed: dgu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the nine?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:🔽Supreme joy, joy, pliancy, bliss, concentration, seeing things as they really are, nirvāṇa, freedom from desire,

original: mchog tu dga' ba dang / dga' ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / bde ba dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ye shes mthong ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang /
analyzed: mchog tu dga' ba dang / dga' ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / bde ba dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ye shes mthong ba dang / mya ngan las 'das pa dang / 'dod chags dang bral ba dang /
translated: and freedom from ignorance.

original: rnam par grol ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba ste /
translated: liberation,

original: 'di dgu yang gong ma bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di dgu yang gong ma bzhin no //
translated: and these nine are as above.
