original: nges par 'byung ba'i chos bcu ste /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i chos bcu ste /
translated: “There are ten dharmas of renunciation.

original: bcu gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gang zhe na /
translated: What are the ten?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam mo //
analyzed: dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam mo //
translated: the ten wholesome courses of action.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: srog gcod pa spangs pa dang / ma byin par len pa spangs pa dang / 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa spangs pa dang / brdzun du smra ba spangs pa dang / phra ma @114a *//
analyzed: srog gcod pa spangs pa dang / ma byin par len pa spangs pa dang / 'dod pa la log par g-yem pa spangs pa dang / brdzun du smra ba spangs pa dang / phra ma @114a *//
translated: renouncing killing, renouncing stealing, renouncing sexual misconduct, renouncing lying, renouncing slander,

original: spangs pa dang / ngag rtsub po spangs pa dang / tshil kyal pa spang pa dang / brnab sems spangs pa dang / gnod sems med pa dang / yang dag par lta ba ste /
analyzed: spangs pa dang / ngag rtsub po spangs pa dang / tshil kyal pa spang pa dang / brnab sems spangs pa dang / gnod sems med pa dang / yang dag par lta ba ste /
translated: renouncing harsh speech, renouncing frivolous speech, renouncing covetousness, renouncing malice, and renouncing wrong views.

original: 'di yang gong ma bzhin te /
analyzed: 'di yang gong ma bzhin te /
translated: This is also as above.

original: lam de ni /
analyzed: lam de ni /
translated: This path

original: nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: will lead to renunciation.

original: 'di ltar sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: 'di ltar sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Thus, Śāriputra,

original: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos kyi dge ba ji snyed pa /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos kyi dge ba ji snyed pa /
translated: all the wholesome dharmas of the factors of awakening🔽are included in the aggregate of morality

original: tshul khrims kyi phung po dang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi phung po dang ldan pa'am /
translated: He is endowed with the aggregate of morality.🔽

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po dang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi phung po dang ldan pa'am /
translated: It is to be endowed with the aggregate of absorption,

original: shes rab kyi phung po dang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: shes rab kyi phung po dang ldan pa'am /
translated: the aggregate of wisdom,

original: rnam par grol ba'i phung po dang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i phung po dang ldan pa'am /
translated: the aggregate of liberation,

original: rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po dang ldan pa'am /
analyzed: rnam par grol ba'i ye shes mthong ba'i phung po dang ldan pa'am /
translated: and the aggregate of the wisdom of the vision of liberation.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang ldan pa de dag kyang nges par 'byung ba'i lam zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa dang ldan pa de dag kyang nges par 'byung ba'i lam zhes bya'o //
translated: It is to be endowed with the noble truths.

original: gzhan yang nges par 'byung ba zhes pa ni /🔽yang dag par sgrub pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang nges par 'byung ba zhes pa ni / yang dag par sgrub pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: “Furthermore, emergence refers to🔽correct practice.

original: gang yang dag par sgrub pa de la ni /
analyzed: gang yang dag par sgrub pa de la ni /
translated: In correct practice,

original: chos gang yang gsog pa'am /
analyzed: chos gang yang gsog pa'am /
translated: there is no accumulation,🔽no decrease,

original: 'bri ba'am / blang ba'am /🔽dor ba'am / gzung ba'am /
analyzed: 'bri ba'am / blang ba'am / dor ba'am / gzung ba'am /
translated: no grasping,

original: spang ba med do /
analyzed: spang ba med do /
translated: no rejection,🔽no acceptance,🔽and no abandonment of any phenomenon.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: yang dag par sgrub pa la zhugs pa ni /
analyzed: yang dag par sgrub pa la zhugs pa ni /
translated: Those who engage in correct practice

original: gnyis la blo mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: gnyis la blo mi 'jug ste /
translated: do not engage with the mind in duality.

original: chos thams cad gnyis su med par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ye shes mthong ba ni /
analyzed: chos thams cad gnyis su med par yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du ye shes mthong ba ni /
translated: The wisdom vision of all phenomena as nondual and just as they are

original: nges par 'byung ba'i lam ste /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba'i lam ste /
translated: is the path of emergence.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa sems can rnams la nges par 'byung ba'i lam yang dag par rab tu ston to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa sems can rnams la nges par 'byung ba'i lam yang dag par rab tu ston to //
translated: The Tathāgata teaches the path of deliverance to sentient beings.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa de yang 'khor thams cad shes par byed pa /🔽'khor thams cad @114b mgu bar byed pa /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa de yang 'khor thams cad shes par byed pa / 'khor thams cad @114b mgu bar byed pa /
translated: This fearlessness of the Tathāgata is understood by the entire assembly.🔽It delights the entire assembly.

original: 'khor thams cad kyi lus sim par byed pa /
analyzed: 'khor thams cad kyi lus sim par byed pa /
translated: It refreshes the bodies of the entire assembly.

original: 'khor thams cad kyi sems tshim pa skyed pa /
analyzed: 'khor thams cad kyi sems tshim pa skyed pa /
translated: It generates satisfaction in the minds of the entire assembly.

original: 'khor thams cad dga' ba dang / rab tu dga' ba dang / dad pa skyed pa /
analyzed: 'khor thams cad dga' ba dang / rab tu dga' ba dang / dad pa skyed pa /
translated: It generates joy, delight, and faith in the entire assembly.

original: snying rje chen pos sbyor ba /🔽de bzhin nyid kyis mnyam pa /
analyzed: snying rje chen pos sbyor ba / de bzhin nyid kyis mnyam pa /
translated: It is connected with great compassion.🔽It is the same in reality.

original: de kho na nyid /
analyzed: de kho na nyid /
translated: It is reality.

original: de bzhin nyid /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid /
translated: It is suchness.

original: gzhan ma yin pa nyid /🔽mi 'gyur ba nyid /
analyzed: gzhan ma yin pa nyid / mi 'gyur ba nyid /
translated: It is non-otherness.🔽It is immutability.

original: mi 'khrug pa nyid /🔽'byung ba med pa nyid /
analyzed: mi 'khrug pa nyid / 'byung ba med pa nyid /
translated: It is non-agitation.🔽It is non-arising.

original: 'jig pa med pa nyid /
analyzed: 'jig pa med pa nyid /
translated: It is non-destruction.

original: rtsod pa med pa nyid de /
analyzed: rtsod pa med pa nyid de /
translated: It is non-dispute.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa la rtsod pa gang yang med do //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa la rtsod pa gang yang med do //
translated: There is no dispute in the fearlessness of the Tathāgata.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa ni /
translated: The fearlessness of the Tathāgata

original: rtsod pa med pa /
analyzed: rtsod pa med pa /
translated: is non-dispute.

original: 'thab pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'thab pa med pa'o //
translated: It is without conflict.

original: de bzhin nyid dang mnyam zhing chos kyi dbyings ngos mnyam pa /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang mnyam zhing chos kyi dbyings ngos mnyam pa /
translated: It is the same as suchness and the same as the realm of phenomena.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams rab 'byams ma lus pa thams cad la thogs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams rab 'byams ma lus pa thams cad la thogs pa med pa'o //
translated: It is unobstructed in all the infinite worlds.

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa tshad med /
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pa tshad med /
translated: In this way, the Tathāgata is endowed with immeasurable,🔽incalculable,

original: grangs med / bsam gyis mi khyab /🔽gzhal du med /
analyzed: grangs med / bsam gyis mi khyab / gzhal du med /
translated: inconceivable,

original: dpag tu med /
analyzed: dpag tu med /
translated: immeasurable,

original: brjod du med pa'i chos dang ldan zhing snying rje chen pos zin pa'i sems kyis sems can rnams la nges par 'byung ba'i lam yang dag par rab tu ston te /
analyzed: brjod du med pa'i chos dang ldan zhing snying rje chen pos zin pa'i sems kyis sems can rnams la nges par 'byung ba'i lam yang dag par rab tu ston te /
translated: and inexpressible qualities. With a mind that is embraced by great compassion, he correctly teaches the path of deliverance to sentient beings.

original: de so sor rtog pas sems can der 'jug pa rnams de byed pa'i sdug bsngal yang dag par zad cing nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de so sor rtog pas sems can der 'jug pa rnams de byed pa'i sdug bsngal yang dag par zad cing nges par 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Through discernment, those sentient beings who engage in that will completely exhaust their suffering and attain deliverance.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: 'di ni / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa bzhi pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ni / de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa bzhi pa ste /
translated: this is the fourth fearlessness of the Tathāgatas.

original: mi 'jigs pa de dang ldan pas /
analyzed: mi 'jigs pa de dang ldan pas /
translated: Endowed with this fearlessness,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa 'khor gyi nang du sengge'i sgra yang dag par @115a *//
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa 'khor gyi nang du sengge'i sgra yang dag par @115a *//
translated: The Tathāgata’s lion’s roar in the midst of the assembly is🔽

analyzed: sgrog cing / khyu mchog gi gnas su zhal gyis 'che ste /
translated: The Tathāgata, in the midst of the assembly, roars the lion’s roar and proclaims the state of the supreme person:

original: dge sbyong ngam /🔽bram ze'am / lha'am /
analyzed: dge sbyong ngam / bram ze'am / lha'am /
translated: ‘Monks, I am fully awakened with regard to the world,🔽I am fully awakened with regard to the world.🔽I am the one who has attained the world’s peace,

original: bdud dam / tshangs pa'am /
analyzed: bdud dam / tshangs pa'am /
translated: the one who has attained the world’s supreme peace,🔽the one who has attained the world’s supreme peace.🔽I am the one who has attained the world’s supreme peace.🔽I am the one who has attained the world’s supreme peace.🔽I am the one who has attained the world’s supreme peace.🔽I am the one who has attained the world’s supreme peace.🔽I am the one who has attained the world’s supreme peace.

original: sus kyang 'jig rten 'dir chos dang mthun par ma bskor ba tshangs pa'i 'khor lo rab tu bskor to //🔽de ltar sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sus kyang 'jig rten 'dir chos dang mthun par ma bskor ba tshangs pa'i 'khor lo rab tu bskor to // de ltar sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: I am the one who has attained the world’s supreme peace.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa bzhi mtha' yas mu med do //🔽'di lta ste /🔽dper na / sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa bzhi mtha' yas mu med do // 'di lta ste / dper na / sh'a ri'i bu /

original: nam mkha'i mtha' 'dod do //
analyzed: nam mkha'i mtha' 'dod do //
translated: I am the one who has attained the world’s supreme

original: byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa de thos nas mngon par dad /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi de bzhin gshegs pa'i mi 'jigs pa bsam gyis mi khyab pa de thos nas mngon par dad /
translated: The bodhisattvas, having heard this inconceivable fearlessness of the Tathāgatas,🔽have faith,

original: yid ches / rab tu rtog /🔽som nyi med /
analyzed: yid ches / rab tu rtog / som nyi med /
translated: believe,🔽understand,

original: the tshom mi za /
analyzed: the tshom mi za /
translated: are without doubt,🔽and are free from uncertainty.

original: rgya cher dga' mgu ste rangs pa rnyed nas nam mkha' lta bur bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir ngo mtshar dang / rmad kyi bar du 'du shes bskyed do //
analyzed: rgya cher dga' mgu ste rangs pa rnyed nas nam mkha' lta bur bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir ngo mtshar dang / rmad kyi bar du 'du shes bskyed do //
translated: They are greatly delighted, joyful, and elated, and they generate the perception of wonder and marvel because of the inconceivability that is like space.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs so //
translated: Then the Bhagavān spoke these verses:

original: chos kun mnyam pa nyid mnyam par //
analyzed: chos kun mnyam pa nyid mnyam par //
translated: “All phenomena are equal

original: rang byung bas ni rjes su rtogs //
analyzed: rang byung bas ni rjes su rtogs //
translated: because of being realized by the self-originated one.

original: de phyir yang dag mngon sangs rgyas //
analyzed: de phyir yang dag mngon sangs rgyas //
translated: Therefore, the perfect buddha

original: de bzhin gshegs pas mnyam pa gzigs //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas mnyam pa gzigs //
translated: sees the equality of the tathāgatas.

original: so so'i @115b skye bo'i chos gang yin //
analyzed: so so'i @115b skye bo'i chos gang yin //
translated: “Whatever phenomena of ordinary beings

original: de dag sangs rgyas chos dang mnyam //
analyzed: de dag sangs rgyas chos dang mnyam //
translated: are equal to the phenomena of the buddhas,

original: slob dang mi slob chos rnams dang // rang rgyal gyi ni chos nyid dang // gang dag 'jig rten chos rnams dang / gang dag 'jig rten 'das chos dang // dge dang mi dge mi g-yo rnams //
analyzed: slob dang mi slob chos rnams dang // rang rgyal gyi ni chos nyid dang // gang dag 'jig rten chos rnams dang / gang dag 'jig rten 'das chos dang // dge dang mi dge mi g-yo rnams //
translated: The virtuous, non-virtuous, and neutral,

original: mya ngan 'das pa'i lam dang 'dra //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa'i lam dang 'dra //
translated: Are like the path to nirvāṇa.

original: stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med //
translated: Emptiness and the absence of marks,

original: smon lam dag ni rnam par spangs //
analyzed: smon lam dag ni rnam par spangs //
translated: The abandonment of aspirations,

original: ma skyes mngon par 'du mi byed //
analyzed: ma skyes mngon par 'du mi byed //
translated: The unborn and unconditioned,

original: 'di ni mnyam pa nyid du bstan //
analyzed: 'di ni mnyam pa nyid du bstan //
translated: This is taught to be sameness.

original: 'di dag mnyam pa nyid rtogs nas //
analyzed: 'di dag mnyam pa nyid rtogs nas //
translated: Having realized the sameness of these,

original: thub pa chen po mi 'jigs pa /
analyzed: thub pa chen po mi 'jigs pa /
translated: The fearless Great Sage

original: gang gis sems can grol 'gyur ba //
analyzed: gang gis sems can grol 'gyur ba //
translated: Liberates sentient beings

original: de bzhin du yang rab tu ston //
analyzed: de bzhin du yang rab tu ston //
translated: And likewise teaches them.

original: 'jig rten gsum las rnam par grol //
analyzed: 'jig rten gsum las rnam par grol //
translated: Liberated from the three worlds,

original: rnam par thar pa rab tu ston //
analyzed: rnam par thar pa rab tu ston //
translated: He teaches perfect liberation.

original: mi dbang gi ni mi 'jigs pa //
analyzed: mi dbang gi ni mi 'jigs pa //
translated: The fearless one, the Lord of Humans,

original: gnyis pa yang dag rab tu bstan //
analyzed: gnyis pa yang dag rab tu bstan //
translated: Correctly teaches the second truth:

original: rgyal bas gang chos rjes su sangs rgyas pa //
analyzed: rgyal bas gang chos rjes su sangs rgyas pa //
translated: The Dharma that the Victor has realized

original: ma bsten par ni rnam par grol mi 'thob //
analyzed: ma bsten par ni rnam par grol mi 'thob //
translated: Is not attained through liberation without reliance.

original: bag med pa dang khrel ba med gyur dang // gang la ngo tsha ci yang med pa dang // lus dang ngag rnams dang ni yid kyis su //
analyzed: bag med pa dang khrel ba med gyur dang // gang la ngo tsha ci yang med pa dang // lus dang ngag rnams dang ni yid kyis su //
translated: “Those who are careless and shameless, Who have no sense of shame at all, And who have no restraint in body, speech, and mind,

original: gang dag sdom pa nam yang yod min dang // 'dun dang zhe sdang gti mug 'jigs pa dang / srog gcod pa dang gzhan la 'tshe ba dang / gzhan gyi chung ma de bzhin brdzun dang chang //🔽nga rgyal mi gus de bzhin bdun pa'o //
analyzed: gang dag sdom pa nam yang yod min dang // 'dun dang zhe sdang gti mug 'jigs pa dang / srog gcod pa dang gzhan la 'tshe ba dang / gzhan gyi chung ma de bzhin brdzun dang chang // nga rgyal mi gus de bzhin bdun pa'o //
translated: “Those who have no restraint at all, Who kill and harm others out of desire, anger, and ignorance, Who have sexual relations with others’ wives and lie and drink alcohol,

original: gang dag log par smra ba brgyad pa ste /
analyzed: gang dag log par smra ba brgyad pa ste /
translated: “Who are arrogant and disrespectful, and who are the eighth, Who engage in the eight wrong paths,

original: thams cad rnam par grol ba'i lam rgyud gcod //
analyzed: thams cad rnam par grol ba'i lam rgyud gcod //
translated: Cut the continuity of the path to liberation for all.

original: gang dag mnar sems dgu dang nyes mang dang / mi dge bcu yi las kyi lam rnams dang / gang dag tshul min zhi ba mi @116a *//
analyzed: gang dag mnar sems dgu dang nyes mang dang / mi dge bcu yi las kyi lam rnams dang / gang dag tshul min zhi ba mi @116a *//
translated: “Those who have the nine kinds of malice and many faults, Who engage in the ten unwholesome courses of action, And who do not know the proper way to be peaceful,

original: shes pa; ;de dag la ni nam yang thar pa med //
analyzed: shes pa; ;de dag la ni nam yang thar pa med //
translated: Will never be liberated.

original: phyin ci log la zhugs par rig gyur nas //
analyzed: phyin ci log la zhugs par rig gyur nas //
translated: “Knowing that they have entered into error,

original: bag med yang dag ma yin smra la chags //
analyzed: bag med yang dag ma yin smra la chags //
translated: They are attached to carelessness and false speech.

original: rgyal ba rnams kyi mi 'jigs gsum pa ste //
analyzed: rgyal ba rnams kyi mi 'jigs gsum pa ste //
translated: Is the third fearlessness of the Victorious Ones.

original: chos nyid 'di dag la ni bsnyen par bya //
analyzed: chos nyid 'di dag la ni bsnyen par bya //
translated: You should approach these dharmatās.

original: gang dag rnam sbyong sgo ni tshad med la //
analyzed: gang dag rnam sbyong sgo ni tshad med la //
translated: The immeasurable gateways for purifying

original: mi gang ston pa byang chub reg par 'gyur //
analyzed: mi gang ston pa byang chub reg par 'gyur //
translated: The person who teaches will reach awakening.

original: rgyal ba nyid kyis ma thos thams cad rig /
analyzed: rgyal ba nyid kyis ma thos thams cad rig /
translated: The Victorious One knows everything that has not been heard.

original: shes nas mi 'chir 'gro ba'i chos 'chad do //
analyzed: shes nas mi 'chir 'gro ba'i chos 'chad do //
translated: Having known, he teaches the Dharma for the benefit of beings.

original: ji tsam dge ba'i chos ni mang yod pa //
analyzed: ji tsam dge ba'i chos ni mang yod pa //
translated: To the extent that there are many virtuous dharmas,

original: byang chub phyogs dge rgyal bas bsngags pa la //
analyzed: byang chub phyogs dge rgyal bas bsngags pa la //
translated: The Victorious One praises the virtuous factors of awakening.🔽Relying on them, the liberated ones do not quarrel.

original: bsten pa rnam par thar pa mi 'thab pa; ;gnas med par ni stobs bcu rnams kyis bshad //
analyzed: bsten pa rnam par thar pa mi 'thab pa; ;gnas med par ni stobs bcu rnams kyis bshad //
translated: The ones with the ten powers explain that there is no abode.

original: tshul bzhin gyis ni nyon mongs mang po zhi //
analyzed: tshul bzhin gyis ni nyon mongs mang po zhi //
translated: Through proper conduct, the many afflictions are pacified.

original: yang dag chos dge mnyam pa med ldan zhing //
analyzed: yang dag chos dge mnyam pa med ldan zhing //
translated: The perfect virtuous Dharma is endowed with equality.🔽One is not attached to Dharma or non-Dharma,

original: chos dang chos ma yin la de mi chags; ;zhi ba mya ngan med pa rnam grol reg /
analyzed: chos dang chos ma yin la de mi chags; ;zhi ba mya ngan med pa rnam grol reg /
translated: And reaches the peace, the deathless, liberation.

original: gsog gsob nam mkha' 'dra zhing ya ma brla //
analyzed: gsog gsob nam mkha' 'dra zhing ya ma brla //
translated: Empty, hollow, like space,

original: sgyu ma'i gzugs 'dra nam mkha' lta bu dang // dge chos rnam pa gang gis rab shes pa; ;de ni srid pa'i mtsho las thar par 'gyur //🔽thub pa stobs bcu rnams kyi chos 'di ni //
analyzed: sgyu ma'i gzugs 'dra nam mkha' lta bu dang // dge chos rnam pa gang gis rab shes pa; ;de ni srid pa'i mtsho las thar par 'gyur // thub pa stobs bcu rnams kyi chos 'di ni //
translated: Like an illusory form, like space,🔽By whatever virtuous qualities one understands,🔽One will be liberated from the ocean of existence.🔽🔽This is the Dharma of the Sage with the ten powers.🔽

original: yid ches / rab tu rtog /🔽som nyi med /
analyzed: yid ches / rab tu rtog / som nyi med /
translated: “Śāriputra, if bodhisattvas have faith in, have conviction in, and have certainty about the inconceivable great compassion of the tathāgatas,🔽from not having doubts up to not having uncertainty,

original: the tshom mi za ba nas ngo mtshar dang / rmad kyi bar du 'du shes bskyed ce na /
analyzed: the tshom mi za ba nas ngo mtshar dang / rmad kyi bar du 'du shes bskyed ce na /
translated: and generate the perception of it being a wonder and a marvel,

original: 'di la sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: 'di la sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: then, Śāriputra,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi snying rje chen po ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa rnams kyi snying rje chen po ni /
translated: the great compassion of the tathāgatas

original: sems can thams cad rjes su mi gtong zhing rtag tu 'jug pa /
analyzed: sems can thams cad rjes su mi gtong zhing rtag tu 'jug pa /
translated: never abandons all sentient beings and is always engaged.

original: sems can yongs su smin par 'gyur ba ste /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par 'gyur ba ste /
translated: It is the ripening of sentient beings.

original: mi ldog par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: mi ldog par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be known to be irreversible.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying rje chen po de yang ji ltar dag gi las kyis kyang khong du chud par bya ba sla ba ma yin pa de ltar bsam gyis mi khyab /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying rje chen po de yang ji ltar dag gi las kyis kyang khong du chud par bya ba sla ba ma yin pa de ltar bsam gyis mi khyab /
translated: “That great compassion of the tathāgatas is inconceivable in that it is not easily understood even by the work of the intellect.

original: de ltar mtshungs pa med /🔽de ltar dpag tu med /
analyzed: de ltar mtshungs pa med / de ltar dpag tu med /
translated: It is incomparable.🔽It is immeasurable.

original: de ltar brjod du med /
analyzed: de ltar brjod du med /
translated: It is inexpressible.

original: de ltar mi bzad cing khong du chud par dka'o //
analyzed: de ltar mi bzad cing khong du chud par dka'o //
translated: It is thus that the Tathāgata’s great compassion is difficult to fathom.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pas byang chub thob pa de ltar sems can la de bzhin gshegs pas snying rje chen po 'jug ste /
analyzed: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pas byang chub thob pa de ltar sems can la de bzhin gshegs pas snying rje chen po 'jug ste /
translated: The Tathāgata’s great compassion for sentient beings is like the Tathāgata’s attainment of enlightenment.

original: byang chub ci 'dra ba snying rje chen po yang de 'dra'o //
analyzed: byang chub ci 'dra ba snying rje chen po yang de 'dra'o //
translated: Just as is enlightenment, so is great compassion.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas byang chub ji ltar thob ce na /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas byang chub ji ltar thob ce na /
translated: How does the Tathāgata attain enlightenment?

original: de bzhin gshegs pas rtsa ba med pa gnas med pa'i byang chub thob bo /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas rtsa ba med pa gnas med pa'i byang chub thob bo /
translated: The Tathāgata attains enlightenment that is rootless and groundless.

original: de la rtsa ba gang /
analyzed: de la rtsa ba gang /
translated: What is the root?

original: gnas gang zhe na /🔽'jig tshogs ni /🔽rtsa ba'o // yang dag pa ma yin pa kun tu rtog pa ni /
analyzed: gnas gang zhe na / 'jig tshogs ni / rtsa ba'o // yang dag pa ma yin pa kun tu rtog pa ni /
translated: What is the ground?🔽The root is the perishable collection view.

original: gnas so // @117a *//
analyzed: gnas so // @117a *//
translated: The ground is the imagination of what is unreal.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas byang chub mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir de dag mnyam par mkhyen te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas byang chub mnyam pa nyid kyi phyir de dag mnyam par mkhyen te /
translated: The Tathāgata knows that they are the same because enlightenment is the same.

original: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pas rtsa ba med pa gnas med pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pas rtsa ba med pa gnas med pa'i byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas zhes bya ste /
translated: Therefore, the Tathāgata is said to have attained enlightenment that is rootless and groundless.

original: sems can 'di dag ni /
analyzed: sems can 'di dag ni /
translated: “These sentient beings

original: rtsa ba med pa /
analyzed: rtsa ba med pa /
translated: are without root,

original: gnas med pa mi shes pa de dag shes par bya'o //
analyzed: gnas med pa mi shes pa de dag shes par bya'o //
translated: without basis. Those who do not know this should know it.”

original: zhes sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying rje chen po 'jug go /
analyzed: zhes sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying rje chen po 'jug go /
translated: Thus, Śāriputra, the great compassion of the Tathāgata extends to sentient beings.

original: gzhan yang sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: gzhan yang sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Moreover, Śāriputra,

original: byang chub ni /
analyzed: byang chub ni /
translated: enlightenment

original: zhi ba dang / nye bar zhi ba'o //
analyzed: zhi ba dang / nye bar zhi ba'o //
translated: is peace and tranquility.

original: de ji ltar zhi /
analyzed: de ji ltar zhi /
translated: How is it peace?

original: ji ltar nye bar zhi zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar nye bar zhi zhe na /
translated: How is it tranquility?

original: nang zhi ba'o //
analyzed: nang zhi ba'o //
translated: It is peace internally.

original: phyi rol nye bar zhi ba'o; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: phyi rol nye bar zhi ba'o; ;de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: It is tranquility externally. Why is that?

original: mig ni / bdag gam bdag gis stong ste /
analyzed: mig ni / bdag gam bdag gis stong ste /
translated: The eye is empty of self and what belongs to self.🔽Its nature

original: de'i rang bzhin ni /🔽'di yin pas na /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ni / 'di yin pas na /
translated: is this.

original: de'i phyir zhi ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhi ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called “peace.”

original: de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid ni /
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid ni /
translated: Similarly, the ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind

original: bdag dang bdag gis stong ste /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gis stong ste /
translated: are empty of self and what belongs to self.🔽Their nature

original: de'i rang bzhin 'di yin pas na /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin 'di yin pas na /
translated: is this.

original: de'i phyir zhi ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhi ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called “peace.”

original: de mig stong par yongs su shes nas gzugs la mi rgyug ste /
analyzed: de mig stong par yongs su shes nas gzugs la mi rgyug ste /
translated: Having fully understood the eye to be empty, one does not run toward forms.

original: de'i phyir nye bar zhi ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir nye bar zhi ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called “tranquility.”

original: yid kyi bar du yang stong par yongs su shes nas chos la mi rgyug ste /
analyzed: yid kyi bar du yang stong par yongs su shes nas chos la mi rgyug ste /
translated: Having fully understood that the mind is also empty, he does not run toward phenomena.

original: de'i phyir nye bar zhi zhes bya na /
analyzed: de'i phyir nye bar zhi zhes bya na /
translated: Therefore, he is said to be ‘peaceful.’

original: sems can 'di dag ni /
analyzed: sems can 'di dag ni /
translated: But these sentient beings

original: zhi ba dang / nye bar zhi ba 'di mi shes te /
analyzed: zhi ba dang / nye bar zhi ba 'di mi shes te /
translated: do not understand this peace and this tranquility.

original: de dag shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag shes par bya'o //
translated: I will make them understand!

original: zhes sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying rje chen po 'jug go /
analyzed: zhes sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying rje chen po 'jug go /
translated: Thus, the Tathāgata’s great compassion extends to sentient beings.

original: gzhan yang sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: gzhan yang sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Moreover, Śāriputra,

original: ngas ni / rang bzhin gyis 'od @117b gsal ba byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: ngas ni / rang bzhin gyis 'od @117b gsal ba byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: I have fully awakened to the enlightenment that is naturally luminous.

original: ji ltar 'od gsal zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'od gsal zhe na /
translated: How is it luminous?

original: rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni /
analyzed: rang bzhin gang yin pa de ni /
translated: That which is its nature

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa med pa ste /
translated: is free from afflictive emotions.

original: nam mkha' lta bu'o //🔽nam mkha'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' lta bu'o // nam mkha'i rang bzhin no //
translated: It is like space.🔽It is the nature of space.

original: nam mkha' ni /
analyzed: nam mkha' ni /
translated: Space

original: rjes su 'brang ba'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'brang ba'o //
translated: is a continuum.

original: nam mkha' dang mnyam pa nyid kyis mnyam pa ste /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang mnyam pa nyid kyis mnyam pa ste /
translated: It is equal because it is equal to space.

original: de ni / rang bzhin gyis shin tu 'od gsal bas na /
analyzed: de ni / rang bzhin gyis shin tu 'od gsal bas na /
translated: It is naturally very luminous.

original: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba 'di khong du ma chud pas byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams glo bur gyi nyon mongs pas kun nas nyon mongs te /
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba 'di khong du ma chud pas byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams glo bur gyi nyon mongs pas kun nas nyon mongs te /
translated: Because they do not understand this natural luminosity, childish ordinary beings are completely afflicted by adventitious afflictions.

original: sems can rnams rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba 'di mi shes pas /
analyzed: sems can rnams rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba 'di mi shes pas /
translated: Sentient beings do not understand this natural luminosity.

original: de dag rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: They should understand this natural luminosity.

original: zhes sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying rje chen po 'jug go /
analyzed: zhes sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying rje chen po 'jug go /
translated: Thus the Tathāgata’s great compassion engages for sentient beings.

original: gzhan yang sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: gzhan yang sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Moreover, Śāriputra,

original: ngas ni / blang ba med pa dang / dor ba med par byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //🔽de la blang ba med pa gang /
analyzed: ngas ni / blang ba med pa dang / dor ba med par byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so // de la blang ba med pa gang /
translated: I have fully awakened to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment without accepting or rejecting anything.🔽What is it to not accept anything?

original: dor ba med pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dor ba med pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is it to not reject anything?

original: blang ba med pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: blang ba med pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Not accepting anything means

original: chos thams cad mi 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad mi 'dzin pa'o //
translated: not grasping at any phenomena.

original: dor ba med pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: dor ba med pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Not rejecting anything means

original: chos thams cad rab tu 'dzin pa med pa'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad rab tu 'dzin pa med pa'o //
translated: not grasping at any phenomena at all.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pas blangs ba med pa dang / dor ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid mnyam pa nyid du gzigs te /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pas blangs ba med pa dang / dor ba med pa'i ngo bo nyid mnyam pa nyid du gzigs te /
translated: The Tathāgata sees the reality of non-appropriation and non-rejection as being the same.

original: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pas tshu rol med pa dang / pha rol med par gzigs pa de ltar chos thams cad tshu rol dang / pha rol dang bral bar de bzhin gshegs pas mngon par rdzogs @118a *//🔽par sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pas tshu rol med pa dang / pha rol med par gzigs pa de ltar chos thams cad tshu rol dang / pha rol dang bral bar de bzhin gshegs pas mngon par rdzogs @118a *// par sangs rgyas te /
translated: Just as the Tathāgata sees neither this shore nor the farther shore, so the Tathāgata, fully awakened, sees all things as free from this shore and the farther shore.

original: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya'o //🔽blang ba med pa dang / dor ba med pa 'di sems can rnams kyis khong du ma chud pas de khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa zhes bya'o // blang ba med pa dang / dor ba med pa 'di sems can rnams kyis khong du ma chud pas de khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, he is called the Tathāgata.

original: zhes sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying rje chen po 'jug go /
analyzed: zhes sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying rje chen po 'jug go /
translated: Since sentient beings do not understand non-appropriation and non-rejection, the Tathāgata’s great compassion for sentient beings engages in order to cause them to understand.

original: gzhan yang sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: gzhan yang sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Moreover, Śāriputra,

original: ngas mtshan ma med pa dang / dmigs pa med par byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: ngas mtshan ma med pa dang / dmigs pa med par byang chub tu mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: I have fully awakened to awakening as signless and reference-less.

original: de la mtshan ma med pa gang /
analyzed: de la mtshan ma med pa gang /
translated: What is signless?

original: dmigs pa med pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the absence of apprehension?

original: mig gis rnam par shes pa mi dmigs pa ni /
analyzed: mig gis rnam par shes pa mi dmigs pa ni /
translated: The non-apprehension of visual consciousness

original: mtshan ma med pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'o //
translated: is the absence of signs.

original: gzugs yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ni /
analyzed: gzugs yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ni /
translated: The non-perception of form

original: dmigs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa'o //
translated: is the absence of apprehension.

original: yid kyis rnam par shes pa'i bar du mi dmigs pa ni /
analyzed: yid kyis rnam par shes pa'i bar du mi dmigs pa ni /
translated: The non-apprehension of mental consciousness

original: mtshan ma med pa'o //🔽chos yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ni /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'o // chos yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ni /
translated: is the absence of signs.🔽The non-perception of mental objects

original: dmigs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa'o //
translated: is the absence of apprehension.

original: de ltar sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: de ltar sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Thus, Śāriputra,

original: mtshan ma med pa dang / dmigs pa med pa ni /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa dang / dmigs pa med pa ni /
translated: the absence of signs and the absence of apprehension

original: 'phags pa rnams kyi spyod yul lo //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyi spyod yul lo //
translated: are the domain of the noble ones.🔽What is the domain of the noble ones?

original: 'phags pa rnams kyi spyod yul gang zhe na; khams gsum pa ni /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyi spyod yul gang zhe na; khams gsum pa ni /
translated: The three realms

original: 'phags pa rnams kyi spyod yul te /
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyi spyod yul te /
translated: are the domain of the noble ones.

original: gang 'phags pa rnams kyi spyod yul de ni /
analyzed: gang 'phags pa rnams kyi spyod yul de ni /
translated: That which is the domain of the noble ones

original: byis pa so so'i skye bo thams cad kyi spyod yul ma yin pas /
analyzed: byis pa so so'i skye bo thams cad kyi spyod yul ma yin pas /
translated: is not the domain of all foolish ordinary beings.

original: de khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: One should understand this.

original: zhes sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying rje chen po 'jug go /
analyzed: zhes sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying rje chen po 'jug go /
translated: Thus, the Tathāgata’s great compassion extends to sentient beings.

original: gang sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: gang sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: byang chub ni /
analyzed: byang chub ni /
translated: enlightenment

original: 'das pa ma yin /
analyzed: 'das pa ma yin /
translated: is not past,

original: ma 'ongs pa ma yin /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa ma yin /
translated: not future,

original: da ltar @118b byung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: da ltar @118b byung ba ma yin te /
translated: and not present.

original: dus gsum mnyam pa nyid 'khor gsum yongs su chad pa'o //
analyzed: dus gsum mnyam pa nyid 'khor gsum yongs su chad pa'o //
translated: It is the sameness of the three times, the complete elimination of the three spheres.

original: de la 'khor gsum yongs su chad pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'khor gsum yongs su chad pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the complete elimination of the three spheres?

original: gang 'das pa la sems mi 'jug pa dang / ma 'ongs pa la rnam par shes pa rjes su mi rgyug pa dang / da ltar byung ba la yid la byed pa mi 'jug pa ste /
analyzed: gang 'das pa la sems mi 'jug pa dang / ma 'ongs pa la rnam par shes pa rjes su mi rgyug pa dang / da ltar byung ba la yid la byed pa mi 'jug pa ste /
translated: It is the non-engagement of the mind in the past, the non-pursuit of consciousness in the future, and the non-engagement of attention in the present.

original: de sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa la mi gnas pas 'das pa la mi rtog /
analyzed: de sems dang / yid dang / rnam par shes pa la mi gnas pas 'das pa la mi rtog /
translated: Since it does not dwell in mind, thought, or consciousness, it does not conceptualize the past,

original: ma 'ongs pa la rlom sems su mi byed /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa la rlom sems su mi byed /
translated: does not imagine the future,

original: da ltar byung ba la spros par mi byed pa 'di ni /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba la spros par mi byed pa 'di ni /
translated: and does not proliferate about the present.

original: dus gsum mnyam pa nyid 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa yin na /
analyzed: dus gsum mnyam pa nyid 'khor gsum yongs su dag pa yin na /
translated: This is the sameness of the three times, the complete purification of the three spheres.

original: sems can rnams kyis khong du ma chud pas de khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyis khong du ma chud pas de khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Since sentient beings do not comprehend it, they should comprehend it.

original: zhes sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying rje chen po 'jug go /
analyzed: zhes sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying rje chen po 'jug go /
translated: Thus the great compassion of the Tathāgata extends to all sentient beings.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: ngas byang chub ni /
analyzed: ngas byang chub ni /
translated: I have awakened to this awakening

original: lus med pa /🔽mngon par 'dus ma byas par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
analyzed: lus med pa / mngon par 'dus ma byas par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas te /
translated: which is not a body,🔽which is not a product of conditions.

original: de ni / mig gi rnam par shes pas rnam par shes par bya ba ma yin pa nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar gyis rnam par shes par bya ba ma yin no //🔽'dus ma byas zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: de ni / mig gi rnam par shes pas rnam par shes par bya ba ma yin pa nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar gyis rnam par shes par bya ba ma yin no // 'dus ma byas zhes bya ba ni /
translated: It is not an object of knowledge of the eye consciousness, up to and including the mind consciousness.🔽What is called unconditioned

original: gang ma skyes pa /
analyzed: gang ma skyes pa /
translated: is unborn,

original: mi 'jig pa /
analyzed: mi 'jig pa /
translated: undestroyed,

original: mi gnas pa de ni /
analyzed: mi gnas pa de ni /
translated: and non-abiding.

original: 'khor gsum dang bral ba 'dus ma byas zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'khor gsum dang bral ba 'dus ma byas zhes bya'o //
translated: That is called unconditioned, free from the three spheres.

original: 'dus ma byas ji lta bar 'dus byas kyang de ltar khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ji lta bar 'dus byas kyang de ltar khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Just as the unconditioned, so too should the conditioned be understood.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin de ni /
analyzed: gang chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin de ni /
translated: The nature of all phenomena

original: dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'o //
translated: is non-entity.

original: gang dngos po med pa de la gnyis su med de /
analyzed: gang dngos po med pa de la gnyis su med de /
translated: That which is non-entity is non-dual.

original: lus med pa /
analyzed: lus med pa /
translated: It is not a body,

original: @119a *// mngon par 'dus ma byas pa de sems can rnams kyis khong du ma chud pas de khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: @119a *// mngon par 'dus ma byas pa de sems can rnams kyis khong du ma chud pas de khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Since sentient beings do not understand that which is unconditioned, they should understand it.🔽

original: zhes sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying rje chen po 'jug go /
analyzed: zhes sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying rje chen po 'jug go /
translated: The Thus-Gone One’s great compassion for sentient beings is as follows: ‘Sentient beings do not understand the unconditioned, so I will help them understand it.🔽’

original: sh'a ri'i bu /🔽ngas byang chub ni /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu / ngas byang chub ni /
translated: Śāriputra,🔽I have awakened to the indivisible awakening

original: dbyer med pa dang / gnas su mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: dbyer med pa dang / gnas su mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: and to the abode.

original: de la dbyer med pa gang /
analyzed: de la dbyer med pa gang /
translated: What is indivisible?

original: gnas gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnas gang zhe na /
translated: What is the abode?

original: de la de bzhin nyid ni /🔽gnas so // gnas med pa ni /
analyzed: de la de bzhin nyid ni / gnas so // gnas med pa ni /
translated: The suchness of phenomena is the abode,

original: dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: dbyer med pa'o //
translated: and the absence of abode is indivisible.

original: chos kyi dbyings ni /🔽gnas so // tha dad pa med pa ni /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings ni / gnas so // tha dad pa med pa ni /
translated: The realm of phenomena is the abode,

original: dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: dbyer med pa'o //
translated: and the absence of differentiation is indivisible.

original: yang dag pa'i mtha' ni /🔽gnas so // g-yo ba med pa ni /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha' ni / gnas so // g-yo ba med pa ni /
translated: The limit of reality is the abode,

original: dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: dbyer med pa'o //
translated: and the absence of movement is indivisible.

original: stong pa nyid ni /
analyzed: stong pa nyid ni /
translated: Emptiness is the abode,🔽and the absence of reference points is indivisible.

original: gnas so // dmigs su med pa ni /🔽dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: gnas so // dmigs su med pa ni / dbyer med pa'o //
translated: The absence of marks is the abode,

original: mtshan ma med pa ni /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa ni /
translated: and the absence of concepts is indivisible.

original: gnas so // rnam par mi rtog pa ni /🔽dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: gnas so // rnam par mi rtog pa ni / dbyer med pa'o //
translated: The absence of wishes is the abode,

original: smon pa med pa ni /
analyzed: smon pa med pa ni /
translated: and the absence of aspirations is indivisible.

original: gnas so // 'jug pa med pa ni /
analyzed: gnas so // 'jug pa med pa ni /
translated: It is the basis.

original: dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: dbyer med pa'o //
translated: Non-engagement is the indivisible.

original: sems can med pa ni /🔽gnas so // sems can med pa'i rang bzhin ni /
analyzed: sems can med pa ni / gnas so // sems can med pa'i rang bzhin ni /
translated: The absence of sentient beings is the basis.

original: dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: dbyer med pa'o //
translated: The nature of the absence of sentient beings is the indivisible.

original: nam mkha' ni /🔽gnas so // mi dmigs pa ni /
analyzed: nam mkha' ni / gnas so // mi dmigs pa ni /
translated: Space is the basis.

original: dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: dbyer med pa'o //
translated: Non-apprehension is the indivisible.

original: mi skye ba ni /🔽gnas so // mi 'gag pa ni /
analyzed: mi skye ba ni / gnas so // mi 'gag pa ni /
translated: Non-arising is the basis.

original: dbyer med pa'o //🔽'dus ma byas ni /🔽gnas so // rgyu ba med pa ni /
analyzed: dbyer med pa'o // 'dus ma byas ni / gnas so // rgyu ba med pa ni /
translated: Non-cessation is the indivisible.🔽The unconditioned is the basis.

original: dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: dbyer med pa'o //
translated: Non-movement is the indivisible.

original: byang chub ni /🔽gnas so // nye bar zhi ba ni /
analyzed: byang chub ni / gnas so // nye bar zhi ba ni /
translated: Awakening is the basis.

original: dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: dbyer med pa'o //
translated: Peace is the indivisible.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa ni /🔽gnas so // mngon par mi 'grub pa ni /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa ni / gnas so // mngon par mi 'grub pa ni /
translated: Nirvāṇa is the basis.

original: dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: dbyer med pa'o //
translated: Non-establishment is the indivisible.

original: de ltar sh'a ri'i bu /🔽@119b dbyer med pa'i gnas 'di sems can rnams kyis khong du ma chud pas de khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar sh'a ri'i bu / @119b dbyer med pa'i gnas 'di sems can rnams kyis khong du ma chud pas de khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Thus, Śāriputra,

original: zhes sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying rje chen po 'jug go /
analyzed: zhes sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying rje chen po 'jug go /
translated: since sentient beings do not understand this indivisible basis, the Tathāgata's great compassion engages with sentient beings, thinking, 'I will cause them to understand that.'

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: byang chub ni /
analyzed: byang chub ni /
translated: awakening is

original: lus kyis mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas te /
analyzed: lus kyis mngon par rdzogs par sangs ma rgyas te /
translated: It is not fully awakened through the body,

original: sems kyis kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: sems kyis kyang ma yin no //
translated: nor is it fully awakened through the mind.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: lus ni / bem po //
analyzed: lus ni / bem po //
translated: The body is inanimate,

original: g-yo ba med pa /
analyzed: g-yo ba med pa /
translated: motionless,

original: byed pa med pa /
analyzed: byed pa med pa /
translated: and inactive,

original: rtsva dang / shing dang / rdo dang / mig yor lta bu'o //
analyzed: rtsva dang / shing dang / rdo dang / mig yor lta bu'o //
translated: like grass, trees, stones, and mirages.

original: sems ni / sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / chu zla lta bu ste /
analyzed: sems ni / sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / chu zla lta bu ste /
translated: The mind is like an illusion, a mirage, and the reflection of the moon in water.

original: gang gis lus dang / sems de ltar khong du chud pa de ni /
analyzed: gang gis lus dang / sems de ltar khong du chud pa de ni /
translated: One who understands the body and the mind in this way

original: byang chub ces bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub ces bya'o //
translated: is said to be awakened.

original: byang chub ni; tha snyad tsam du bzung ba ste /
analyzed: byang chub ni; tha snyad tsam du bzung ba ste /
translated: Awakening is apprehended as merely a convention.

original: byang chub ni /
analyzed: byang chub ni /
translated: Awakening

original: lus sam / sems sam /
analyzed: lus sam / sems sam /
translated: is not the body, the mind,

original: chos ma yin pa'am /🔽yang dag pa ma yin pa'am /
analyzed: chos ma yin pa'am / yang dag pa ma yin pa'am /
translated: a phenomenon,🔽something real,

original: bden pa'am / rdzun pa gang gis kyang brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: bden pa'am / rdzun pa gang gis kyang brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: or something false. It cannot be expressed in any way.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: And why is that?

original: byang chub ni /
analyzed: byang chub ni /
translated: Awakening

original: chos thams cad kyis brjod par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: chos thams cad kyis brjod par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: cannot be expressed by any phenomenon.

original: byang chub la ni /
analyzed: byang chub la ni /
translated: Awakening

original: gang gis kyang tshig gi tha snyad du 'gyur ba'i gnas cung zad kyang med do //🔽ji ltar nam mkha' gnas med cing tshig med pa de bzhin du byang chub kyang gnas med pa /
analyzed: gang gis kyang tshig gi tha snyad du 'gyur ba'i gnas cung zad kyang med do // ji ltar nam mkha' gnas med cing tshig med pa de bzhin du byang chub kyang gnas med pa /
translated: There is not even the slightest basis for verbal expression.

original: brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: Just as space is without basis and without words, so awakening is without basis and without words.

original: de ltar sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: de ltar sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Śāriputra,

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin tshol ba na chos thams cad tshig med pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin tshol ba na chos thams cad tshig med pa ste /
translated: when seeking the way things really are, all phenomena are without words.

original: chos la tshig med /
analyzed: chos la tshig med /
translated: Phenomena are not words,

original: tshig la yang chos med do //
analyzed: tshig la yang chos med do //
translated: and words are not phenomena.

original: de lta bu'i chos kyi tshul mi shes shing khong du ma chud pas de khong du chud par bya'o //🔽zhes sems can @120a *//
analyzed: de lta bu'i chos kyi tshul mi shes shing khong du ma chud pas de khong du chud par bya'o // zhes sems can @120a *//
translated: Not knowing and not understanding such a way of phenomena, one should understand it.

original: rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying rje chen po 'jug go /
analyzed: rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying rje chen po 'jug go /
translated: Thus, the tathāgatas’ great compassion extends to sentient beings.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Śāriputra,

original: byang chub ni /
analyzed: byang chub ni /
translated: awakening

original: gzung ba med pa /
analyzed: gzung ba med pa /
translated: is ungraspable

original: kun gzhi med pa'o //
analyzed: kun gzhi med pa'o //
translated: and without a basis.

original: de la gzung ba med pa gang kun gzhi med pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la gzung ba med pa gang kun gzhi med pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is meant by ungraspable and without a basis?

original: 'di lta ste /🔽mig yongs su shes pa ni /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / mig yongs su shes pa ni /
translated: It is as follows:

original: gzung ba med pa'o //
analyzed: gzung ba med pa'o //
translated: The complete understanding of the eye is ungraspable.

original: gzugs yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ni /
analyzed: gzugs yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ba ni /
translated: Not seeing form is

original: kun gzhi med pa'o //
analyzed: kun gzhi med pa'o //
translated: the absence of the all-base.

original: yid kyi bar du yongs su shes pa ni /
analyzed: yid kyi bar du yongs su shes pa ni /
translated: Understanding the mind up to the mental factors

original: gzung ba med pa'o //
analyzed: gzung ba med pa'o //
translated: is the absence of apprehended objects.

original: chos mi dmigs pa ni /
analyzed: chos mi dmigs pa ni /
translated: Not observing phenomena

original: kun gzhi med pa ste /
analyzed: kun gzhi med pa ste /
translated: is the absence of the all-base.

original: de ltar sh'a ri'i bu /🔽de bzhin gshegs pas gzung ba med pa /
analyzed: de ltar sh'a ri'i bu / de bzhin gshegs pas gzung ba med pa /
translated: Thus, Śāriputra,🔽the Tathāgata has fully awakened to awakening

original: kun gzhi med par byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: kun gzhi med par byang chub mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: as the absence of apprehended objects and the absence of the all-base.🔽Having fully awakened, he does not apprehend the eye,

original: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas mig mi 'dzin pa dang / gzugs kun gzhi med pas rnam par shes pa mi gnas so //
analyzed: mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas mig mi 'dzin pa dang / gzugs kun gzhi med pas rnam par shes pa mi gnas so //
translated: and because form is without the all-base, consciousness does not abide.

original: yid kyi bar du mi 'dzin cing chos kun gzhi med pas rnam par shes pa mi gnas so //
analyzed: yid kyi bar du mi 'dzin cing chos kun gzhi med pas rnam par shes pa mi gnas so //
translated: Up to the mind, he does not apprehend, and because phenomena are without the all-base, consciousness does not abide.

original: de rnam par shes pa mi gnas pas sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi gnas shes so //
analyzed: de rnam par shes pa mi gnas pas sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi gnas shes so //
translated: Because consciousness does not abide, he knows the mental states of all sentient beings.

original: ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How does he know?

original: sems can rnams kyi sems kyi gnas ni /
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi sems kyi gnas ni /
translated: The mental states of sentient beings

original: bzhi ste / bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: bzhi ste / bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: are four. What are the four?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: gzugs ni / sems kyi gnas so //
analyzed: gzugs ni / sems kyi gnas so //
translated: Form is the mental state.

original: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed ni; sems can rnams kyi sems kyi gnas te /
analyzed: tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed ni; sems can rnams kyi sems kyi gnas te /
translated: Feeling, perception, and volitional factors are the mind’s dwelling places for sentient beings.

original: 'di bzhi ni /
analyzed: 'di bzhi ni /
translated: These four

original: sems can rnams kyi sems kyi gnas so //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi sems kyi gnas so //
translated: are the mind’s dwelling places for sentient beings.

original: gnas de yang gnas med par de bzhin gshegs pas mkhyen te /🔽@120b gnas med pa'i mtha' 'di sems can rnams kyis khong du ma chud pas de khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: gnas de yang gnas med par de bzhin gshegs pas mkhyen te / @120b gnas med pa'i mtha' 'di sems can rnams kyis khong du ma chud pas de khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: The Tathāgata knows that dwelling place to be non-dwelling.

original: zhes sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying rje chen po 'jug go /
analyzed: zhes sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying rje chen po 'jug go /
translated: Sentient beings do not understand this non-dwelling limit, and so the Tathāgata’s great compassion arises for sentient beings, thinking, ‘I must make them understand this.’

original: sh'a ri'i bu /🔽byang chub ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu / byang chub ces bya ba ni /
translated: “Śāriputra,

original: stong pa nyid kyi tshig bla dvags so //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyi tshig bla dvags so //
translated: awakening is a term for emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid gang gis byang chub stong pa'i stong pa nyid de'i chos thams cad stong ste /
analyzed: stong pa nyid gang gis byang chub stong pa'i stong pa nyid de'i chos thams cad stong ste /
translated: The emptiness that is the emptiness of awakening is the emptiness of all phenomena.

original: de dag stong pa ji lta ba bzhin du /
analyzed: de dag stong pa ji lta ba bzhin du /
translated: Just as they are empty,

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pas chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas mod kyi /
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pas chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas mod kyi /
translated: the Tathāgata has fully awakened to all phenomena.

original: stong pa nyid kyis stong pa nyid mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa ni /🔽ma yin pas /
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyis stong pa nyid mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pa ni / ma yin pas /
translated: Emptiness is not awakened to by emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid dam byang chub ces bya ba 'di ni /
analyzed: stong pa nyid dam byang chub ces bya ba 'di ni /
translated: Therefore, this so-called emptiness or awakening

original: tshul gcig pa'i ye shes so //
analyzed: tshul gcig pa'i ye shes so //
translated: is the wisdom of a single principle.

original: de la gnyis po gang gis stong pa nyid dang / byang chub tu gnyis su dbye ba'i gnyis gang yang med do //
analyzed: de la gnyis po gang gis stong pa nyid dang / byang chub tu gnyis su dbye ba'i gnyis gang yang med do //
translated: In this regard, there is no duality whatsoever by which emptiness and awakening are divided into two.

original: chos de ni /
analyzed: chos de ni /
translated: This Dharma

original: gnyis su med cing gnyis su dbyar med de /
analyzed: gnyis su med cing gnyis su dbyar med de /
translated: is nondual and indivisible.

original: ming med pa /
analyzed: ming med pa /
translated: It is nameless,

original: mtshan ma med pa /🔽'jug pa med pa /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa / 'jug pa med pa /
translated: signless,🔽non-engaging,

original: rab tu rgyu ba med pa /
analyzed: rab tu rgyu ba med pa /
translated: non-proliferating,

original: spyod pa med pa'o //
analyzed: spyod pa med pa'o //
translated: and non-functioning.

original: gang stong pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gang stong pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: That which is called “empty”

original: mngon par chags pa dang / 'dzin pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: mngon par chags pa dang / 'dzin pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: is free from attachment and grasping.

original: don dam pa'i chos gang yang mi dmigs pas /
analyzed: don dam pa'i chos gang yang mi dmigs pas /
translated: Since no ultimate Dharma is observed,

original: stong pa nyid gang yin pa de stong zhes bya'o //
analyzed: stong pa nyid gang yin pa de stong zhes bya'o //
translated: that emptiness is called “empty.”

original: ji ltar nam mkha' nam mkha' zhes kyang bya la /
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' nam mkha' zhes kyang bya la /
translated: Just as space is called “space,”

original: nam mkha' ni /
analyzed: nam mkha' ni /
translated: but space

original: brjod par bya ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: brjod par bya ba yang ma yin no //
translated: is not something to be expressed.

original: de bzhin du stong pa zhes kyang bya la /
analyzed: de bzhin du stong pa zhes kyang bya la /
translated: In the same way, it is called emptiness.

original: stong pa nyid brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
analyzed: stong pa nyid brjod par bya ba ma yin no //
translated: But emptiness is not something that can be expressed.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: ming tsam du tha snyad 'dogs pa 'di ni /🔽chos thams cad la @121a *//
analyzed: ming tsam du tha snyad 'dogs pa 'di ni / chos thams cad la @121a *//
translated: The mere name is a conventional designation.

original: 'jug pa ste /🔽ming de yang yul na mi gnas /
analyzed: 'jug pa ste / ming de yang yul na mi gnas /
translated: It is the entry into all phenomena.

original: phyogs na mi gnas so //🔽ji ltar ming yul na mi gnas /
analyzed: phyogs na mi gnas so // ji ltar ming yul na mi gnas /
translated: That name does not exist in any place or direction.

original: phyogs na mi gnas pa de bzhin du /🔽chos ming gi tha snyad du 'dogs pa'i chos de yang yul na mi gnas /
analyzed: phyogs na mi gnas pa de bzhin du / chos ming gi tha snyad du 'dogs pa'i chos de yang yul na mi gnas /
translated: Just as that name does not exist in any place or direction,

original: phyogs na mi gnas te /
analyzed: phyogs na mi gnas te /
translated: so too the phenomena that are designated by names do not exist in any place or direction.

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pas chos thams cad mkhyen to //
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pas chos thams cad mkhyen to //
translated: In this way, the Tathāgata knows all phenomena.

original: thog ma nas ma skyes ma byung bar de ltar mkhyen pas de ltar rnam par gol te /
analyzed: thog ma nas ma skyes ma byung bar de ltar mkhyen pas de ltar rnam par gol te /
translated: Since he knows them as unborn and non-arisen from the beginning, he is free from such conceptualizations.

original: bcings pa yang med /
analyzed: bcings pa yang med /
translated: There is no bondage,

original: grol ba yang med na /
analyzed: grol ba yang med na /
translated: and there is no liberation.

original: de byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis khong du ma chud pas de khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: de byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis khong du ma chud pas de khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Since this is not understood by foolish ordinary beings, he causes them to understand it.

original: zhes sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying rje chen po 'jug go /
analyzed: zhes sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying rje chen po 'jug go /
translated: Thus the great compassion of the Tathāgata extends to all sentient beings.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /🔽byang chub ni /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu / byang chub ni /
translated: Śāriputra!

original: nam mkha' dang mnyam ste /🔽nam mkha' ni /🔽mnyam pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: nam mkha' dang mnyam ste / nam mkha' ni / mnyam pa yang ma yin /
translated: Awakening is equal to space.

original: mi mnyam pa'ang ma yin no //🔽byang chub kyang mnyam pa'ang ma yin //
analyzed: mi mnyam pa'ang ma yin no // byang chub kyang mnyam pa'ang ma yin //
translated: Space is neither equal nor unequal.

original: mi mnyam pa'ang ma yin te /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa'ang ma yin te /
translated: Awakening is also neither equal nor unequal.

original: de ji ltar chos rnams yang dag par yongs su grub pa med de /
analyzed: de ji ltar chos rnams yang dag par yongs su grub pa med de /
translated: How is it so? Phenomena are not truly established.

original: mnyam pa'am mi mnyam pa zhes brjod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mnyam pa'am mi mnyam pa zhes brjod pa ma yin no //
translated: They are not described as equal or unequal.

original: de ltar sh'a ri'i bu /🔽de bzhin gshegs pas chos thams cad mnyam pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: de ltar sh'a ri'i bu / de bzhin gshegs pas chos thams cad mnyam pa yang ma yin /
translated: Thus, Śāriputra,

original: mi mnyam pa yang ma yin par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //🔽ji ltar chos rdul tsam yang mnyam par byas pa yang ma yin /
analyzed: mi mnyam pa yang ma yin par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so // ji ltar chos rdul tsam yang mnyam par byas pa yang ma yin /
translated: the Tathāgata has fully awakened to all phenomena as neither equal nor unequal.

original: mi mnyam par byas pa yang ma yin pa de ltar mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: mi mnyam par byas pa yang ma yin pa de ltar mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: Just as not even an atom’s worth of phenomena is made equal or unequal, so has he fully awakened.

original: chos ji snyed pa de dag kyang yang dag pa'i @121b ye shes kyis shes so //
analyzed: chos ji snyed pa de dag kyang yang dag pa'i @121b ye shes kyis shes so //
translated: All these phenomena are known through correct wisdom.

original: yang dag pa'i ye shes gang zhe na /
analyzed: yang dag pa'i ye shes gang zhe na /
translated: What is correct wisdom?

original: chos ma byung ba rnams 'byung ba dang / byung nas 'jig par 'gyur ba de dag ni /
analyzed: chos ma byung ba rnams 'byung ba dang / byung nas 'jig par 'gyur ba de dag ni /
translated: Phenomena that have not yet arisen arise, and once arisen, they cease.

original: bdag po med par 'byung /
analyzed: bdag po med par 'byung /
translated: They arise without a master,

original: bdag po med par 'jig ste /
analyzed: bdag po med par 'jig ste /
translated: and they cease without a master.

original: rkyen gyis 'byung ba dang / 'jig par 'gyur zhing /🔽'di la 'jug pa'am /
analyzed: rkyen gyis 'byung ba dang / 'jig par 'gyur zhing / 'di la 'jug pa'am /
translated: They arise and cease due to conditions,

original: ldog pa gang yang med de /
analyzed: ldog pa gang yang med de /
translated: and there is nothing that enters or exits.

original: lam bcad pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa chos ston to //
analyzed: lam bcad pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa chos ston to //
translated: The Thus-Gone One teaches the Dharma in order to cut through the path.

original: lam bcad pa 'di sems can rnams kyis khong du ma chud pas khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: lam bcad pa 'di sems can rnams kyis khong du ma chud pas khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Since sentient beings do not understand this cutting through of the path,

original: zhes sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying rje chen po 'jug go /
analyzed: zhes sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying rje chen po 'jug go /
translated: the Thus-Gone One’s great compassion extends to sentient beings with the thought, ‘I will help them understand.’

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: byang chub de ni /
analyzed: byang chub de ni /

original: ji lta ba bzhin gyi gnas so //
analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin gyi gnas so //
translated: is the true state of affairs.

original: byang chub ji lta bar gzugs kyang de bzhin te /
analyzed: byang chub ji lta bar gzugs kyang de bzhin te /
translated: Just as enlightenment is, so too is form.

original: de bzhin nyid kyis mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyis mi 'byung ngo //
translated: It does not arise through suchness.

original: byang chub ji lta ba bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'ang de bzhin te /
analyzed: byang chub ji lta ba bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa'ang de bzhin te /
translated: Feeling, perception, formation, and consciousness are just like awakening.

original: de bzhin nyid kyis mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyis mi 'byung ngo //
translated: They do not arise from suchness.

original: byang chub ji lta ba bzhin du sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams kyang de bzhin te /
analyzed: byang chub ji lta ba bzhin du sa'i khams dang / chu'i khams dang / me'i khams dang / rlung gi khams kyang de bzhin te /
translated: The earth element, water element, fire element, and wind element are just like awakening.

original: de bzhin nyid kyis mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyis mi 'byung ngo //
translated: They do not arise from suchness.

original: byang chub ji lta ba bzhin du mig gi khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams nas yid kyi khams dang / chos kyi khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: byang chub ji lta ba bzhin du mig gi khams dang / gzugs kyi khams dang / mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams nas yid kyi khams dang / chos kyi khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi bar du'o //
translated: The eye element, form element, and eye consciousness element, up to the mind element, dharma element, and mind consciousness element are just like awakening.

original: chos rnams kyi btags pa ni /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi btags pa ni /
translated: The designation of phenomena

original: ming tsam du zad de /🔽de ni / phung po dang / khams dang / @122a *//
analyzed: ming tsam du zad de / de ni / phung po dang / khams dang / @122a *//
translated: is nothing but mere names.🔽They are designated as the aggregates, elements,

original: skye mched rnams su btags pa ste /
analyzed: skye mched rnams su btags pa ste /

original: de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
analyzed: de dag kyang de bzhin gshegs pas ji lta ba bzhin du mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //
translated: The Tathāgata has fully awakened to them as they are.

original: phyin ci ma log par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pas na /
analyzed: phyin ci ma log par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas pas na /
translated: Because he has fully awakened to them without error,

original: sngon ji lta bar phyis kyang de bzhin /
analyzed: sngon ji lta bar phyis kyang de bzhin /

original: bar du yang de bzhin te /
analyzed: bar du yang de bzhin te /

original: sngon gyi mtha' nas ma skyes /
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' nas ma skyes /

original: phyi ma'i mthar mi 'pho'o //
analyzed: phyi ma'i mthar mi 'pho'o //

original: bar du'ang dben pa ste /
analyzed: bar du'ang dben pa ste /
translated: He is also isolated in the middle.

original: de ltar de dag ni /
analyzed: de ltar de dag ni /
translated: Thus, they

analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin gyi gnas yin no // gcig ji lta ba bzhin thams cad kyang de bzhin no //

original: thams cad ji lta bar gcig kyang de bzhin te /
analyzed: thams cad ji lta bar gcig kyang de bzhin te /

analyzed: ji lta ba bzhin ni /

analyzed: rnam pa med pa zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: gzhal ba las yang dag par 'das pa'o //

analyzed: gang na rnam par shes pa'i las med pa'o // rnam pa zhes bya ba ni /

analyzed: gang na 'dus byas la so sor rtog pa'o //

analyzed: rnam pa med pa ni /
translated: The absence of aspects

original: 'dus ma byas mngon sum du byed pa ste /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas mngon sum du byed pa ste /
translated: is the realization of the unconditioned.

original: rnam pa dang / rnam pa med pa la 'jug pa 'di byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis khong du ma chud pas de khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam pa dang / rnam pa med pa la 'jug pa 'di byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis khong du ma chud pas de khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: The engagement in aspects and the absence of aspects is not understood by childish ordinary beings.

original: zhes sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying rje chen po 'jug go /
analyzed: zhes sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying rje chen po 'jug go /
translated: Thus, the great compassion of the Tathāgatas engages towards sentient beings.

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: byang chub ni /
analyzed: byang chub ni /

original: zag pa med pa /
analyzed: zag pa med pa /
