original: len pa med pa'o //🔽de la zag pa med pa gang /
analyzed: len pa med pa'o // de la zag pa med pa gang /
translated: and free from appropriation.🔽What is uncontaminated?

original: len pa med pa gang zhe na /🔽zag pa med pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: len pa med pa gang zhe na / zag pa med pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: What is free from appropriation?🔽Uncontaminated

original: zag pa bzhi dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: zag pa bzhi dang bral ba ste /
translated: means being free from the four contaminations:

original: 'dod pa'i zag pa dang bral ba dang / srid pa'i zag pa dang bral ba dang / ma rig pa'i zag pa dang bral ba dang / lta ba'i zag pa dang bral ba'o //🔽nye bar len pa med pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i zag pa dang bral ba dang / srid pa'i zag pa dang bral ba dang / ma rig pa'i zag pa dang bral ba dang / lta ba'i zag pa dang bral ba'o // nye bar len pa med pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: being free from the contamination of desire, being free from the contamination of existence, being free from the contamination of ignorance, and being free from the contamination of views.🔽Free from appropriation

original: len pa bzhi dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: len pa bzhi dang bral ba ste /
translated: means being free from the four appropriations:

original: 'dod pa'i len pa dang bral ba dang / srid pa'i len pa dang bral ba dang / lta ba'i len pa dang bral ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs kyis len pa dang bral ba'o //🔽de la nye bar len pa bzhi po de dag thams cad ni /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i len pa dang bral ba dang / srid pa'i len pa dang bral ba dang / lta ba'i len pa dang bral ba dang / tshul khrims dang brtul zhugs kyis len pa dang bral ba'o // de la nye bar len pa bzhi po de dag thams cad ni /
translated: The first is the appropriation of desire, the second is the appropriation of existence, the third is the appropriation of views, and the fourth is the appropriation of morality and asceticism.

original: ma rig pas ldongs par byas pa dang / sred pa'i chus g-yogs pa dang / bdag tu mngon par chags pas phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched len to //
analyzed: ma rig pas ldongs par byas pa dang / sred pa'i chus g-yogs pa dang / bdag tu mngon par chags pas phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched len to //
translated: All four of these appropriations are due to the fact that, blinded by ignorance and drenched by the waters of craving, one becomes attached to the self and appropriates the aggregates, elements, and sense bases.

original: de @123a *// la de bzhin gshegs pas bdag nye bar len pa'i rtsa ba yongs su mkhyen pa'i phyir bdag rnam par dag pas sems can rnam par dag par mkhyen to //
analyzed: de @123a *// la de bzhin gshegs pas bdag nye bar len pa'i rtsa ba yongs su mkhyen pa'i phyir bdag rnam par dag pas sems can rnam par dag par mkhyen to //
translated: The Tathāgata, having understood the root of appropriation, knows that the purity of sentient beings is due to the purity of the self.

original: bdag rnam par dag pa gang yin pa de la yongs su rtog pa gang gis tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed par 'gyur ba'i yongs su rtog pa gang yang med de /
analyzed: bdag rnam par dag pa gang yin pa de la yongs su rtog pa gang gis tshul bzhin ma yin pa yid la byed par 'gyur ba'i yongs su rtog pa gang yang med de /
translated: In that purity of the self, there is no conceptualization whatsoever that would lead to incorrect mental activity.

original: de ni / tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang ldan pas ma rig pa kun nas mi slong ngo //
analyzed: de ni / tshul bzhin yid la byed pa dang ldan pas ma rig pa kun nas mi slong ngo //
translated: “He who is endowed with proper mental activity does not activate ignorance.

original: ma rig pa kun nas mi slong bas srid pa'i yan lag bcu gnyis kun nas mi ldang ba de ni /
analyzed: ma rig pa kun nas mi slong bas srid pa'i yan lag bcu gnyis kun nas mi ldang ba de ni /
translated: Since he does not activate ignorance, the twelve members of existence do not arise.

original: skye ba med pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba med pa'o //
translated: That is non-production.

original: gang skye ba med pa de ni /
analyzed: gang skye ba med pa de ni /
translated: That which is non-production

original: nges par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: nges par gyur pa'o //
translated: is the definitive.

original: gang nges par gyur pa de ni /
analyzed: gang nges par gyur pa de ni /
translated: That which is the definitive

original: nges pa'i don to //
analyzed: nges pa'i don to //
translated: is the definitive meaning.

original: gang nges pa'i don de ni /
analyzed: gang nges pa'i don de ni /
translated: That which is the definitive meaning

original: don dam pa'o //
analyzed: don dam pa'o //
translated: is the ultimate.

original: gang don dam pa de gang zag med pa'i don to //
analyzed: gang don dam pa de gang zag med pa'i don to //
translated: That which is the ultimate is the meaning of the non-existence of person.

original: gang gang zag med pa'i don de brjod du med pa'i don to //
analyzed: gang gang zag med pa'i don de brjod du med pa'i don to //
translated: That which is the meaning of the non-existence of person is the meaning of the inexpressible.

original: gang brjod du med pa'i don de rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang brjod du med pa'i don de rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba'i don to //
translated: That which is the meaning of the inexpressible is the meaning of dependent origination.

original: gang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don de chos kyi don to //
analyzed: gang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don de chos kyi don to //
translated: That which is the meaning of dependent origination is the meaning of the Dharma.

original: gang chos kyi don de de bzhin gshegs pa'i don to //
analyzed: gang chos kyi don de de bzhin gshegs pa'i don to //
translated: That which is the meaning of the Dharma is the meaning of the Tathāgata.

original: de'i phyir sus rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba mthong ba des chos mthong ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir sus rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba mthong ba des chos mthong ngo //
translated: Therefore, whoever sees dependent origination sees the Dharma.

original: sus chos mthong ba des de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ste /
analyzed: sus chos mthong ba des de bzhin gshegs pa mthong ste /
translated: Whoever sees the Dharma sees the Tathāgata.

original: 'di ltar de bzhin nyid du bcal na /
analyzed: 'di ltar de bzhin nyid du bcal na /
translated: Thus, when one searches for suchness,

original: ci yang mi mthong ba de ltar mthong ngo //
analyzed: ci yang mi mthong ba de ltar mthong ngo //
translated: one sees in such a way that one does not see anything at all.

original: de la ci yang zhes bya ba gang zhe na /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la ci yang zhes bya ba gang zhe na / 'di lta ste /
translated: What is meant by “anything at all”?

original: mtshan ma med pa dang / dmigs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa dang / dmigs pa med pa'o //
translated: It means the absence of signs and the absence of reference points.

original: gang gis mtshan ma med pa dang / @123b dmigs pa med pa mthong ba des yang dag pa mthong ste /
analyzed: gang gis mtshan ma med pa dang / @123b dmigs pa med pa mthong ba des yang dag pa mthong ste /
translated: Whoever sees the absence of signs and the absence of reference points sees reality.

original: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pas chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du mnyam par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so //🔽zag pa med pa dang / len pa med pa 'di byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis khong du ma chud pas de khong du chud par bya'o //🔽zhes sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying rje chen po 'jug go sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin gshegs pas chos thams cad mnyam pa nyid du mnyam par mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas so // zag pa med pa dang / len pa med pa 'di byis pa so so'i skye bo rnams kyis khong du ma chud pas de khong du chud par bya'o // zhes sems can rnams la de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying rje chen po 'jug go sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: In this way, the Tathāgata fully and perfectly awakened to the sameness of all phenomena.🔽Since immature, ordinary beings do not understand the absence of defilements and the absence of appropriation, the Tathāgata’s great compassion extends to them with the thought, ‘They should understand this!’

original: da ltar byung ba la chos kyi dbyings la gnas pa'i ye shes ni /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba la chos kyi dbyings la gnas pa'i ye shes ni /
translated: The wisdom that abides in the dharmadhātu in the present is

original: nyon mongs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pa ste /
translated: without afflictions.

original: de ltar dag pa dang / dri ma med pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa gnas gcig tu 'jug par 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: de ltar dag pa dang / dri ma med pa dang / nyon mongs pa med pa gnas gcig tu 'jug par 'gyur ba ni /
translated: Thus, purity, stainlessness, and being without afflictions come together in one place,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: which is

original: zhi ba'i gnas so //
analyzed: zhi ba'i gnas so //
translated: the state of peace.

original: gang zhi ba de ni /
analyzed: gang zhi ba de ni /
translated: What is peace is

original: rab tu zhi ba /
analyzed: rab tu zhi ba /
translated: complete peace.

original: de ni / nye bar zhi ba ste /
analyzed: de ni / nye bar zhi ba ste /
translated: It is peace.

original: thub pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: thub pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the Sage.

original: de lta bas na //
analyzed: de lta bas na //
translated: Therefore,

original: ji ltar nam mkha' ji lta bar byang chub kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' ji lta bar byang chub kyang de bzhin no //
translated: just as is space, so is awakening.

original: byang chub ji lta bar chos kyang de bzhin no //
analyzed: byang chub ji lta bar chos kyang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as is awakening, so is the Dharma.

original: chos ji lta bar sems can yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: chos ji lta bar sems can yang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as is the Dharma, so are sentient beings.

original: sems can ji lta bar zhing yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: sems can ji lta bar zhing yang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as are sentient beings, so are the fields.

original: zhing ji lta bar mya ngan las 'das pa yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: zhing ji lta bar mya ngan las 'das pa yang de bzhin no //
translated: Just as are the fields, so is nirvāṇa.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: chos thams cad ni /
analyzed: chos thams cad ni /
translated: all phenomena

original: mya ngan las 'das pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa dang mnyam pa zhes bya ste /
translated: are said to be equal to nirvāṇa.

original: mthar thug pa'i rnam pas gnyen po med do //🔽gnyen po med pa'i rnam pas thog ma nas rnam par dag pa'o //🔽thog ma nas dri ma med pa'o //
analyzed: mthar thug pa'i rnam pas gnyen po med do // gnyen po med pa'i rnam pas thog ma nas rnam par dag pa'o // thog ma nas dri ma med pa'o //
translated: Since they are the ultimate, they are without antidote.🔽Since they are without antidote, they are pure from the beginning.

original: thog ma nas nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
analyzed: thog ma nas nyon mongs pa med pa'o //
translated: Since they are pure from the beginning, they are stainless from the beginning.🔽Since they are stainless from the beginning, they are without afflictions from the beginning.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar gzugs can dang / gzugs med pa'i chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sems @124b can gyi khams la rnam par gzigs shing sems can rnams la dag pa dang / dri ma med pa dang /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pas 'di ltar gzugs can dang / gzugs med pa'i chos thams cad mngon par rdzogs par sangs rgyas nas sems @124b can gyi khams la rnam par gzigs shing sems can rnams la dag pa dang / dri ma med pa dang /
translated: The Thus-Gone One has fully awakened to all phenomena, whether they are physical or not, and then surveyed the realms of sentient beings. He has seen that sentient beings are pure and stainless,🔽

original: nyon mongs pa med pas rnam par rol pa zhes bya ba'i snying rje chen po 'jug go /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa med pas rnam par rol pa zhes bya ba'i snying rje chen po 'jug go /
translated: The Thus-Gone One, having fully and perfectly awakened to all phenomena, whether they are physical or not, looks out over the realms of sentient beings and engages with them through great compassion, which is called ‘the display of purity, immaculacy, and the absence of afflictions.’

original: de ltar sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: de ltar sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying rje chen po dag pa dang / dri ma med pa dang / nyon mongs pa med par lhun gyis grub pas rtag tu 'jug ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying rje chen po dag pa dang / dri ma med pa dang / nyon mongs pa med par lhun gyis grub pas rtag tu 'jug ste /
translated: the Thus-Gone One’s great compassion is pure, immaculate, and free of afflictions. It is always active spontaneously,

original: phyis gtang bar bya ba med cing /
analyzed: phyis gtang bar bya ba med cing /
translated: without ever being abandoned.

original: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams rab 'byams ma lus par thogs pa med do //
analyzed: phyogs bcu'i 'jig rten gyi khams rab 'byams ma lus par thogs pa med do //
translated: It is unobstructed throughout the infinite worlds of the ten directions.

original: de ltar sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: de ltar sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying rje chen po ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying rje chen po ni /
translated: the Thus-Gone One’s great compassion

original: mtha' yas mu med de /
analyzed: mtha' yas mu med de /
translated: is infinite and boundless.

original: gang de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying rje chen po'i mtha' 'dod pa de ni /
analyzed: gang de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying rje chen po'i mtha' 'dod pa de ni /
translated: Whoever wishes to know the extent of the Tathāgata’s great compassion

original: nam mkha'i mtha' 'dod do //
analyzed: nam mkha'i mtha' 'dod do //
translated: should try to know the extent of space.

original: byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying rje chen po bsam gyis mi khyab pa de thos nas mngon par dad /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying rje chen po bsam gyis mi khyab pa de thos nas mngon par dad /
translated: When the bodhisattvas heard this explanation of the Tathāgata’s inconceivable great compassion, they greatly rejoiced,🔽trusted,

original: yid ches / rab tu rtog /🔽som nyi med /
analyzed: yid ches / rab tu rtog / som nyi med /
translated: and fully approved of it.

original: the tshom mi za ba nas nam mkha' lta bur bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir ngo mtshar dang / rmad kyi bar du 'du shes bskyed do //
analyzed: the tshom mi za ba nas nam mkha' lta bur bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir ngo mtshar dang / rmad kyi bar du 'du shes bskyed do //
translated: They were filled with wonder and amazement, up to the point where they conceived the idea that it was inconceivable, like space.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis don 'di nyid rgya cher bstan pa'i phyir de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis don 'di nyid rgya cher bstan pa'i phyir de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs so //
translated: Then, in order to teach this very meaning in a more extensive way, the Blessed One spoke these verses:🔽“The Buddha has attained awakening,

original: rtsa ba med cing gnas med par //🔽sangs rgyas kyis ni byang chub reg /
analyzed: rtsa ba med cing gnas med par // sangs rgyas kyis ni byang chub reg /
translated: which has no root and no location.

original: ji ltar rtogs pa de bzhin du //
analyzed: ji ltar rtogs pa de bzhin du //
translated: Just as he has realized it,

original: srog chags rnams ni kun la ston //🔽nang gi mig ni stong pa ste //
analyzed: srog chags rnams ni kun la ston // nang gi mig ni stong pa ste //
translated: he teaches it to all living beings.🔽The inner eye is empty,

original: phyi rol gzugs kyang stong ba'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gzugs kyang stong ba'o //
translated: and external forms are also empty.

original: zhi dang nye bar zhi ba dang // sangs @125a *//
analyzed: zhi dang nye bar zhi ba dang // sangs @125a *//
translated: Peace, complete peace,

original: rgyas kyis ni byang chub reg /
analyzed: rgyas kyis ni byang chub reg /
translated: The Buddha has attained enlightenment.

original: zhi dang nye bar zhi ba ste //
analyzed: zhi dang nye bar zhi ba ste //
translated: Peace, complete peace,

original: sems can khong du ma chud bas //
analyzed: sems can khong du ma chud bas //
translated: Sentient beings do not understand.

original: tshig don rtogs nas sems can la //
analyzed: tshig don rtogs nas sems can la //
translated: Having realized the meaning of words,🔽Compassion arises for sentient beings.

original: de dag la ni snying rje 'jug byang chub rang bzhin 'od gsal zhing //
analyzed: de dag la ni snying rje 'jug byang chub rang bzhin 'od gsal zhing //
translated: Enlightenment is clear light,

original: rnam dag nam mkha' 'dra ba de //
analyzed: rnam dag nam mkha' 'dra ba de //
translated: Pure like the sky.

original: sems can rnams kyis mi shes pas //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyis mi shes pas //
translated: Sentient beings do not know this,

original: de dag la yang snying rje 'jug /
analyzed: de dag la yang snying rje 'jug /
translated: So compassion arises for them.🔽In all phenomena there is no grasping

original: chos rnams kun la 'dzin pa dang / rab tu 'dzin pa yod ma yin //
analyzed: chos rnams kun la 'dzin pa dang / rab tu 'dzin pa yod ma yin //
translated: And no fixation.

original: blang med dor ba med pa yi //
analyzed: blang med dor ba med pa yi //
translated: Without accepting or rejecting,

original: sangs rgyas kyi ni byang chub reg /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi ni byang chub reg /
translated: The Buddha has attained enlightenment.

original: sems can 'di dag mi shes pas //
analyzed: sems can 'di dag mi shes pas //
translated: Sentient beings do not understand this,

original: de dag la ni snying rje 'jug /
analyzed: de dag la ni snying rje 'jug /
translated: So compassion arises for them.

original: mtshan ma med cing dmigs pa med //
analyzed: mtshan ma med cing dmigs pa med //
translated: Signless and without reference point,

original: 'phags pa rnams kyi spyod yul 'di //
analyzed: 'phags pa rnams kyi spyod yul 'di //
translated: This is the domain of the noble ones.

original: byis pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa //
analyzed: byis pa'i spyod yul ma yin pa //
translated: It is not the domain of the childish.

original: sangs rgyas kyis ni byang chub reg /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyis ni byang chub reg /
translated: The Buddha has attained enlightenment.

original: gang dag mi mkhas bcings pa yi //
analyzed: gang dag mi mkhas bcings pa yi //
translated: Those who are unskilled are bound

original: so so'i skye bo mi shes pas //🔽de bzhin gshegs pa sems can la //
analyzed: so so'i skye bo mi shes pas // de bzhin gshegs pa sems can la //
translated: Ordinary beings do not understand this,🔽And so the Tathāgata

original: snying rje chen po rab tu 'jug /
analyzed: snying rje chen po rab tu 'jug /
translated: Engages in great compassion for sentient beings.

original: rang bzhin gyis ni 'dus ma byas //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis ni 'dus ma byas //
translated: It is uncompounded by nature,

original: skye ba med cing 'jig pa med //
analyzed: skye ba med cing 'jig pa med //

original: de la gnas pa yod min te //
analyzed: de la gnas pa yod min te //

original: mtshan nyid gsum las rnam par grol //
analyzed: mtshan nyid gsum las rnam par grol //

original: 'dus byas rnams kyi rang bzhin ni //
analyzed: 'dus byas rnams kyi rang bzhin ni //

original: byis pas khong du ma chud pas //
analyzed: byis pas khong du ma chud pas //
translated: Is not understood by the childish,

original: de dag la yang snying rje 'jug /
analyzed: de dag la yang snying rje 'jug /
translated: And so compassion engages them.

original: tshul 'di gang gis sangs rgyas pa //
analyzed: tshul 'di gang gis sangs rgyas pa //
translated: Those who awaken to this way

original: byang chub las kyis mi rtogs te //
analyzed: byang chub las kyis mi rtogs te //
translated: Do not realize enlightenment through action,

original: sems kyis kyang ni 'tshang mi rgya //
analyzed: sems kyis kyang ni 'tshang mi rgya //
translated: Nor do they awaken through the mind.

original: lus ni bem po'i rang bzhin te //
analyzed: lus ni bem po'i rang bzhin te //
translated: The body has the nature of matter,

original: sems kyang sgyu ma lta bu'o //
analyzed: sems kyang sgyu ma lta bu'o //
translated: And the mind is like an illusion.

original: lus dang sems kyi rang bzhin @125b te //
analyzed: lus dang sems kyi rang bzhin @125b te //
translated: The nature of the body and mind

original: byis pas khong du ma chud pas //🔽tshul 'di khong du chud gyur nas //
analyzed: byis pas khong du ma chud pas // tshul 'di khong du chud gyur nas //
translated: Is not understood by the childish,

original: de dag la ni snying rje 'jug /
analyzed: de dag la ni snying rje 'jug /
translated: And so compassion engages them.

original: rang byung ba ni byang chub dam pa rgya chen mchog reg ste //
analyzed: rang byung ba ni byang chub dam pa rgya chen mchog reg ste //
translated: Having reached the sublime, vast, and supreme self-arisen enlightenment,

original: shing mchog drung du bzhugs nas sems can khams la rnam par gzigs //
analyzed: shing mchog drung du bzhugs nas sems can khams la rnam par gzigs //
translated: Sitting under the supreme tree, he looks upon the realms of sentient beings.

original: 'khor ba'i 'khor lor zhugs shing 'gro rgyud sna tshogs 'khyams gyur pa //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i 'khor lor zhugs shing 'gro rgyud sna tshogs 'khyams gyur pa //
translated: Engaged in the wheel of saṃsāra, wandering through various realms of beings,

original: de dag gzigs nas sangs rgyas kyis ni snying rje mi bzad 'jug /
analyzed: de dag gzigs nas sangs rgyas kyis ni snying rje mi bzad 'jug /
translated: Seeing them, the Buddha’s unbearable compassion arises.

original: nga dang rgyags pa dag la chags shing lta ba'i dra bas gzings //
analyzed: nga dang rgyags pa dag la chags shing lta ba'i dra bas gzings //
translated: Attached to “I” and “mine,” bound by the net of views,

original: sdug bsngal bde dang mi rtag rtag dang sdug par 'du shes shing //
analyzed: sdug bsngal bde dang mi rtag rtag dang sdug par 'du shes shing //
translated: Perceiving suffering as happiness, the impermanent as permanent,

original: bdag dang sems can dang ni srog tu lta bar chags pa rnams //
analyzed: bdag dang sems can dang ni srog tu lta bar chags pa rnams //
translated: Attached to the views of self, sentient beings, and life,

original: gzigs nas de dag la ni sangs rgyas snying rje mi bzad 'jug /
analyzed: gzigs nas de dag la ni sangs rgyas snying rje mi bzad 'jug /
translated: Seeing them, the Buddha’s unbearable compassion arises.

original: sems can khams ni gti mug ling tog khebs shing bsgribs pa kun //
analyzed: sems can khams ni gti mug ling tog khebs shing bsgribs pa kun //
translated: All realms of sentient beings are covered and obscured by the cataracts of delusion,

original: nyi ma sprin khebs bzhin du snang med lam med mi 'gyur ba //🔽de dag gzigs nas ye shes snang ba dri med 'od bya zhes //
analyzed: nyi ma sprin khebs bzhin du snang med lam med mi 'gyur ba // de dag gzigs nas ye shes snang ba dri med 'od bya zhes //
translated: Like the sun obscured by clouds, they are without light or path.🔽Seeing them, the Buddha’s unbearable compassion arises,

original: de dag la yang sangs rgyas kyi ni snying rje mi bzad 'jug /
analyzed: de dag la yang sangs rgyas kyi ni snying rje mi bzad 'jug /
translated: With the thought, “I will create the stainless light of wisdom.”

original: ngan song 'gro bar zhugs shing lam stor rab tu 'khyams pa rnams //
analyzed: ngan song 'gro bar zhugs shing lam stor rab tu 'khyams pa rnams //
translated: They have entered the lower realms and lost their way, wandering.

original: sems can sems can dmyal dang dud 'gro yi dvags rgyu lhung ba //
analyzed: sems can sems can dmyal dang dud 'gro yi dvags rgyu lhung ba //
translated: Sentient beings have fallen into the causes of hell, animal, and hungry ghost rebirths.

original: de dag gzigs nas sngon gyi rgyal bas bsnyen pa'i lam bstan ces //
analyzed: de dag gzigs nas sngon gyi rgyal bas bsnyen pa'i lam bstan ces //
translated: Having seen them, the Victorious Ones of the past taught the path to be followed.

original: de dag la yang sangs rgyas kyi ni snying rje mi bzad 'jug /
analyzed: de dag la yang sangs rgyas kyi ni snying rje mi bzad 'jug /
translated: The buddhas’ unbearable compassion extends to them as well.

original: de bzhin nyid ltar de bzhin nyid du chos rnams thams cad ni //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ltar de bzhin nyid du chos rnams thams cad ni //
translated: All phenomena are suchness, just like suchness itself.

original: nam mkha' mtshungs 'dra de dag ma bcings ma grol rab mkhyen te //
analyzed: nam mkha' mtshungs 'dra de dag ma bcings ma grol rab mkhyen te //
translated: They are like space, neither bound nor liberated.

original: 'gro ba @126a *//
analyzed: 'gro ba @126a *//
translated: The buddhas know this.

original: dag cing bzang ba'i chos rnams mi shes gzigs nas su //
analyzed: dag cing bzang ba'i chos rnams mi shes gzigs nas su //
translated: Having seen that beings do not know the pure and excellent Dharma,

original: de dag la yang sangs rgyas kyi ni snying rje mi bzad 'jug /
analyzed: de dag la yang sangs rgyas kyi ni snying rje mi bzad 'jug /
translated: the buddhas’ unbearable compassion extends to them as well.

original: de ltar sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: de ltar sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Śāriputra,

original: byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying rje chen po bsam gyis mi khyab pa la mngon par dad /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa'i snying rje chen po bsam gyis mi khyab pa la mngon par dad /
translated: the bodhisattvas have conviction in the inconceivable great compassion of the thus-gone ones.🔽They have faith,

original: yid ches / rab tu rtog /🔽som nyi med /
analyzed: yid ches / rab tu rtog / som nyi med /
translated: they understand,

original: the tshom mi za /
analyzed: the tshom mi za /
translated: they are free from doubt,🔽and they are free from uncertainty.

original: rgya cher dga' mgu ste rangs pa rnyed nas nam mkha' lta bur bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir ngo mtshar dang / rmad du 'du shes bskyed do ////🔽bam po bdun pa /
analyzed: rgya cher dga' mgu ste rangs pa rnyed nas nam mkha' lta bur bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir ngo mtshar dang / rmad du 'du shes bskyed do //// bam po bdun pa /
translated: and, having found great joy, delight, and satisfaction, they give rise to a sense of wonder and amazement, because it is inconceivable like space.

original: yang sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: yang sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Moreover, Śāriputra,

original: ji ltar na /
analyzed: ji ltar na /
translated: how do bodhisattvas have faith in,

original: byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa la mngon par dad /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa la mngon par dad /
translated: have conviction in, and contemplate the thus-gone ones’ eighteen distinctive qualities of a buddha,

original: yid ches / rab tu rtog pa nas ngo mtshar dang / rmad kyi bar du 'du shes bskyed ce na /
analyzed: yid ches / rab tu rtog pa nas ngo mtshar dang / rmad kyi bar du 'du shes bskyed ce na /
translated: and how do they give rise to a sense of wonder and amazement?

original: sh'a ri'i bu; de bzhin gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad po 'di dag ste /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu; de bzhin gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad po 'di dag ste /
translated: “Śāriputra, the thus-gone ones’ eighteen distinctive qualities of a buddha are as follows:

original: chos de dag dang ldan pas de bzhin gshegs pa 'khor gyi nang du sengge'i sgra yang dag par sgrog cing khyu mchog gi gnas su zhal gyis 'che ste /🔽dge sbyong ngam /
analyzed: chos de dag dang ldan pas de bzhin gshegs pa 'khor gyi nang du sengge'i sgra yang dag par sgrog cing khyu mchog gi gnas su zhal gyis 'che ste / dge sbyong ngam /
translated: Endowed with these qualities, the thus-gone ones roar the lion’s roar in the midst of the assembly and claim the seat of the supreme vehicle.🔽No one can refute them,🔽whether it be a monk,

original: bram ze'am / lha'am /
analyzed: bram ze'am / lha'am /
translated: a brahmin,

original: bdud dam / sus kyang 'jig rten du chos dang mthun par ma bskor ba /
analyzed: bdud dam / sus kyang 'jig rten du chos dang mthun par ma bskor ba /
translated: No one, not even Mara, has turned the wheel of the Dharma in the world in accordance with the Dharma.

original: tshangs pa'i 'khor lo rab tu bskor ro //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i 'khor lo rab tu bskor ro //
translated: He has turned the wheel of the Dharma in the world, which has not been turned by any ascetic, brahmin, god, Māra, Brahmā, or anyone else.🔽He has turned the wheel of the Dharma in its three revolutions and twelve aspects.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad gang zhe na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bco brgyad gang zhe na /
translated: “What are the eighteen distinctive qualities of the Buddha?

original: 'di la sh'a ri'i bu /🔽gang gi phyir lus kyi 'khrul pa gang las byis pa'am /
analyzed: 'di la sh'a ri'i bu / gang gi phyir lus kyi 'khrul pa gang las byis pa'am /
translated: Śāriputra,🔽the Thus-Gone One does not have any physical error that would cause the childish

original: mkhas pa @126b chos dang mthun par rgol bar byed pa'i lus kyi 'khrul ba de bzhin gshegs pa la med do //
analyzed: mkhas pa @126b chos dang mthun par rgol bar byed pa'i lus kyi 'khrul ba de bzhin gshegs pa la med do //
translated: to dispute with him in accordance with the Dharma.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams ni /
translated: The blessed buddhas

original: lus kyis las 'khrul pa med pa ste; de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod lam mdzes pas kun tu gzigs pa dang / rnam par gzigs pa dang / bskum pa dang / brkyang ba dang / chos gos snam sbyar dang / chos gos dang / lhung bzed bsnams pa dang /
analyzed: lus kyis las 'khrul pa med pa ste; de bzhin gshegs pa'i spyod lam mdzes pas kun tu gzigs pa dang / rnam par gzigs pa dang / bskum pa dang / brkyang ba dang / chos gos snam sbyar dang / chos gos dang / lhung bzed bsnams pa dang /
translated: do not have any physical error. The Thus-Gone One’s conduct is beautiful to behold, whether he is looking around, looking ahead, bending, stretching, holding his upper and lower robes and alms bowl,

original: mngon du gshegs pa dang / slar gshegs pa dang / byon pa dang / bzhud pa dang / bzhengs pa dang / bzhugs pa dang / mnal ba dang / grong dang / grong khyer du 'jug pa dang / 'byung ba na zhabs kyi mthil sa la mi reg ste /
analyzed: mngon du gshegs pa dang / slar gshegs pa dang / byon pa dang / bzhud pa dang / bzhengs pa dang / bzhugs pa dang / mnal ba dang / grong dang / grong khyer du 'jug pa dang / 'byung ba na zhabs kyi mthil sa la mi reg ste /
translated: When he walks, when he returns, when he comes, when he goes, when he stands, when he sits, when he lies down, when he enters a town or a city, when he comes out, the soles of his feet do not touch the ground.

original: 'khor lo rtsibs stong pa sa las 'byung zhing dri yid du 'ong ba'i padma mngon par 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'khor lo rtsibs stong pa sa las 'byung zhing dri yid du 'ong ba'i padma mngon par 'byung ste /
translated: A thousand-spoked wheel arises from the ground, and a lotus with a pleasant scent appears.

original: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhabs 'jog go /
analyzed: de la de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhabs 'jog go /
translated: The Tathāgata places his feet on that.

original: de la gang dud 'gro'i skye gnas su song ba'i sems can dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhabs la reg na /
analyzed: de la gang dud 'gro'i skye gnas su song ba'i sems can dag gis de bzhin gshegs pa'i zhabs la reg na /
translated: When sentient beings who have gone to the animal realm touch the Tathāgata’s feet,

original: de dag zhag bdun du rab tu bde ba dang ldan par 'gyur /
analyzed: de dag zhag bdun du rab tu bde ba dang ldan par 'gyur /
translated: they become endowed with supreme bliss for seven days.

original: shi 'phos nas kyang bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shi 'phos nas kyang bde 'gro mtho ris kyi 'jig rten du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: After death, they are reborn in the happy realms of the higher worlds.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la chos gos sor bzhi tsam gyis mi reg mod kyi /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la chos gos sor bzhi tsam gyis mi reg mod kyi /
translated: The Tathāgata’s body is not touched by the Dharma robes, even by a mere four fingers.

original: rnam par 'thor rlung gis kyang bzlog par mi nus so //
analyzed: rnam par 'thor rlung gis kyang bzlog par mi nus so //
translated: Even the wind that scatters everything cannot stop it.

original: sku'i 'od kyis mnar med pa'i bar gyi sems can bde ba'i tshor ba myong bar 'gyur te /🔽de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la 'khrul pa @127a *//
analyzed: sku'i 'od kyis mnar med pa'i bar gyi sems can bde ba'i tshor ba myong bar 'gyur te / de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa'i sku la 'khrul pa @127a *//
translated: The light of his body makes all beings, down to the Avīci hell, experience the sensation of bliss.

original: med ces bya'o //
analyzed: med ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the Tathāgata’s body is said to be without error.

original: yang sh'a ri'i bu /🔽gang gi phyir ngag 'khrul pa gang las byis pa'am /
analyzed: yang sh'a ri'i bu / gang gi phyir ngag 'khrul pa gang las byis pa'am /
translated: “Moreover, Śāriputra,

original: mkhas pa chos dang mthun par rgol bar byed pa'i ngag gi 'khrul pa de bzhin gshegs pa la med do //
analyzed: mkhas pa chos dang mthun par rgol bar byed pa'i ngag gi 'khrul pa de bzhin gshegs pa la med do //
translated: the Tathāgata has no error of speech from which a fool or a wise person could argue in accordance with the Dharma.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Śāriputra,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni /🔽dus su smra ba /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni / dus su smra ba /
translated: the Tathāgata

original: yang dag par smra ba /
analyzed: yang dag par smra ba /

original: bden par smra ba /🔽tshigs su smra ba /
analyzed: bden par smra ba / tshigs su smra ba /
translated: speaks the truth,🔽speaks what is meaningful,

original: ji skad smra ba de bzhin du byed pa'o //
analyzed: ji skad smra ba de bzhin du byed pa'o //
translated: speaks what he has practiced,

original: shin tu nges pa'i tshig go /
analyzed: shin tu nges pa'i tshig go /
translated: speaks with certain words,

original: sems can thams cad tshim par byed pa'i tshig go /
analyzed: sems can thams cad tshim par byed pa'i tshig go /
translated: speaks words that satisfy all beings,

original: mi zlos pa'i tshig go /
analyzed: mi zlos pa'i tshig go /
translated: speaks words that are not repetitive,

original: don dang yi ges shin tu brgyan pa'i tshig go /
analyzed: don dang yi ges shin tu brgyan pa'i tshig go /
translated: speaks words that are well-adorned with meaning and letters,🔽and speaks words that are well-purified.

original: skad gcig brjod pas sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa tshim par byed pa ste /
analyzed: skad gcig brjod pas sems can thams cad kyi bsam pa tshim par byed pa ste /
translated: And by uttering a single sound, he satisfies the thoughts of all sentient beings.

original: de'i phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi ngag gi las 'khrul pa med ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams kyi ngag gi las 'khrul pa med ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the speech of the Blessed Buddhas is said to be without error.

original: yang sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: yang sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Moreover, Śāriputra,

original: sems 'khrul pa gang las byis pa'am /
analyzed: sems 'khrul pa gang las byis pa'am /
translated: the error of mind from which a fool or

original: mkhas pa chos dang mthun par rgol bar byed pa'i sems kyi 'khrul pa de bzhin gshegs pa la med do //
analyzed: mkhas pa chos dang mthun par rgol bar byed pa'i sems kyi 'khrul pa de bzhin gshegs pa la med do //
translated: a learned one would argue in accordance with the Dharma—that error of mind does not exist in the Tathāgata.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di la sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: 'di la sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: Here, Śāriputra,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni /
translated: the Tathāgata

analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i dngos po mi 'dor zhing /
translated: does not abandon the state of equipoise,

original: sangs rgyas kyi bya ba thams cad byed kyang sems der mi gtong zhing chos thams cad la de'i chags pa med pa'i ye shes mthong ba 'jug ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi bya ba thams cad byed kyang sems der mi gtong zhing chos thams cad la de'i chags pa med pa'i ye shes mthong ba 'jug ste /
translated: and while performing all the activities of a Buddha, he does not direct his mind to that, and the vision of his wisdom that is not attached to any phenomenon engages.

original: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa la sems 'khrul pa med ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa la sems 'khrul pa med ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, the mind of the Tathāgata is said to be without error.

original: ji ltar de'i sems 'khrul pa med pa de ltar sems can rnams kyi sems @127b 'khrul pa spang ba'i phyir chos ston to //
analyzed: ji ltar de'i sems 'khrul pa med pa de ltar sems can rnams kyi sems @127b 'khrul pa spang ba'i phyir chos ston to //
translated: And just as his mind is free of error, so he teaches the Dharma to sentient beings in order to eliminate the errors of their minds.

original: de ni / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa dang po'o //
analyzed: de ni / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa dang po'o //

analyzed: gzhan yang sh'a ri'i bu // ca co gang las bdud dam / bdud kyi ris kyi lha'i bu'am /
translated: “Moreover, Śāriputra,🔽the Tathāgata does not speak in a way that would cause Māra or

analyzed: gzhan mu stegs can gyis glags rnyed par 'gyur ba'i ca co de bzhin gshegs par med do //

original: yang sh'a ri'i bu /🔽de bzhin gshegs pa la ca co'am /
analyzed: yang sh'a ri'i bu / de bzhin gshegs pa la ca co'am /
translated: Śāriputra,

analyzed: rjes su ca co 'byin pa med de /

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni; rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba dang bral ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni; rjes su chags pa dang / khong khro ba dang bral ba ste /
translated: The Tathāgata is free from attachment and aversion,

analyzed: sems can thams cad kyis bkur sti byas kyang ma thos par mi sems /

original: de gang las 'gyod pa'am /
analyzed: de gang las 'gyod pa'am /

translated: There is nothing that the Tathāgata has not completed, nothing that he has not done, nothing that he has not accomplished, nothing that he has not abandoned, nothing that he has not manifested, nothing that he has not realized, nothing that he has not attained, nothing that he has not fully known.

original: mdud pa thams cad dang bral ba dang / de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa la ca co med do //🔽ji ltar de la ca co med pa de ltar sems can thams cad kyi ca co thams cad spang ba'i phyir chos ston te /🔽'di ni / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa gnyis pa'o //🔽gzhan yang sh'a ri'i bu /🔽bsnyel ba gang las chos gang la yang rmongs par 'gyur ba'i bsnyel ba de bzhin gshegs pa la med do //

original: @128a *// bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa la thogs pa med cing /
analyzed: @128a *// bsam gtan dang / rnam par thar pa dang / ting nge 'dzin dang / snyoms par 'jug pa la thogs pa med cing /
translated: He is not obstructed in his meditative concentrations, liberations, samādhis, and samāpattis.

original: sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa dang / g-yo ba la rnam par blta ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa la rmongs pa med do //🔽so sor ci rigs par chos ston pa'i phyir kun tu nyams pa med do //
analyzed: sems can thams cad kyi sems kyi spyod pa dang / g-yo ba la rnam par blta ba'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa la rmongs pa med do // so sor ci rigs par chos ston pa'i phyir kun tu nyams pa med do //
translated: He is not confused about the thoughts and actions of all sentient beings.🔽He is not deficient in teaching the Dharma in accordance with each individual.

original: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar la thogs pa med pa'i ye shes mthong ba'i phyir don dang / chos dang / nges pa'i tshig dang / spobs pa so sor yang dag par rig pa la kun tu nyams pa med do //
analyzed: 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar la thogs pa med pa'i ye shes mthong ba'i phyir don dang / chos dang / nges pa'i tshig dang / spobs pa so sor yang dag par rig pa la kun tu nyams pa med do //
translated: He is not deficient in the analytical knowledges of meaning, Dharma, language, and confidence.

original: ji ltar bdag kun tu nyams pa med cing 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar la thogs pa med pa'i ye shes mthong ba de ltar sems can thams cad brjed ngas par mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir chos ston te /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag kun tu nyams pa med cing 'das pa dang / ma 'ongs pa dang / da ltar la thogs pa med pa'i ye shes mthong ba de ltar sems can thams cad brjed ngas par mi 'gyur bar bya ba'i phyir chos ston te /
translated: “In order to teach the Dharma to all sentient beings so that they may be without forgetfulness, just as I am without forgetfulness and have unobstructed wisdom vision of the past, future, and present,

original: 'di ni / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa gsum pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni / sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa gsum pa'o //
translated: this is the third unique quality of a buddha.

original: gzhan yang sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: gzhan yang sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Moreover, Śāriputra,

original: de bzhin gshegs pa la mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sems mi dmigs te /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa la mnyam par ma bzhag pa'i sems mi dmigs te /
translated: the tathāgatas do not have a mind that is not in meditative equipoise.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni /🔽'chag gam / bzhengs sam /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni / 'chag gam / bzhengs sam /
translated: The tathāgatas🔽whether walking, standing,

original: bzhugs sam / mnal tam /
analyzed: bzhugs sam / mnal tam /
translated: sitting, lying down,

original: bshos gsol lam /
analyzed: bshos gsol lam /
translated: eating,

original: gsung ngam / cang mi gsung bar gyur kyang rung ste /
analyzed: gsung ngam / cang mi gsung bar gyur kyang rung ste /
translated: speaking, or remaining silent,

original: rtag tu mnyam par bzhag cing ting nge 'dzin zab mo dam pa'i mthar phyin pa sgrib pa med pa'i bsam gtan la bsam gtan byed pa ste /
analyzed: rtag tu mnyam par bzhag cing ting nge 'dzin zab mo dam pa'i mthar phyin pa sgrib pa med pa'i bsam gtan la bsam gtan byed pa ste /
translated: are always in meditative equipoise. They have perfected the highest profound samādhi and are in meditative concentration without obscurations.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin @128b gyis brlabs pa ma gtogs par sems can gyi ris na sems can gang mnyam par bzhag kyang rung /🔽mnyam par ma bzhag kyang rung ste /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i byin @128b gyis brlabs pa ma gtogs par sems can gyi ris na sems can gang mnyam par bzhag kyang rung / mnyam par ma bzhag kyang rung ste /
translated: Except for the blessing of the Tathāgata, there is no sentient being in the realm of sentient beings who can see the Tathāgata’s mind, whether in equipoise or not in equipoise.

original: su yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sems la lta bar nus pa med do //
analyzed: su yang de bzhin gshegs pa'i sems la lta bar nus pa med do //
translated: There is no one at all who can see the Tathāgata’s mind.

original: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa rtag tu mnyam par bzhag pa de ltar ting nge 'dzin la lta bas sems can rnams la chos ston te /
analyzed: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa rtag tu mnyam par bzhag pa de ltar ting nge 'dzin la lta bas sems can rnams la chos ston te /
translated: The Tathāgata teaches the Dharma to sentient beings by seeing samādhi in that way, always in equipoise.

original: 'di ni / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bzhi pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa bzhi pa'o //
translated: This, Śāriputra, is the fourth of the Tathāgata’s unique qualities of a buddha.

original: gzhan yang sh'a ri'i bu /
analyzed: gzhan yang sh'a ri'i bu /
translated: “Moreover, Śāriputra,

original: de tha dad pa'i 'du shes gang las sems mi mnyam par gnas par 'gyur ba'i tha dad pa'i 'du shes de bzhin gshegs pa la med de /
analyzed: de tha dad pa'i 'du shes gang las sems mi mnyam par gnas par 'gyur ba'i tha dad pa'i 'du shes de bzhin gshegs pa la med de /
translated: the Tathāgata has no notion of a difference that would cause the mind to be uneven.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: nam mkha' bzhin du zhing mi zad pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa la zhing tha dad pa'i 'du shes med do //
analyzed: nam mkha' bzhin du zhing mi zad pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa la zhing tha dad pa'i 'du shes med do //
translated: The Tathāgata has no notion of a difference of realm, because the realm is inexhaustible like space.

original: rang bzhin gyis tha dad pa med pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa la sems can tha dad pa'i 'du shes med do //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis tha dad pa med pa'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa la sems can tha dad pa'i 'du shes med do //
translated: Because they are not different by nature, the Tathāgata has no notion of sentient beings as different.

original: chos kyi dbyings dbyer med cing mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa la sangs rgyas kyi zhing tha dad pa'i 'du shes med do //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings dbyer med cing mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes kyi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa la sangs rgyas kyi zhing tha dad pa'i 'du shes med do //
translated: Because of the wisdom of the indivisible and uniform ultimate realm, the Tathāgata has no notion of the buddhafields as different.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i chos nyid kyi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa la chos tha dad pa'i 'du shes med do //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i chos nyid kyi phyir de bzhin gshegs pa la chos tha dad pa'i 'du shes med do //
translated: Because of the nature of being free from attachment, the Tathāgata has no notion of phenomena as different.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa ni /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa ni /
translated: The Tathāgata

original: tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i sems can la yang rjes su chags pa med /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang ldan pa'i sems can la yang rjes su chags pa med /
translated: is not attached to sentient beings who have moral discipline,

original: tshul khrims 'chal ba la yang khong khro ba med /
analyzed: tshul khrims 'chal ba la yang khong khro ba med /
translated: and is not averse to those with faulty discipline.

original: phan par gyur pa la yang lan du phan 'dogs pa med /
analyzed: phan par gyur pa la yang lan du phan 'dogs pa med /
translated: He does not reciprocate help with help,

original: gnod @129a *// par gyur pa la yang gnod par byed pa med /
analyzed: gnod @129a *// par gyur pa la yang gnod par byed pa med /
translated: and does not reciprocate harm with harm.

original: 'dul bar 'os pa la yang mnyam pa nyid du ma yin /
analyzed: 'dul bar 'os pa la yang mnyam pa nyid du ma yin /
translated: He is not even-minded toward those who are suitable to be disciplined,🔽and is not uneven toward those who are not suitable to be disciplined.

original: log par nges pa'i sems can la yang smod pa ma yin gyi; de bzhin gshegs pa ni /
analyzed: log par nges pa'i sems can la yang smod pa ma yin gyi; de bzhin gshegs pa ni /
translated: The Tathāgata

original: chos thams cad la mnyam par gnas te /
analyzed: chos thams cad la mnyam par gnas te /
translated: is impartial toward all phenomena.

original: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa la tha dad pa'i 'du shes med ces bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir de bzhin gshegs pa la tha dad pa'i 'du shes med ces bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is said that the Tathāgata has no conception of distinctions.

original: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa la tha dad pa'i 'du shes med pa de ltar sems can thams cad kyi tha dad pa'i 'du shes spang ba'i phyir chos ston te /
analyzed: ji ltar de bzhin gshegs pa la tha dad pa'i 'du shes med pa de ltar sems can thams cad kyi tha dad pa'i 'du shes spang ba'i phyir chos ston te /
translated: Just as the Tathāgata has no conception of distinctions, in the same way he teaches the Dharma in order to eliminate the conception of distinctions in all sentient beings.

original: 'di ni / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa lnga pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni / de bzhin gshegs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi chos ma 'dres pa lnga pa'o //
translated: This is the fifth of the qualities unique to the Buddha.

original: gzhan yang sh'a ri'i bu /
